This controller sits comfortable in the hands for extended periods and the buttons are easy and comfortable to press.UPDATE: After a year of casual use the left joystick drifts downwards frequently. When I am trying to walk forwards in many games my character randomly stops in place or even walks backwards. I had some drift with the joy-cons after a couple of months, but I ignored it since I just used this controller instead after I got it. I was very happy with this controller at first, but honestly if I have to replace my controller every year it's not worth it. I'll just be getting cheap knock-offs with a similar style or moving back to Xbox or something. I never had controller problems with Xbox controllers, and I didn't even treat those nicely. It's really a shame, since apart from not doing its job it is a good controller in all other aspects. If it were reliable I would recommend this, but honestly I am embarrassed that I have recommended this to anyone in the past. You're basically buying a 1-year subscription to a functional controller. If you buy this, expect to buy a new one before too long.

in my opinion this is the best Nintendo controller and possibly the best controller in general I have ever used.Pros: Amazing feeling in the hands (never had much fun playing mario kart with a joy cons now I play it as much as possible)

Get the Pro Controller, you won't regret it. Perfect for Splatoon 2, Fortnite and even Zelda.I was unsure when I first got my Switch (at launch) if I should fork out so much extra for the Pro Controller. I'm not a hardcore gamer and thought the Joy-Cons and grip would be enough.... How wrong I was! I've been using the Pro Controller for over a month and I regret I didn't buy it sooner. It feels solid and sturdy. The triggers and buttons have much more feeling than the Joy-Cons. The button layout is very comfortable. But most importantly, the analogue sticks feel (and probably are) more responsive and accurate.

It’s a really nice controller. It feels larger than the joycons with the joycon grip. The buttons on the pro controller feel higher quality and are larger than the joycons which is great for games like Splatoon 2 where the ZL and ZR buttons are used frequently. It takes a while to transition from the joycons to the pro controller if you’re used to the joycons alone, but the pro controller becomes natural to use. I just wish it wasn’t so expensive so I can buy a second pro controller for myself. Other than that, this is a great upgrade from the joycons. It has the same features from the joycons like motion controls, NFC for amiibo, snapshot for photo and video, home button, and rumble. It comes with a charger which you can plug it in to your Nintendo Switch to recharge your pro controller. Overall it’s is a great controller and I hope it’ll last for a very long time.

I originally didn't see much point to buying these, considering the Switch has a built in controller. But after struggling through games like Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild, I finally broke down and purchased this. Wow, I have to say it made quite the difference.Even after a few spills, the controller keeps on functioning (albeit some of the buttons are a bit harder to press now).

A must-have for anyone who intends to seriously play on the Nintendo Switch for hours on end. The joy-cons are an interesting concept and are sometimes fun to use, but ergonomically speaking, they're not the greatest for long gaming sessions. That's where the Pro Controller comes in and saves the day. This is a well-made controller with pretty good haptic feedback. It fits well in the hands, and has good quality buttons and texture. The battery also lasts quite a while, and can be recharged using the included USB-A to USB-C cable, which can be attached to any USB-A port on the Switch's dock, or plugged into an appropriate USB-A wall outlet or adapter.

Fits in your hand way better then the joycons do. An overall good tool to have on hand if you own a Nintendo Switch.For those considering buying this for Smash Ultimate: This controller is a great choice! You can go with either the Gamecube controller or pro controller for this game. I believe that the pro controller does  lose 1 frame with inputs around ~20% of the time. Not even noticeable in normal gameplay, and definitely wouldn't effect any casual smashers! (Google input comparison between the two for better details)

I initially bought this controller to play Zelda Breath of the Wild, MarioKart 8, and Fortnite. It was a huge improvement over using the Joy-Cons because of the great ergonomics and the freedom of motion in the analog sticks. The battery also lasts for a VERY long time. My main initial complaint at that point was that it didn't have a headset jack like Xbox and PS4 controllers have, not a huge deal. However, when I started playing Tetris99, I noticed a new flaw that became infuriating: the d-pad doesn't work well. When you push left or right, sometimes it pushes up or down too. In Tetris99, that means you're accidentally doing to do a "hard drop" when you intend to rotate the piece. I stopped using the pro controller with Tetris99 because I was so frustrated with it. Given the price of the controller, I would think that the d-pad would be better.

As much as I love my Switch, it is hard to use the controllers while attached to the system. I bought this because I miss the feeling of a full size controller. It was easy to set up and I have not noticed any lag between the controller and the system. This has an amazing battery life as well. I was shocked that I charged it once and then was able to use it all week with about an hour average per play. The battery was still strong every time that I picked this up to play some games. Extra bonus is that the power cord that comes with this controller will also charge the Switch. That is a huge plus for me because it means having to carry less charging cords when I am on the go.

Obviously it works with a Switch. But it also works with Steam, over regular bluetooth. Steam even lets you swap the a/b and x/y buttons to make it like *every other controller* where the bottom button is yes and the right button is no. Not only that, it works with Steam Link on android, which passes the full controls through, meaning you don't need any special configuration on the Android side, the Steam configs work just like they do when you connect it directly. I'm super happy with this setup, it lets me have one controller for all my games, no matter what I'm playing them on.

The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is a game changer (pun intended). I first thought that I loved the Joy Con controllers included with the console more than anything. It wasn't until I got the pro controller as a gift that I found out what I was missing. I fee like I have way more control over my games with the pro controller as opposed to the very small joy con controllers. The battery life on this thing is outstanding. I can play 3-4 game sessions of 4-5 hours each before ever getting a low battery notification, and they charge quickly. If you have not given the pro controller a shot because the price tag being almost as much as a game, I totally get it. I would much rather have a new game over a controller too! Once you have a few games that you play consistently this comes worth getting for sure.

Feels like a quality piece of Nintendo peripheral out of the box.  Links up to the Switch with no issues, with no noticeable intermittency during use in my experience.  The Sony Dual Shock 4 has been my favorite gamepad for a long time, but I'd say this beats it out by a small margin.  The layout is great, and all the buttons and sticks feel very tactile with just the right amount of stiffness.  The rumble that we expect from Nintendo controllers is back as well, and then some.  As for the negatives, in my opinion, the cosmetic design is pretty ugly; it doesn't look like a consumer ready product, and appears more industrial.  But being a "pro" controller [whatever that means], maybe this was the marketing intent.  Additionally, for those Steam users out there, apparently Steam is working on native support for this gamepad, so there is some added value in that respect (hopefully Nintendo doesn't get in the way with that...you know how they are).

I've had both one of my joycons and now my pro controller both experiences drift and make basically all games unplayable! It's mind-blowing that Nintendo would apologize for joycon drift in their controllers but also say its not a problem! it's a very big problem when my controller is stuck in the down position!

Before I got the Switch Pro Controller, the Xbox One controller was my favorite. It has a great ergonomic design, nice feeling sticks, and a good weight. I pretty much thought that it was the perfect design for a controller.After I got the Pro Controller though, my opinions changed.

Purchased this controller for my husband about 8 months ago. He was really into smash bro’s and BOTW at the time and his hands were getting fatigued from using the joycons. He absolutely loved the gift and uses it every time he decides to play. As an added bonus, I was able to reap the benefits from this controller when AC New Horizons came out. Overall, the quality of this controller is great and it is just as nice now as it was  pre 2000 hours of play time. I would 100% recommend a pro controller to anyone that has a switch.

This is a nice controller to use with your Switch, but also with a gaming PC.I have it paired currently with my MacBook when I want to stream games to it. The controller is super-easy to pair, and even reports battery status when connected. I love that it uses a USB C port because I can actually use my MacBook's Apple charging cord + brick to charge the controller (just like the Switch itself).

The joy sticks that come with the Switch feel flimsy and are not too ergonomic. They may work well as single controllers, but putting them together into one is not a good feel. I also have to admit, not many games I play (maybe none) work with a single joy con anyway.This feels more like a PS4 controller, which I am more used to. It's expensive, rarely goes on sale, but it is the real thing, not a knock-off like some of the others. I have a third controller for the times when three of us want to play, but I probably should have just got another genuine Pro controller.

While a bit expensive, this is the nicest controller I have ever owned. The build quality is excellent, and thank goodness Nintendo didn't cheap out and put a stupid micro USB port on this controller. I am really happy I pulled the trigger on this instead of getting a cheaper alternative. While the joycon grip is ok, I think it's worth it to spend $65 to buy this. It comes with a 6 foot USB C to USB A cable so you can charge it with the switch dock. The HD rumble is awesome and so are the motion controls. It has NFC too for amibo but do people even use that feature? So there is lots of tech packed into this hardware and I believe it justifies it's price tag.

UPDATE: I reached out and was able to send my controller in for repairs. The controller works fine now, but I had to wait almost a month to get it back, so I bumped rating up to 4 stars. But when the controller works it is very good.Original Review:

As many other 1-star reviews have stated, the left stick degrades and starts to drift after a couple months of play (conveniently just outside of Nintendo's ludicrous 90 day warranty period). The running theory is that bits of plastic from the stick rub off into a white dust and then gets stuck inside, interfering with the sensors. I usually don't recommend off-brand controllers, but when you're spending twice the price on something that'll be worthless in a couple months, how can you not go with the competition instead?

Great controller. I opted to get this version over the black pro controller and it paid off. It was more expensive, but luckily I was able to grab it at retail price on Amazon (that one day they actually had it available) than the jacked up ones you see everywhere now.Feels very high quality, all tight, nothing loose whatsoever. I can’t imagine ever playing the Switch without this now. Only downside is the pink color, but eh...nothing wrong with a little standout color here and there.

I really want to like this controller.The good: feels very solid, is comfortable to hold, and battery life is outstanding.  No issues with wireless connection to console (though I usually play wired anyway).
The pro controller is a fantastic peripheral for the Switch; many pros just a few cons.Pros

The controller is great. The size and position of the buttons feels natural. It also has the capability of motion controls and amiibo support. However, the d-pad is really lacking on this controller. It's so lacking that I feel like it deducts 2 stars all on it's own. The reason the d-pad is so bad is that it will completely mess up your button presses. It's not uncommon to push left on the d-pad but have it register as up. This happens with all the directions. If Nintendo fixed the d-pad, this would be the best controller of all time.

I played a lot of video games growing up and held a lot of controllers throughout my life. This is a quality built controller that is very comfortable in your hand. I've held both the Xbox cotnroller nad Ps4 controller before and none felt as good as this controller. So for comfortability, this controller is a win in my book.The battery life is great and last over 30 hours according to the instruction manual.I haven't used it that long to test it out but so far, it never ran out on me. This came with a USB-c charger that can be plugged into the switch dock so it's convenience.
The cost of this controller is pretty hard to swallow, but I think it’s necessary for any Switch owners who play shooters.Pros:

I really like these controllers. I prefer them over the Joycons. One warning is that they have a known issue. The joysticks will create dust when you use them, and this dust eventually causes drifting. Mine lasted for over a year with so many hours of gameplay I can't really complain, but I also made sure to keep the dust from getting into the controller. I have heard that some people's controllers start drifting in as little as a month. You can also choose to get metal joysticks, which are easy enough to install. This will prevent the dust issue entirely. I give this product 5 stars based on my personal experience.

This thing is very comfortable. It feels great in my hands, is nice and weighty, and I appreciate the larger buttons. Analog sticks are bigger and longer than the joycons, which makes movement and aiming much more precise. So far, the wireless signal has been flawless, and the battery life is great (at least 30 hours).The one and only downside to this controller is the D-Pad. It's too sensitive. For example, when you press "right", it often activates the up or down directions as well. It makes 2D platformers a bit of a pain, and Tetris 99 is nearly impossible with this D-Pad. If it weren't for this problem, it would be a perfect controller.

I have had the Switch for a year now, and the whole time I have been using the Joy-Con controllers in the grip, as I was surprised with how comfortable they were, even with my fairly large hands. I got the pro controller after my girlfriend moved in with me so we could play together more comfortably rather than using one Joy-Con each.I always thought the pro controller looked meh, as if the build quality would be distinctly average, but I was definitely wrong about that. It is exceedingly comfortable, and I mean the most comfortable controller I have ever used. It is as if Nintendo just decided to make the most ergonomic and functional controller they could, and they did just that. It does not look super flashy, but it is a damn fine controller. The buttons are big and comfortable, the controller sits nicely in the hand, the triggers are designed really well so they feel great and are natural to rest your fingers on.

Like other users, I’ve experienced issues with the left control stick. The first instance was with stick drift. I was surprised to have this issue because of the price. Luckily, the controller was under warranty. Nintendo repaired and sent it back at no cost to me.After a few more months of use the problem has returned. When I push the stick up, it comes back. Annoying when you’re tying to make a character run forward and they start walking. Again, my controller is under warranty so I sent it to Nintendo and they’re fixing it again.

An absolutely comfortable controller, one of the most so from Nintendo that I've used. I have normal sized hands but cannot stand how small the joycons are even attached to the holder. Has a great weight to it, D-pad is well made especially when compared to the joycon option. I especially like the feel of the ZL,ZR buttons, they fit the contour of where your fingers would be perfectly. It's a must for a second controller if needed, but it is my go to pad for playing everything, notably Smash Bros. Ultimate where a normal sized controller is more suited for. I find the joycons to feel extremely cheaply made, also evidenced by the rubber tops coming off after only a few months. Battery life is quite good on it as well, I really have nothing bad to say about it.

The Switch Pro controller is an amalgamation of designs such as the Xbox 360 controller and the Dualshock 2. Having an outer ring, the analog sticks feel similar to the Dualshock 4's as well. The buttons are flat, as opposed to the convex buttons on microsoft controllers, which makes this more comfortable for me to press repeatedly. The back buttons are digital instead of triggers, which makes it more suitable to instant actions. I think this is the ideal controller for Bayonetta, and games like it.The D-Pad is outstanding given how generic in application this controller is. It is very slightly elevated in the center, meaning the hat switch is easy to rock back and forth. It doesn't hurt my thumb very much compared to a lot of previous Nintendo designs, but you may develop a callus if playing fighting games frequently.

My son was complaining about joy-con drift with his first generation Switch. I purchased two of these. So far, so good.They were packaged nicely and arrived quickly. Also, these are easier for adults to use versus the joy-cons, which are pretty small. They are rechargeable, which is nice (no more messing with replacement batteries and battery acid like our old wii controllers). They are also really well constructed and appear durable. Hopefully they will last a while because at $60 each, they are not inexpensive.

This is a very good controller. Easily tied with the Xbox 360 controller for my personal favorite. The analog sticks are excellent, responsive, but soft. This results in an extremely smooth feeling actuation, which is a common theme for this controller. All the buttons are nice and soft, but firm. Tactility is on point. The controller itself is also a good size for my large hands. USB-C is much appreciated.My one criticism is the translucent plastic used for the faceplate. I get the aesthetic they were going for, but it just reminds me of the dreadful electronic shells of the early 2000s.

This controller was a hard sell for me at the price, but especially now that Steam has beta compatibility with this controller, this is my absolute favorite controller to use anytime I need one. The only downside is the reversed Nintendo buttons, which causes tooltips to be backwards after you change the controls to a more American layout. This doesn't seem like it would be an issue, since you don't usually look at tooltips when you know how to play a game, but it manages to have a subconscious influence that leaves me often pressing the wrong buttons for certain games. Steam also has support for the gyro controls, though I cannot vouch for the feature myself.As an aside, if you play Splatoon 2, this controller is the absolute best way to play. Very comfortable for other switch games too, even Super Mario Odyssey, which rewards playing with detached joycons.

This controller is the best you'll get for a switch. It feels very nice in your hand, and looks pretty decent too. I think the buttons are responsive, the sticks feel comparable to the other two big guy's controllers. I wish the console supported analog triggers but for digital triggers these are fine. I prefer the batteries be rechargeable (which these are) as long as they don't lose their ability to hold their charge anytime soon, but so far so good. I wish it were slightly cheaper, but you'll prefer this to the joy cons for sure.
Overall I am very happy with this controller.  The key benefits are as follows:-Top of the line build quality

I can't play my Switch without it. With the Switch undocked and the JoyCons locked in place it's bearable, but anytime I have my Switch docked and am using a TV I can't bear with the strange placement for the joysticks.If you're used to a DualShock controller from the PlayStation line-up then this is a MUST for you. Unless you own and constantly use a 3DS and a PS Vita you won't find the JoyCons very comfortable.
I'm kinda mad at myself for not buying this before playing through Zelda: Breath of the Wild.This is an absolute must-have for the Switch.
Original product, working perfectly!Much better to play certain games with this controller than using the Joy Con.

I loved this controller. It was great for about 2 straight years. I probably put in close to 300 hours on it playing on the switch. The battery life is longer than other controllers and ergonomically fits in my hands well. Nintendo is notorious for having controllers with drift issues, I didnt believe this applied to their pro controller but it does. It WILL eventually wear down and youll have to get a new controller. Granted I put in a lot of hours, i had to dock a star for the drift.

I am so happy I purchased this product, wish I bought this sooner. Nice and sturdy, the wireless play makes it worth every penny. Highly recommended for gamers. Easy to connect and the battery lasts for a good amount of time and charges very quickly.

I have to give a two star not for this product. But for the joy-cons controller from Nintendo. The left Joy-cons are always easy to become uncontrollable after about 100h usage which is in really poor quality. I think this is the way which nintendo promotes us to buy this pro controller. Actually this pro controller has much better perfermance. But it is not easy to carry away as nintendo switch is easy-carried on game consellors. Hope nintendo can improve this problem in the furture.

The pro controller stops working after about 5-6 months of playing smash. Nintendo has really dropped the ball with their controllers on the switch. Had my mom mail me my old gamecube controllers and console. It's really ridiculous that 10+ year controllers work better than these cheaply made pieces of garbage. Don't get me started on the joy cons. Those are even worse

It takes a while to get used to this controller for me. I was using the joy-cons for a long time when I transitioned to this controller. I felt like the buttons were too "gummy" but it's actually a good thing once I got used to it. It is perfect for those long gaming sessions. It just feels better. You need to try it to understand the difference in "feel". I got these on sale, I think. I'm kind of a cheap-o so I probably wouldn't get these full price...yet I still use it every time I play on my switch. Go get it if you can get a decent discount. It's nintendo so I guess any discount is a decent one.

Bought from Amazon warehouse so the product was preopened and missing the data cable, in exchange for 10% off an already reduced price (under 50 w/tax)Appeared to be a fake at first glance (semi-transparent casing, not entirely see through like my legit pro controller), but the battery inside appeared to be the same, the buttons, sticks, and triggers worked properly, the plus and minus weren't sticking out any further, and the HD rumble was working perfectly (tested with Kirby Star Allies), and it even had the secret message under the stick ("THx2ALLGAMEFANS!)

I have two Pro controllers bought at separate times.  One started disconnecting and reconnecting rapidly, then would lock up and become unresponsive.  It would not shut off (even if forced) until the battery ran out.  Updated firmware, re-sync'd it, did everything the Nintendo support said to do, nothing worked.  They will not exchange, they will just try and repair it for $30 plus shipping for each controller.  So far every controller i have bought for the switch has failed.  Nintendo can't make reliable controllers.

This is quite possibly the best controller on the planet. Even better than the good ol xbox360 controller. It's rechargeable (Type C USB), long battery life, HD Vibration which feels really good and adds a lot to games. Very good D-Pad and it's built really good. Pay the extra money and get what will last you a LONG time. Oh, and there is NO drift. If Nintendo only made their joycons this good.

You cannot go wrong with this controller. It is the best controller to use when playing games on your Nintendo Switch on the Television. The joycons in the joycon grip is just a bit too tiny and cramped for my fingers to play games like Smash bros and Hyrule Warriors. This controller is great and extremely comfortable. I dare say its the best Nintendo controller made, next to the Gamecube Controller of course which is the best controller ever. I highly recommend buying this! It may be a bit expensive but it is a must!!

I really like this controller. I found myself using my switch in dock mode a deal more than expected and ended up getting this because the joycons get uncomfortable after a while. This is a little pricey but you really are getting your money's worth. It's very well made and feels very sturdy, so do all the buttons and sticks. It also had the wireless and rumble functionality just like the joycon, something a lot of the 3rd part controllers lack.It also just feels really nice and I can play comfortably for a long time with it. The battery life is amazing, I've had it for a few months now and charged it maybe 3 times after the initial charge.

Controllers made by the manufacturer of the game systems tend to be the best and that is true in this case.If you want to spring for the real deal, this is it.  I have not tried any of the off-brand controllers in the past but I have with other consoles and its always the same thing, they do not last and they are not accurate.

Got this with promo which is 59 before tax. I just feel that price and the quality doesn’t match. In other words, this controller should not be this expensive. Well it’s bit heavy for my wrist to hold it. The controller needs to redesign to make it more comfortable. Well now my sibling is using it since he likes it. This product is depends on your hand size and how you feel once you play it for a while.

We were going to purchase a set of joy-cons until we read up on this. So glad we went with a pro controller than another set of joy-cons! It's extremely comfortable in hand, the design is basically just like an xbox controller which we love. My only gripe about it is the home, plus, minus & select buttons in the center are very poorly placed & could stick up a bit more too. I find that when I go to hit the plus I hit home by accident. Just a small thing but annoying nonetheless. Either way, I do recommend this controller though, it's a great addition!

I understand some people are having issues with the controller drift problem, but I haven't seen or occurred those problems on my device. It feels great in the hand and all the controls are very easy to use. Battery life has been very good, and I have also been able to use it on some compatible PC games. Been using it for about a month and it definitely improves the gaming experience. I hope the device continues to work properly and I will update this review if anything occurs later on.
First of all, I'll have to admit that, although this is a good controller, it's still a bit too expensive compared to what other competitors such as Sony and Microsoft offer.Pros:
Stopped working after 3 months - ironnically after the warrenty expires. Do NOT buy this controller because it will not last. Very disappointed because it was rather expensive.

I purchased two controllers a few months ago and just got around to opening the second controller. The left control stick has a permanent drift so my characters are constantly moving, cars always drift to the left, etc.Unfortunately I didn't notice this until after my return window, so I'm stuck with it. Amazon linked me to some guides to disassemble my controller, so I guess that's my next step. I would be wary in purchasing these controllers - at the very least, make sure to test them right away!

Probably the best-feeling controller I’ve ever used. It’s got a nice heft, the rubberized grips feel good, the sticks and buttons all have very satisfying feedback, and best of all I can use it to turn on my Switch. About the only issue I have with it is that since the D-Pad is so close to the left analog stick and the - and + buttons are in a slickly different position and not raised, it’s a pretty big adjustment from using the Switch’s Joy-Cons in Breath of the Wild. I find myself having to think before and while I’m trying to use those buttons.

The controller itself is great, no issues there.  However, I don't know at what point the USB-C cable that came included stopped working. There's numerous reports of the Switch and this controller NEEDING the official Nintendo cable to charge. Well, after only using this cable for a few weeks, it suddenly stopped working. I don't even know at what point this happened because I had not played my Switch in a while.TL;DR:

One thing that held me up from playing our Switch were the terrible controllers that come with it.  For my large hands, they are impossible to use singly, and even when mounted together, the spacing is way off and strange.  With Smash Brothers Ultimate being released in December, these controllers were a necessity. They fit the hands nicely, they are well built, and I feel like I have finer control over any game I play.  Docked one star for the cost. Seriously, Nintendo?  Drop $20 off the cost and I'd give five stars.  One nice feature is that they can be charged with a common USB-C cable, meaning that we no longer have to spend money on proprietary power supplies.

Everything about this controller is a huge improvement over the standard Joy-Cons that come with the Switch.  The controller has a nice heft to it and fits larger hands a lot better than the standard Joy-Cons.  My hands don't cramp up using this controller like they did with the other ones.  It feels very well made.The analog sticks have a better feel to them with greater resistance than the standard Joy-Con.  The buttons are larger and firmer.  The vibration feedback is improved as well.  Battery life is great too.
OK I like the controller...did not like the price but that's my bad for choosing to pay that much.I was buying the switch for my husbands 61st Birthday. He never asks for anything for his self.

Slightly expensive considering most PS4 and Xbox 1 controllers are 45 to 50 but it’s better than third party options. Solid option if you’re a solo gamer and like the traditional wireless controller feel. Here’s the build/design:• vibration mechanism like Xbox 1 with single unit in the middle

The control feels great in hand, one of the best feeling controllers. My trouble with it is that on certain games the left Joystick gets stuck and on some games it doesn't. Also the chip reader is not sensitive and can really struggle to read amiibos. If this controller was $30-40 i would still give it 5 stars, but because its $65+, it definitely takes away some of the luster of the controller.

Performs at least as well as the joycons in every way. More comfortable than the joycon mold thing. Face buttons feel good, not my favorite but at least as good as joycons' buttons for most purposes. R/L and ZR/ZL feel extremely smooth, the best bumper and triggers of any controller imo. The joysticks are the smoothest I've ever used, like butter. The sensor doesn't seem to function any differently from the joycon's, but most people seem to prefer aiming in Splatoon with this and I agree. It might just be that the sensor is coming from the center rather than the right joycon. Could also just be the familiarity of holding a more traditional controller making the gyro aiming feel more natural. Either way, I prefer it.

I love the feel of this controller. The placement of the buttons - the quality. i've had mine almost a year and I'e had no issues with it. I am a little bummed that I read that the latency is behind the wired gamecube controller. Even when u connect the controller to the switch via a wire it is still behind the gamecube, which doesn't make sense.  Luckily this only matters for competitive fighting games, so unless you're planning on bringing your controller to competitive tournaments, you're good.  Every switch owner needs this controller.

The Nintendo Switch has quickly become my favorite of the current generation of game consoles. It has such a Nintendo charm to it, that keeps bringing me back for more.That being said, the Switch has one pretty big drawback; Scratch that, two significant drawbacks. Joy-cons one and two.
The price was indeed painful, but for what it is I think it's worth it.Here is why I think so:

The quality of the Nintendo controller outweighs it’s third-party options. It is very responsive and durable. I love the rumble it provides while playing games. You can also use a Amibos with it. It is definitely worth the money. I have had it for over a year and a half and I have no complaints.

I do not like the standard JoyCon controllers with the Switch.  I knew I was going to invest a bunch of hours into Breath of the Wild, so it seemed a no brainer to get a controller that fit my hands better.  It seemed better to go with the name brand in this case and this controller has been worth every penny!  The range is decent, the controller is holding up well, and the fit is perfect!
Update:After a few more hours with the d pad jamming, it cleared up.  Controller has run well for several weeks now.

It has a nice, ergonomic feel. My middle, ring, and pinky fingers feel right at home wrapped around the grips, unlike many other controllers for the console.Great stick height and nice buttons, but I wish they were in more of a diamond arrangement, instead of a rhombus.

I was going to get an officially licensed PowerA pro controller for like half the price but decided on the real deal.  This controller is solid, has a nice weight, and the battery lasts for a long time between charges.  The Power A ones have Nintendo's blessing but you lose rumble and the NFC reader.  I'm not super worried about those features but I didn't want to need them in the future and come up short.  If I buy a 2nd controller I probably will get the licensed aftermarket one and not spend as much as this thing (which is a little absurd for a controller).

The product arrived in perfect condition. After using a switch for a few years the joycons controller grip that comes with the switch started to grow more and more uncomfortable. I had gotten a couple of switch controllers but you really cant beat this. This controller has all of the fucntions, aside from being able to split in half, and feels like a normal controller. Feels great and works great and this is a must have for any switch owner. The mailing process was great and the product works great.

They are a little too small for my hands, and I am not a "big" guy at 5'8" - if my height is any indication of my hand size.  The 2 small controllers that come with the system when put into the holster to create a pro style controller really does have the best, most comfortable, feel to me but those controllers always lag and have problems.  These at least work consistently.  Thank you nintendo for the imperfect system controllers and essentially forcing me to use these less than ideal controllers instead.

Quality controller! Good weight in the hand and much more crisp and responsive than the joy con controllers. There are 4 LEDs that indicate controller order (multiplayer games), that also flash when the battery runs low. Recharges via usb-C.

The Switch Pro controller is an amazing controller. I like everything about it, from the buttons to the analogue sticks. The HD rumble is great, and it's just the right size for my hands. And don't even get me started on the battery life. This thing's battery lasts so long that I often forget it even needs to be charged every once in a while.But I can't give it a full five stars. Reason being that the point where the analogue stick makes contact with the edges of the controller cause some serious abrasion. This has happened to both my pro controllers, and gives the analogue stick endpoints a slight grindy-ness for lack of a better term. It probably won't do anything serious to the controller's longevity, but it makes it lose its "premium" feel after about ten hours of use.

Im a xbox gamer mostly, but i do love nintendo. Once i put the controller in my hands, it just melt into my hands, really comfortable. And the controller is way better than the joycon grips. Since i use xbox controllers, it was natural to me. My second favorite controller, my favorite is still the xbox one controller. Is it exspensive yes, is it worth it yes. Overall if you use xbox controllers than i recommend this bad boy.

the design of the controller is good, it fits well in my hands and it feels good to use. Until it drifts, i've only used it for about 6 hours and now the left joystick drifts and it makes playing games difficult i thought these issues were sorted out but apparently they haven't been, if you're lucky enough to get one that works then id say its worth the purchase however i cant recommend spending the money for one, don't buy it, just get replacement joy cons and save your money on something that may or may not work.

i'm very impressed by this! it simply feels excellent to use. the joysticks are very smooth!  usb-c charging is very nice as welli have tried to use this on my pc as well, and it works excellently for that. in steam there is a setting you can enable to change the button layout to mimic a standard xbox 360 controller type layout, instead of the Nintendo button layout, and that makes it feel right for gaming on the pc.

Must have for any Switch owner who spends a decent time having it docked and playing on your TV. it really is up there with the other console controllers and probably even better than the PS4 and Xbox One controller. it just has a great feel to it. Maybe it's the size of my hands, but it just feels right. The D-pad had issues on earlier models and I know this is a revised version, but I haven't noticed the issue anymore. A lot of my games dont require much use from them, so I havent been able to fully test it either.

The weight is good.  I wish the left-side thumb control and direction pad were reversed but all the other brands I tried which are reversed feel too light and cheap.The Nintendo controller is overpriced compared to the other options (I have tried four other controllers) but this is the one I return to because of the feel.  I am not really satisfied with any of them because all of them angle my hands wrong so that my thumb is not really aligned with the sticks and pads as would be more natural.  This one, though, is the least awkward and most usable for me.
This is a really well built controller! I'll get right to the point about what I enjoy about this:* joysticks play really nicely, very smooth and accurate

One of the most comfortable controllers I have ever used. It's size is roughly akin to that of an xbox one controller, but without the grooves, which works in its favor. I love the bigger size of the face buttons (XYAB), which i was originally skeptical about. It makes moving your thumb from the right stick very easy and fluid. The actual d-pad is a massive improvement over the joy-con controllers. The bumpers and triggers (L R and ZL ZR) are more or less 1:1 with the joy-cons. It did take me a small amount of time to get used to the position of the +. -, home and share buttons, but it hardly drew away from the overall controller experience. Additionally, you can use this controller for PC gaming via bluetooth if your computer supports it or a micro-usb cable, though you will need the proper drivers (which can be easily found online.).
Amazing battery life comfort and familiarity.The first time i took it out of the package and held it i naturally gripped it and it felt great.

I was hesitant to get the pro controller since I have (2) Joy-con. I got to say this is one of the best controllers I ever owned, I would say is even better than the XBOX One controller. The size, grip weight, standard vibration plus accelerometer its all in one package. But surpassingly one of the things I love must is the buttons and analog joy sticks, they feel right, and right size. You need to have one of these to understand, its like playing with nintendo buttons quality (NES/SNES) but in a pro version.

I love this controller. The weight is good, controls are good, etc., but no matter what, the portion your hand actually grips, is always sticky. It's weird and it's because the grip portion is not made of the same material as the rest of it, and whatever they used is purposely sticky as in it makes you feel like your hands are dirty and sweaty even when they're dry and powdered. Not worth the money to be this uncomfortable.

Synced the gamepad with my Switch and immediately discovered the four shoulder buttons didn't work. There really isn't much else to say, it was defective directly out of the box.Nintendo products used to be better than this.

Although I think the portable on the go table is cool, I'll always prefer a standard in hand controller. I've played Zelda BOTW, Mario Odyssey, and Bayonetta with this controller and it's fantastic. Feels great in the hand, buttons have just the right amount of clicky-ness, not to mention one of the longest battery lives I have ever seen on a controller. I've gone days, if not weeks, completely forgetting I even had to charge this thing at all. Other then the price if you own a switch and plan on playing a lot, this is a must. If you can find it on sale, even better.

Let me start by saying that this is a great controller!  The fit, the feel, the overall quality...they're all top-notch!  But you know that a LARGE company like NINTENDO could do well by pricing their controllers somewhere closer in price to what the little, unknown companies can, even with the superior craftsmanship taken into account.  Either way, Nintendo has us coming and going and that's just all there is to it!

I found the undersize joy con controllers to be a bit small for my big hands.  So using the Switch Pro Controller took care of that issue easily. The controller itself is solidly built and holds a charge for a super long time. It feels good with all the controls in the right spot.  Bottom line: This controller is an amazing piece of hardware of superb quality and fantastic tactile feedback. It is, however, simply too expensive, hence 4 stars vice 5.

This is a great controller! I've noticed it's much easier on your hands then joy con controllers. I don't know about quality yet, but we have had bad luck with our joy con controllers. The joy cons we have purchased seem very low quality. The knobs are glitchy and get stuck in forward and they do not want to connect with the switch sometimes. This controller seems to be working great so far. I will update if anything changes, though.

I was tired of taking the joy cons on and off to play games on my TV when the Switch is docked. This wireless controller is perfect for having a "normal" game experience with your Switch! The controller reminds me of an Xbox controller, so it wasn't hard to work it.You charge the controller through a USB cord you can connect to your Switch dock. The charge last a long time on the controller, at least for me it hasn't ran out yet haha! But I also replug it often so maybe that's why.

This controller is pretty good for people wanting an improvement over the Joy-Cons that come with the console. It has almost all of the features the Joy-Cons had (there's no IR sensor), it feels pretty good (doesn't feel cheap at all!), and it has a great battery life. Compared to the Switch's included Joy-Cons, this controller is larger and has a directional pad. Overall, it's a very fantastic controller.However, if you're buying more than one, the price adds up rather dramatically, as they cost $60-$70 each. If you want a cheaper (but still great) alternative, PowerA makes Nintendo-certified USB controllers for under half the price, though these do lack motion control and rumble.

Garbage. This has turned me off of the Switch. I bought a Nintendo Switch Pro controller when I originally got my Nintendo Switch. It stopped working within a few months. I thought, okay, maybe I got a shitty controller, it happens. So I buy this one as a replacement on Amazon and it stopped working already! Why can't I get a replacement???? Another trash product from a once great entertainment company. I'm done.

Let's just say that controllers won't be more comfortable than this. It fits right in my hand, and I have the most average hands on earth. I don't have to worry about holding it when gaming, as if the grips were doing the gripping, so I could focus all of my attention to what was happening on screen. I did hope for a little bit more battery life from it, but I guess I'm a bit jaded, since the rivaling consoles' controllers can't hold a life to the switch controller's battery life.

I've been using the joycons until they drifted. I know nintendo can fix but I don't want something that'll just break in a month after using it so I bought the pro controller.I don't know why it took me so long. I love the weight and the feel in my hands 10000x better than the janky little joycons (even in their holder). 400hrs later and still no drifting so I'm sold. If I had to buy it again I would.

I was very surprised that the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller was usable wireless on PC, but once I figured that out it became my primary controller for everything. As an avid PC and console gamer I've used dozens of controllers over the years but have never had one that felt so natural one first picked up. The gyroscopes are an interesting feature and the button placement leads to easy combos. The battery life is fantastic and the sticks move smoothly.

I was hesitant to buy this controller at first because of the high price compared to 3rd party models. But after receiving it I can understand why.  This is a solid controller.  It weighs more than the joy-cons with the adapter which I was surprised about at first.  But then was immediately comfortable with it and appreciated the weight.  It feels great in the hand, controls are where they should be and you can turn off and on the Switch with it.  Battery life lasts forever, and has rumble features built in.  Something which at first I didn't think I'd need but really enjoy.  Its like the Wavebird was for the GCN.  Completely necessary for most games like Zelda, Warframe, Doom.
It works well right out of the box and is not complicated to set up.This part is anecdotal, but I find that the controller rubs my hands the wrong way sometimes, making it occasionally uncomfortable.

I needed a controller as an alternative to my Joy Cons, as I have issues playing certain games with the tiny Joy Cons. The Pro Controller is a great controller, the buttons are big and responsive, it is very easy to connect to other Switch systems, and it's wireless so I can play in any comfortable position. Its battery life is half of most wireless controller from other systems, but I don't personally find it as an issue (you can just connect it though its usb cable and charge it while you play).  A must-have controller if you like to play various games with a standard controller layout or multiplayer titles.

The Wii U Pro controller was trash. This controller had me worried. Now I DO NOT WANT TO GAME WITH OUT IT! I love this controller and I think it rivals the PS4 Sony Controller. I love the PS4 and I've always loved PlayStation controllers, not thinking they could get any better I was wrong, the PS4 controller was revolutionary, but this Switch Pro Controller is a must! Fits into my Switch dedicated bag I bought here on Amazon too, I wrote a review on it explaining everything I can fit into that bag.

If you want to play some serious Zelda, I recommend having this in your hands.  Going into battle with this controller really makes a difference on button control and performance.The only thing that can get irritating is that once in a while during a serious battle, you go into the scope mode.  The joysticks push-down features are pretty easy to engage.

This controller is awesome. Is rechargeable and connects to my switch every-time. I got a lot of game play before I had to recharge the controller. A message will flash on your screen to let you know when it is near end of battery life. The controller is very comfortable to hold and I like it much better than just using the joy-cons by themselves. I know the price could be lower but don't second guess it, it is worth the price and will last for years to come.

As much as I love the joy-cons on the Nintendo Switch I still wanted a conventional controller for playing in docked mode. I was hesitant to dish out the money for a controller that costs the same if not more as a game but took the leap after reading more about it. Do you absolutely have to buy this controller to have an enjoyable experience? No. However, as many have stated you are paying for a quality product that is not only built well but also extremely comfortable! The battery of the controller will last you a very long time. I myself typically don't play more than 2-5 hours at a time due to my hectic schedule but I rarely charge it and I have yet to drain it's battery entirely. If you're on the fence like I was just know that you won't be disappointed with the purchase. A huge thumbs up!

Great looking controller with a nice heavy feel to it that makes it feel more durable in your hands. I didn't find the controller too heavy even after playing with it for hours. There was an adjustment period going from the Joy-Cons to the Pro controller but nothing an hour with the controller wouldn't fix. My only complaint is that the "+" and "-" buttons are square and feel like the home and share button. I wish they went with the design similar to the joy cons where the buttons were actually shaped like a + and -. All and all, a great controller if you are spending hours upon hours on games like Zelda BotW
This controller has a great feel to it.Its lightweight enough that it doesn't strain the wrists or hands and heavy enough that it wont snap after a few tumbles.
Pros:- Connectivity

It worked like a charm for the few days I actually got to use it. The left analog started to drift (sound familiar?) to the left making mariokart impossible. Come on Nintendo. I’ve heard this hundreds and hundreds of times, it’s obviously a problem. How about you fix this please. I can not recommend this controller especially at the price.lesson learned so you don’t have to.

I believe this is an essential to any Switch gamer that spends a lot of time with the console docked. It increases the ease of control that’s otherwise hindering with the small joy cons, and it lets the joy cons charge for later portable use. I find it especially useful for Mario tennis aces, or any game where the right control stick is used. I find myself accidentally bumping it and messing up my game on the joy cons. My only gripe is that the control sticks have a type of rim around them that hurts if you play hard like me. (I actually got a blister on my thumb after only a few hours of play.) Note: I also have a blue cover on my controller and a control stick cover to alleviate the aforementioned issue, and it seems to have worked.

Best Switch Controller, hands down. Pricey, but worth it. Was glad to grab a second one on sale from Amazon because tired of fighting my wife for just the one.  These things rock compared to the cheap feel of the joy cons.
Used this controller for a few hours for Animal Crossing then on the next day, the left joystick had drifting problems. Probably a bad batch, and needs to be returned.**Update**

When you take the NFC, accelerometer, and vibration into account this controller is a steal. However I wish nintendo made a cheaper version without the NFC for the other 3 controllers I would buy for multiplayer. Amibbos are cool but most games don't use them and if I don't own any why would I buy hardware to support them?The accelerometer is amazing in BoTW. Wish we had some real shooters here like cod to really make use of this fine tuning for shooting
This controller is overall highly rated, and with good reason. I'll explain further:Pros:
Buttons stop working properly.  Support articles are unhelpful, and they're rejecting all repair requests

I like everything about the actual use of the controller.. There are 2 big irritating things about it.1. Because the battery is internal.. If it's dead, your out of luck in terms of swapping a battery.

This is a must have if you have a Switch. The controller feels way better than those puny Joycons. It's got a good weight to it and very good quality controller. If you play Splatoon you gotta get this or you cant paint as effectively, resulting in losing all the time. The NFC scanning works great and fast too. Just touch the Amiibo to the center of the controller and it will work some magic.

It's going to take some time to get used to the weight and shoulder buttons on this compared to the Joy Con. The buttons have softer feedback than the very mechanical feeling Joy Cons, and I'm not sure which I prefer. Pairing was quick and painless, very ergonomic, all the added functions, such as motion controls and amiibo reader are all present (I haven't had a good chance to tell if the HD rumble is present, or just a more basic rumble feature). If the battery life is as good on this as it was the Wii U's Pro Controller, then It'll be half a year before I have to give it it's first charge.

This controller is very durable and most importantly comfortable! This is tied with the steam controller for my favorite. It's joysticks have a smooth responsive feel with a great shape and textured grip. The handles feel good even after long play sessions and the buttons have a superior feel and click without being loud like the joy-cons.

The controller is really comfortable. It looked like it would be clunky like an Xbox controller from the pictures, so I was relunctant to buy it at first. I prefer the PS style controller. Someone told me it actually felt different from other controllers. I decided to buy it and I was very happy. I've only played Splatoon with it so far, but it's a lot easier to handle that using the joy con grip that comes with the system.

This is right up there, right above the xbox one controller as the most comfortable ever for me. The triggers have a much nicer pull and click feel to me, though they're more linear than the xbox one. The buttons are all wonderful to feel and the control sticks have a great rubber that offers grip but with no additional texture. It's a bit expensive though, possibly because of the amiibo reader which i think is unnecessary, but if you can get this controller, it's wonderful for the switch. Battery lasts quite a long while and can be used wired if needed

I love this controller, the quality and the battery duration is great. This is a much better option overall than the joy cons. Also to mention that this controller is very comfortable to use, even compared to Xbox One and PS4 controllers. My only complaint is that is a little pricy otherwise is a must for the switch especially for platformer games

As soon as I held the controller in my hands, I could feel the great build quality of it. All buttons feel great and are highly responsive. The analog sticks feel incredibly smooth. Motion controls are responsive. The HD rumble feels nice on the controller. Only the D-pad leaves a bit to be desired, while it feels nice, there are times where it'll read up-left when I was just pressing up, for example. However, it isn't enough to make me regret my purchase.

Be careful when you buy a used one for those who want to go cheaper. I bought a "Like New" one, and it came out of the box barely looking acceptable. The overall quality of the controller was very poor, having scratches and tears everywhere. I tried to overlook that and tried to play it on the switch. Sadly, the right analog stick won't even work. I tried to calibrate it but no success. I'm not sure whether to be upset for the company lying about the status of the controller, or how over-priced these controllers are, leading me to end up wanting to buy a used one.
Me gusta el control es bastante cómodo, tiene buen balance y buen peso, el único defecto es su cruceta no es cómodo

At first, I was a little hesitant to buy the Pro Controller (price, obviously) for my Switch, but I caved and bought it from Amazon anyway. Once I received it, holy cow, I was impressed! The buttons, joysticks, and motions are very responsive. The vibrations from the HD rumble is really detailed, unlike anything I've experienced from my past controllers. The battery lasts a long time, I was playing Mario Kart 8 and Odyssey for a few hours every day for a few weeks before I finally had to recharge it. I cannot give you my answer on the NFC touchpoint, because I don't own an Amiibo, yet. The only issue I have is that Nintendo should make the home and capture buttons stand out a little more, so I don't have to keep looking down at my controller when my thumb couldn't find one of them.If you're looking to buy a regular controller for your Switch, I recommend getting the Pro Controller!

the second I put my hands on it and started using it, it felt amazing. It feels very premium, the buttons, and texture are all very nice to press. I don’t usually obsess over details like that with controllers or devices, like the PS4 controllers feel ok, and the xbox controllers feel ok, but this somehow blew my expectations. Long battery life too. And it’s charged fully right out of the gate.I got this controller because my joycons has drifting issues. For the time being, I’m just gonna put this in a plastic ziploc when I’m not using it. Probably shouldn’t have food all over your hands when you play or leave it in dusty areas.
Good:1. Weighted controller that feels amazing to hold.

This thing is a back saver. I have been playing with my child lately and I hate doing so with those tiny controls. They work fine for kids but for an adult you basically have to fold yourself in half to use one. If you're playing for any longer than 30 minutes your back will be screaming at you. The 40 hour battery life is amazing. This just makes the time I can play with my child that much more enjoyable.

In my opinion, despite its relatively high price for a controller, it's the definitive way to enjoy your Switch on a TV or monitor. For people with big hands, you'll be able to play it perfectly fine and comfortably versus with the awkward positioning of the normal Switch Joycons. This controller is also very rugged, has a reliable battery life, and good connection distance.

Even my tiny lady hands can't take using the Joy-Cons on the straps or on the small controller included with the console for long periods of time without cramping up. 8 hour sessions of Zelda or Xenoblade would get to be pretty brutal without the pro controller. The long battery life is splendid and it feels amazing to not have to stop playing on one of my few free days for a while so my controller charges because I can literally play all damn day without needing to hook up the usb. It's super comfortable, has a nice weight to it, and I love the d-pad on this (all the buttons feel good, but the dpad gets a special mention). It kind of reminds me of the Xbone d-pad, it's quite satisfying and I have a feeling it'd lend itself very well to any future fighters the Switch might get. And yes, it has the fancy rumble just like the joy-cons do and it feels just as nice here.I initially didn't see the need in a separate controller for my Switch, but after my left joy-con started getting the desync issue I finally caved and ordered one. Nintendo was likely to wipe my Switch during the repair and I was not too thrilled at the idea of buying a whole new set of joy-cons. I figured if the left one worked great still attached to the screen when I played it portable, why not just leave the joycons attached 24/7 and just get the Pro and never worry about syncing issues again. I'm very glad that I did because this makes long gaming sessions 10x better.

The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is, putting it conservatively, Nintendo's best controller yet in terms of functionality and comfort. Its understated clear/black finish belies its immensely satisfying buttons, sticks, and D-pad; additionally, button placement feels extremely natural, and the impeccable build quality will ensure that this controller will stand up to many long gaming sessions. Even with motion control, an NFC sensor, and HD Rumble, it lasts an amazing 40 hours on a single charge - half of what the Wii U Pro Controller did, but still more than the DualShock 4 and the Xbox One controller combined. The Pro Controller also works natively on Windows PCs via USB or Bluetooth, and is even compatible with Steam if the user participates in the Steam Client Beta. My only real gripe is that the HD Rumble in this controller isn't quite as pronounced as that in the Joy-Cons, but I chalk that up to the function having to travel through denser plastics, so it's really more of a nitpick than anything. If you have a Switch and want to graduate from the Joy-Con Grip, there is no reason not to own this controller - it earns its keep and then some.

This is a perfect controller if you're planning on long gaming sessions, or if you want to play shooters and more fast-paced games. The sticks are easier to manipulate than on the joycons, giving you better control, and the whole thing feels a bit more comfortable than just holding the two small halves.That said, if you don't feel like you need finer control for your games, the only real benefit over the joycons is battery life. As long as you don't mind putting the controllers back on the Switch after each play session, that's not a huge issue.

I'm one of those people that rarely has time to game on the go. My Switch will be used at home, connected to my tv, 99% of the time. I found the included Joycon controller, to be a little small for my hands, so i bought the Pro. Right off the bat, you notice how much more comfortable it is to hold for extended periods of time, over the joycons. The inclusion of a proper D-Pad, is also a plus, as i found the 4 buttons on the joycon that act as the D-Pad, just felt weird, when i tried to use what should've been a D-Pad. The buttons and thumbsticks, just seem to react better overall. The battery life of the Pro, is really long. Somewhere around 40 hours, off of 1 charge. I only own Zelda BOTW so far, so i can't comment on the rumble feature, as Zelda barely uses it, and i also can't comment on the built in Amiibo scanner, as i have yet to use it, since i don't have any Amiibo. In the end, if you game mostly at home like myself, definitely get yourself the Pro controller, for extended periods of play.

I bought this as a bundle with Zelda. Saved a few bucks but just be cautious with the first gen pro controllers because they have an inaccurate dpad. Check online for the newer model serial number. It's ok though because this is my shell change SNES controller so its imperfect as my daily beater. If you can't live with the dpad being perfect, I suggest going out your way to finding the newer model. If MSRP is already 70 and taking this for 50, that's ok for me but this is a licensed Nintendo's ,"Pro Controller" ; knowing this should be a quality product. That's my two cents.
Bought this end of February and only used a few times and now 10/31/19 it is completely dead!!! Warranty only covers 90 days?? I would stay away.

This controller is really nice. The handles have a nice grip, the buttons are big and clicky, and the joy sticks are well-placed and comfy on my thumbs. The shoulder buttons are fine, but the triggers aren't analog, which I would prefer. The D-Pad could be a bit looser, but it's much improved from when this controller was first produced.I like that it charges with USB-C, and it also works great as a gamepad for PC games. This is one of my favorite controllers. I've enjoyed playing games on my Switch more since picking this up.

Your left stick will go bad with consistent input in one direction (e.g., Splatoon 2 with consistent left-stick-up input). The warranty is short. This is a great device otherwise. It feels good and it works well, until the left stick goes. It seems plausible not all suffer this defect, but tomorrow I will be on my fourth pro controller. When it works I really like it.

This controller is great, just like the Wii U pro controller (would have been great to be able to re-use those!).The battery life and feel of the controller is good, and I would recommend getting this as your 2nd or 3rd switch purchase after a couple of good games. It feels much more precise than using the switch joycons either attached or detached.

I had no problem with the Joycon grip when playing the Switch in docked mode but I was able to get a Pro controller at a great discount so I picked one up. It's a great controller! I've had it for a couple months and I've yet to recharge the battery, very impressive. If you primarily play your Nintendo Switch on TV, I highly recommend getting the Pro Controller.

Feels completely different from the Joycons. Stronger joysticks, buttons, and triggers. Feels like far more is put into controller feel than anything else. Battery lasts pretty long. Almost as long as the Wii U Pro controllers. These feel more hand gripping and slightly higher quality than the Wii U ones. Only thing I can complain about is that I wish that they looked better. I highly suggest this controller if you play a lot of games on your TV and not in portable mode.

Far too breakable. Received this ~2 weeks ago and from 1 or 2 drops at barely any height the left handle is now flimsy and controller is nearly broken. Going to have to buy another because its the only game in town for certain titles, but this is ridiculous for such a high cost product.If it was just deep scratches that would be understandable (even if my Xbox and PS4 controllers don't scratch nor dent so easily).

This controller is amazing. It feels so good in your hands. The battery life on this controller is insane compared to the PS4 controller. This controller lasts like 20+hours of game play on a single charge. One of the reasons why it's so good is because it does not have an annoying big bright light in the back of it to lower the battery charge as quickly *cough* PS4 *cough*....If you want of a more classical feel controller then get this for your Switch. It's the only and BEST option.

It's so much more comfortable in my hand than the joycon is I feel more freedom of movement I have long fingers and when I use the joy con I can almost completely wrap my hand all the way around it and touch my wrist the Pro controller I don't have that problem save up your money and get one you won't be disappointed yeah it's a little on the expensive side but even if you can go to Etsy you can get a 3D printed holder so that you can mount your switch screen on top of the controller. How's that for ease of access lol

I prefer using this over the standard Joycons that come with the Switch. Those are a little too small and unwieldy for my taste. This controller uses a solid design that mimics the Xbox 360. They claim that you will get up to 40 hours of play time from a single charge which I believe since I have never been close to draining it yet.My only real con is the price. I don't know why these need to retail for $70. I think $50 would be a more realistic but I won't fault the controller itself based on the price. Obviously people (myself included) are buying them for this price...

I like buying official Nintendo brand on things. The battery lasts a really long time. Since buying I still haven’t charged it. It does come with a charging wire just plugs into a USB port.  The hand grip is very comfortable for long game time. I am enjoying playing my switch games in a different more comfortable way. I do wish they had different colors to choose from like the joy cons.

D-pad aside, this is the most slick controller ive held in a long time. It's dinput compatible, so it will work with your PC. It also works natively with the steamlink now.Unfortunately, the charge port is only for charging. Most Android flavours have difficulty with it, it will work fine at first but then lag. probably a polling issue. This is almost a non issue aside from a few games that benefit.

Pro Controller is the one to beat. I used to really think the best Nintendo Controller was the GameCube Controller. Well after I bought this one I have my doubts. The grip and the buttons are all solid. The battery last a long time I rarely have to charge it and I would play Zelda BOTW daily. For an adult or just someone with bigger hands I think this is the best way to go rather than using the joy con's as a single controller. I would recommend at least getting one pro controller for your switch.
Not even 15 seconds after I set up the controller did I notice my character start to wander in a downward motion when my thumb wasn’t on the joystick.Update

If you own a Switch this is a MUST HAVE. It is the most comfortable controller I have ever held Nintendo did their home work here think Gamecube controller but even more comfortable. I can't say enough about this just get it.
I love how comfortable this controller is. It feels great.I have yet to run out of battery. I can game all day, and not worry about running low on power.

The feel and durability of the Pro Controller is way better than Joy Cons, and is a must have for playing on the TV. However, after about ~800 hrs of smash and other games, my left joy stick began to drift/picking up bad responses. Sad, because it is an incredibly comfortable controller and I like it way more than the GC controller for Smash.Still better durability than the Joy Cons, but not up to Nintendo's standards as far as older gen controllers (GC controller)
Looks gorgeous! Feels like the regular one just with a design and looking prettier than the regular one. It's worth getting one, or even two.

Waste of money. After a few months of light use, remote toggles go nuts while you’re playing the game. All the sudden they stop working, and you’re spinning all over the screen. Interesting that this product only has a 3 month warranty, hmm, sounds like they don’t even expect them to last and are too cheap to replace them for customers.

We tried an off-brand pro controller at first, to save a few bucks, but received a defective item - lesson learned. Bought the "real" Nintendo branded one, and it's going strong. Seems pretty well made to me (moreso than the joycons that came with the switch - two years with the switch, and I've already replaced the joysticks in the joycons), and the kids like it - although now they fight over who gets to use it, so... you've been warned! :-)

The ergonomics of this controller are some of the best I've ever had for a controller in my life.But the D-pad is nearly worthless. It will randomly trigger the wrong direction, or even trigger other buttons (the L-button in particular). This makes a lot of games unplayable, like Crypt of the Necrodancer or Cadence of Hyrule.

Been gaming all my life, I go through controllers like you wouldn't believe. This is the nicest controller i've ever used on any system. Comfortable design, smooth joysticks, responsive buttons. I just wish I could use this on my PC and playstation. My only complaint is that just like the charger on the switch, it can only be a NINTENDO usb charger. Why the hell make a UNIVERSAL-serial-bus plug that's...not universal?

Excellent controller. I was forced to buy a new controller once the controllers that came with the Switch started ‘drifting’. Once I realized what was happening I started researching new controllers. This one is one of the more expensive models out there, but I wanted to buy a quality controller and not a cheap piece of plastic which is what most after market brands seem to be. I’ve had this for a few months now and no issues. The button layout is similar but slightly different than the stock controllers, it doesn’t take long to get used to, but it is noticeable at first.
It is as I presumed the same pro controller, plus some color. However, the purple looks brighter in the stock photo, it is actually darker and 'burgundy' .

To those of you who have experienced the dreaded joy con drift like me, this is the perfect substitute. I read a suggestion to get the pro controller rather than a new pair of joy cons as it'd be more of a risk of having the same problem. 2 weeks in and no problems. Works well with my fast paced rhythm games and shooters.

The answer is: yes.Super easy to connect. The feel is very nice and I have noticed that my hands don’t cramp from holding it too long. Joysticks and buttons all feel great to use and somewhat reachable. Definitely, might need to practice some new skills with your fingers in speed and positioning.

I noticed the rubber isn't as thick on the switch as the pro controller has. In terms of durability, I'd recommend this over the stock ones that come with the switch. After the first hundred hours, the rubber on the OEM controllers lose their grip alot faster than the pro controller does at the same amount of time. Plus if you have big hands and are a child at heart like me, you'll enjoy the ergonomics Nintendo put into in designing this controller. I like it better than the Xbox One/X controller inuse for my PC.

The controller arrived almost 3 days quicker than anticipated.  Not only that but for a Used Like New it was practically a new controller never opened complete with plastic film over the front display.  I really lucked out getting this considering I have been camping for near a year for the price to drop under $90 thanks to scalpers.The controller itself is very solid and being a Xenoblade fan, I can see myself using this for years to come.

Very ergonomic controller that works incredibly well with the Nintendo Switch! It's great for use at home when your switch is docked or you can take it with you on the go if you have room for it. For any long duration of play, I would 100% recommend using this controller to avoid discomfort from holding the joy-cons for too long.Highly recommend for any serious Switch gamers!

I've used 3rd party ones that haven't worked well, and I've used 3rd party ones that I like better than this.  But this one is still very good.  Connected easily, and the weight of it is nice.  What I don't like is that it seems to have a dead battery every time I go to use it.  I think It is constantly trying to connect even when it isn't in your hands.  It needs to have an off switch or something.

I’m so disappointed with this. It is ridiculous to spend around 70 dollars to buy it, you can buy everywhere cheaper than it. The box came and it broken a little, the surface of controller seems used, it do have some flaws.

So I was lucky enough to pre-order the Nintendo Switch upon initial announcement. I instantly fell in love with it. Loved the versatility of the "pick up and go" concept, the detachment of the controllers to create the Joy Con Grip, the games! I never thought the Pro Controller was necessary because I had everything I needed with the stock Nintendo Switch equipment...I was wrong. The Pro Controller feels great, works amazing, no lag. I wish I would've bought it sooner. Absolute must buy if you have a Switch.
Didnt Nintendo basically set the standard for D-pads with the NES?Well this one is terrible! Avoid If you want to play any games that require a precise d-pad.

100% necessary if you want to enjoy playing with others on the Switch. The small little joycons are great if you're 5yrs old and have tiny muskrat hands, but my 9yr old even found the joycons too tiny and prefers the Pro controller. We ordered two so we don't have to use the tiny ridiculous joycons.

The controller itself is great! But my son went to go charge it for the first time yesterday and the charger is wrong! It doesn't fit the controller! Almost makes me think someone bought this thing, returned it with the wrong charger and then it was shipped to us. I'm so frustrated right now. Moral of the story: Check EVERYTHING when you get it!

This is easily the most comfortable traditional style controller I have tried. But unfortunately it had to go back. I only tried to use it once and the drift was constant, as bad as the worst joycon drift. It made it unplayable. You could not stay still. It seemed like it was packaged weird so maybe it had been returned before.

Build quality and comfort is very good. Not sure I would put the controller above the Xbox One or the PS4, but easily the best Nintendo controller ever made IMO. The sicks are sensitive and very accurate. The buttons are a pleasure to press without the numbing feeling you can get from some of the rounded hard plastic buttons. Price is a little high, so have held my purchase to just one of these. Wish they were less, so I could sport a pair, but they aren't so I wont :(.

Love this thing. Thought I was fine with just the joy cons in the joy con grip but boy howdy was I wrong. This was well worth it for me but I'd recommend the regular version to anyone looking to save a few bucks and get a very similar experience.To anyone curious, this specific version of the pro controller (Xenoblade) has a (possibly intentional) manufacturing difference in the D-pad. The pivot point is slightly longer, allowing for slightly tighter and precise controls, most relevant for fighting games. Its only noticable if you're looking for it.

After going through multiple controllers for the switch, I noticed the 3rd party controller analogs are usually very inaccurate. The joy cons on the other hand are accurate with the analog aiming, yet they were very short and a little too fast for my liking...This controller is exactly what I expected! higher analog and SUPER accurate aiming adjustments. feels similar to the xbox family, just slightly wider. The icing on the cake for me was the fact that the home button boots the console (3rd party controllers dont do this), i love this controller!

The controller is my favorite to use across my switch and PC.
