The price may be a bit expensive, but the fact it is rechargeable and runs for around 50 hrs on a single charge is well worth it in my opinion. The controller has a good weight and feel that I can play for hours whether it be rocket league, or an adventure game such as Zelda: BoTW. Steam works well with it either hard wired connected or via Bluetooth, allowing you to customize every button to be what you wish.It connects and charges via the same usb-c the switch charges with, and includes a usb -> usb-c cable if you would want to charge it off of the switch dock as well.

As many other reviewers stated, the left control stick got very loose in less than a week. We can’t play Mario Kart with it because it’s too hard to control the car. I do like the way the controller feels while playing, but it’s worthless when maneuvering your car or person. Really disappointing. We already got rid of the box, so I guess we wasted a bunch of money.

My family fights over this controller, because we all believe that it's sleek black color reflect the darkness of our souls!  We also like that it is harder to see what each of the buttons are.  Seems a little less bossy than your average "more clearly labeled" controller.  My family would probably be driven to a physical altercation should you remove all decalling completely!  This is a pro controller!  If you don't know what the buttons have been for the last ten years, then you could get a beginner controller!

I really wasn't expecting much out of nintendo but it's probably my favorite controller to use. It's great to lean back and play like a normal controller. I love my joy cons to death but every so often you just want something that fits your hand a little better. Also, when playing smash bros ultimate, "tilts" are sooo much easier to pull off with these joysticks versus the joycons. If you're struggling with tilts, this is the way to go controller wise. Though if you want a controller "purely" for smash, maybe the gamecube controller is better. But this is preferable to me as it works with almost every game! The only games it won't work with are games that demand half a joycon like super mario party.

This is the official brand pro controller for the Nintendo Switch. In layout, it is very similar to an Xbox 360/One controller, with the exception of the ABXY buttons being changed around a bit. Ergonomically, it is very comfortable to hold, which is surprising since I have very small hands. However, the comfort of a controller is very subjective, so the only real way you will know is if you hold one for yourself. The controller is very easy to connect to the Nintendo Switch console or a PC and has a great wireless range. The controller includes a lithium-ion battery that has a killer battery life of 40 hours, which is so long that sometimes I forget I even have to charge this thing and get shocked when a low battery warning shows up on the screen. The $70 MSRP of the controller seems very steep, but for the comfort, battery life, gyro, and NFC reader, it is worthwhile if you play your Switch a lot. Since it's $50 rn, I would recommend it even more.

D-pad aside, this controller is great for most games on the Switch. It's most used while docked on my TV, and for an extra controller during local multiplayer.However the majority of my Switch use is in handheld mode. So I don't use this controller a whole lot.

If you have a switch, you need this controller. I waited for a few months after I got my switch to purchase, mainly due to no stock available. But man I am so glad I got it, it just feels perfect. Don’t let the price turn you away, the battery life is extremely good, I play my switch a lot and charge it once every 3-4 weeks, compared to my ps4s once every 2 days. It has the motion controls, rumble, amiibo reader. USB c charging cable is a nice touch too.

I've used things like Scuffs, the Xbox Elite controller, etc, so my standards are pretty high. I'd gotten so used to the Joycons and clawing while I was waiting for this. It's... alright. Pretty standard controller, nothing outstanding. No bells and whistles, no paddles, no button remapping. Doesn't offer anything the joycons don't outside of ergonomics and a standardized form-factor. I'd love to see if Scuff eventually releases a switch controller.

After I got home and unboxed my Switch, I realized that I should've bought two of these pro controllers.  The joycons are great - don't get me wrong - but for some games, it's just nicer to have a full-sized controller. These controllers are great quality and have a very long battery life. In fact, I've owned them for awhile now and still haven't had to charge them. In addition, I like how they are USB C and not mini or micro USB.

*UPDATE*After a day with the controller, I decided to call Nintendo's customer support. They ran me through the typical home diagnostics (update system/controllers, perform "input test") and then recommended I send in the controller for repair. So I sent it in.

It’s a little pricey but I like the pro controller. Much like the Xbox 360 controller which really impressed everyone. So far it’s been very durable and the battery lasts a long time. Just be warned it seems the controller will calibrate itself when you first connect to the console. When I did this I accidentally had the joystick held up a bit so it seemed like the joystick was drifting in game. Had to re-pair the controller to fix it. After that no problems, works great.

Yep, just like you'd expect it, it's an official switch pro controller. It's a shame the Xenoblade version is so expensive along with the other special edition pro controllers, but this one in particular is awesome. The colors on the controller (especially the blue) are much more vibrant that I thought, and it just looks awesome. If you don't mind spending a bit of money for a pro controller, this is it!

I love my Pro controller, so when the joysticks were going bad and I needed to replace it, I wasn't willing to switch to any of the other gamepads. While I could have torn it apart and replaced the joysticks, I figured it was time to get a second one anyway, and pulled the trigger on this one. I'll fix the first one later, in the meantime, I still have my favorite controller on hand. Zero complaints (except, perhaps, inability to hold up to a year of gaming before needing new joysticks).

The best console controller I've ever used. Perfect weight, large face buttons, precise D-pad, and a comfortable grip for American hands. It feels like it is built to last. Yes, it is expensive. It is expensive because it is top quality and has built-in NFC and HD rumble. Also works natively as a Bluetooth Directinput device, and can be used for Xinput with X360ce.

I was reluctant to spend 65 bucks on this thing, but when the price dropped to 60 I decided to just bite the bullet. My main beef with the joy-con is the small buttons, but the Pro controller has comparatively huge buttons and I find it to be much more comfortable and ergonomic overall. The thing that really impressed me, though, was the sturdiness of the construction and the texture of the parts. In short, this controller FEELS like it costs 60 dollars. This is simply a must-have item.

Excellent controller. It feels very natural to hold and is so much better than using the Switch's controllers as single unit.Some games dont really feel right with it however. This isnt a fault of the controller however, it's just some games use a lot of motion control and the separate controllers are much better for those games. You can use it for motion control stuff though if you like.

Great controller. I never had an issue with the joy con controllers but i figured since i play a lot at home with the switch docked that i should get this controller. I don't get the complaints about price. Xbox has just about any color or themed controller for about the same price and in my opinion this controller is just better. I actually ended up buying 2 just to have one as a backup and also for Mario Kart. The charge lasts a really long time, never have issues connecting to the Switch, its just an all around great controller, you wont be dissapointed.

Really happy with this purchase even with the higher cost. Was waiting on getting this  controller for a few months. Feels incredible to hold, the construction is solid, one of my favorite parts is that the grips are textured not the same flat colored plastic as the back, also the d-pad is the improved version and works properly.The design is something special with the colors and clashing pyra stripe with the sword. Realistically the color is pink not red if anyone is wondering.

This is the perfect controller for playing Switch games on a big TV. It's definitely the most traditional, and most ergonomic of the Switch controllers, and I prefer it to anything else. This controller is a must for gamers with larger hands or looking for more precise inputs, or for longer play sessions; the joy cons make my hands sore after a few hours.Unlike the Wii U pro controller, which felt flimsy and like a toy, this controller has a good weight to it and feels like a much nicer piece of equipment.

If you have any kind of issues holding or using the joycons dont hesitate buying this.  I made the mistake of purchasing other compatible controllers only for them to stop working after system updates or not having the full functionality of the pro.  If you are thinking about upgrading from the joycon spend the extra and get this one

I intitially bought this to play Rocket League and any other competitive games I may buy on the Switch, but it actually works really well with some of the other games like Mario Odyssey and Breath of the Wild. The controller feels a little larger than an Xbox One controller, but it is still comfortable to use. I have a couple of minor issues with it, however. The first is that the A B X Y buttons are somewhat steep and have sharp edges. If you’ve ever played a fast paced game, you’ll know that you slide between those 4 buttons quite frequently. Sometimes I move a little too quick and it can be pretty uncomfortable. The other issue I have is the non-analog triggers. The triggers are not sensitive so any racing games or Rocket Leauge will not have sensitive acceleration or breaking. Other than those to issues, this controller is a perfect combination with the portable Switch. It will for sure be my controller of choice if and when a new Smash Bros game is released. I would recommend it to anyone who regularly plays the Switch.

Great feeling controller. On par with the DS4 and Xbox controllers. Compared to the joy con this controller is infinitely more comfortable. The shell replacement, if you like doing that, is incredible easy. Connecting to the switch was instantaneous, and battery life is good. Since it uses USB C it charges really fast as well. In addition steam has become compatible with switch pro controllers recently so you can use this controller on pc as well.

Nice design, great build quality, and a big improvement over the Joy-Con controllers. Feels a lot better in the hand than Xbox controllers. The NFC reader didn't work on the first one I ordered so I had to can my Amiibo's on the Joy-Con's which would have been a pain but I emailed Amazon and they sent me a replacement and I returned the faulty controller.

I love the Switch, and Joy-Cons are fine for most games; however, some games, like Doom, are much better with the Pro controller. The Pro controller is one of my favorite full-size controllers. It feels solid, with great joy sticks. It was a good purchase.The best thing about the Pro controller is that I can play for hours without any hand pain. My hands are too big for anything but short playing times with the Joy-Cons.

Nintendo did this right! I recently purchased a Switch and replaced my other gaming consoles. After a couple days of playing, I realized I really wanted a "standard" feeling controller so I went ahead and purchased the Pro Controller. I've absolutely loved it and have to say it feels great to me. I plan to mainly use my Switch as a stand alone console so will definitely be using this more often than not. Very happy with this purchase!

Every aspect of the controller is amazing to the slight concave designed to the analog sticks, the triggers with a well design economical feel, that contours to your index fingers perfectly. (My only downside is that they're not spring loaded, but nor is the actual switch controllers which makes racing games a little less fun. But it's not a deal-breaker.) The face buttons are big a perfectly spaced apart so you're not hitting all of them at the same time. And d-pad is flawless too! Of course it's going to be amazing! this is coming from the person that made the perfect d-pad design!

This is an awesome controller.  It is very sleek, and it seems to hold a charge for days on end.  I have only charged it the first day I got it and haven't plugged it in since, so it's definitely holding up strong.  It feels similar to an Xbox controller to me which is a good thing as that was my previous most used controller.  Highly recommended for those who are playing mostly docked on the TV.

I bought this item on saturday and it was delivered two days later. No problem with the shipping. HOWEVER, the L R ZL and ZR buttons do not work AT ALL. How I found out was while playing single player on Overcooked 2, where you can switch between the two characters. No result. Tried Mario Kart and the first thing on the screen is to press L and R, right? Still nothing!Tried Test Input Devices, updated the controller, held the buttons for a long time and still to no avail. Im returning this product.

If you are still using the two joy cons included with the Switch, I'd recommend this for more serious gamers, if you play single player games or at least play often, this is great, very comfortable and excellent controls. Glad I made the Switch (hehe). The two joy cons just make my hands sore after a while as they are quite small in each hand.

I have had it for a few months. As someone who doesn't play games often, I think it's a comfortable enough controller. I like it better than the one bundled with the XBox One S. The only thing I did not like very much is that the cross button only goes 4 ways, up, down, left and right, no diagonals. I also wish it was a little bigger. Overall, it's nice.

No bad issues with the battery life, but I'm not a super heavy user.  I like that it uses the same charger as my phone (I can charge it while using it wirelessly if needed. ) I use it mostly for Zelda - Breath of the Wild....much better than the joycons in my opinion.  My only issue I've had it that it is very smooth plastic for the grips so it has slipped out of my hands when grabbing it and hit the floor.  (Luckily it's pretty durable so far...)

Definitely worth the buy. The controller that comes with the Switch gets uncomfortable to use after a while. This controller has a nice lightweight build. Very comfortable in the hands. Good battery life. The analogs are very responsive. Soft yet tactile buttons. The rumble shocks (vibration) are much better than the standard Switch controllers. Button layouts are much better as well.

Some people use adapters so they can use an Xbox controller on their Switch, but the Xbox controller will vibrate when it's not supposed to and you can't make it stop in the Switch settings. I bought this one, and of course it works perfectly because it's Nintendo, and I actually think this one feels better than the Xbox controller. I have big hands and this controller is comfortable for me.

Compared to my PS4 controllers and the Xbox I use on my laptop, this is hands down the best controller of the bunch. The size is perfect. The weight is just the right amount of heavy. In real life it looks pretty cool. But it feels like a quality product. Joysticks are responsive and have some feedback to them. Buttons don't wear down as easily as the PS4 ones I got. Once I'm docked, I can't bother with joycons when I got this.A bit pricey but totally worth it for every Switch owner

I've been using the default Joycon controller since I purchased the system a few years ago and decided it was time for an upgrade. This controller is leagues more comfortable and has a great battery life. The buttons and HD rumble all feel excellent. While this may be an expensive controller, I'd say it's going to be your best option. The cheaper third party controllers feel nowhere near as quality as this controller.

Been a gamer my whole life and have tried alot of different controllers over the years. This, in my opinion of course, is the best controller I have ever had the pleasure of owning and using. Before I purchased this, my xbox elite controller had been my favorite due to the way the controller felt in my hands. But this controller feels way more natural to hold. I literally don't have a single complaint regarding this controller. Wireless is great on it, the battery life lasts for a really long time before having to charge it again, and I also love how large the ABXY buttons are compared to xbox/ps4 controllers. I HIGHLY recommend this controller. I don't usually leave reviews, but for this one I just had to. Bravo on this one Nintendo!

So I've been trying to get a good cheap switch controller for a couple years, and all of the ones I got (including powerA) only lasted around 6 months before issues start appearing. I eventually got fed up with buying new controllers and went all in on a pro controller. When I got to the first one I ordered, the controller felt weighty and obviously high quality. HOWEVER, DAY ONE, not even 5 minutes in, the left stick drifts down. Returned and got a new one. This one drifts down on both sticks. I know this is a great product, but if you want to get one online, be prepared to return it.

I have to say, I prefer this controller over the joycons + connector attachment. This felt far more comfortable in my hands. The motion controls work well too - its not quite the same as the joycons for, say, aiming an arrow in BotW, its still more than adequate. Great battery life too - you can use any standard USB-C cable to charge it.

Awesome controller. come with a usb type C wire which can be used to charge your switch on the go. Price is still a bit in the high side but the controller is fantastic. If you don't want to spend so much money buy a Power A controller. although you will be messing the key feature such as amillbo support, rumbo, and a chargeable batteries but power A does have some cool feature to like interactable buttons and designs.

This is it, man. THE controller (Also, there are really no equivalent alternatives). I have hundreds of hours on mine already and It's one of the best game controls I have used in recent memory.The only change I might have made is the D-Pad. If it were a little flatter and pivoted a little more strictly, it might serve its purpose better on games like Cave Story and Tetris.

This controller was great until just outside the warranty window when both sticks started to experience drift.  Calibration did not fix the issue and cleaning the sticks was only a temporary fix.  A controller this expensive should not have this issue.

Was in a new unopened package as the information described it. Feels great in my hands, the price is high and if you live in a country with import taxes it gets even higher, something that was my case, yet, I love the style of it.Never tried the normal pro controller so can't say much on the entire D-pad thing apart from that it works great on this controller and it feels great. Delivery was extremely quick, something that really caught me off guard since I live in Norway and expected it to take some time. Think I had it in less than a week, and I did only pay for the normal slowest kind of transport. Overall very happy with the product, have also connected it up to my pc so I know also use it with pc games like Rocket League, took a tiny bit of calibration and worked like a charm afterward. 5/5 would buy again.

Love this, button placement is like Xbox, the body is like a steam controller, and the arms are like a PlayStation 4, very responsive, joysticks are as if you have extensions on (can move joysticks very far) I've had this for about 20 days and I love it,
SHIPPINGProduct arrived in time.

We used to play switch with the joy-con but recently some of the buttons on joy-con are almost going to die, after heavy use by my son during the stay home period. Also, I am really not the fan of the size of joy-con. So I decide to have a try on the pro controller and it turns out great experience of playing. The size is perfect and the buttons are obviously durable and nice touch. Wil buy another one.

Genuinely feels like a premium controller. This is the most comfortable controller I've ever played with. It has a very nice feeling to all of the buttons and a non-slick design. Easily my favorite controller. EASILY.The Pro Controller feels great for Smash Bros., Breath of the Wild, Mario Odyssey, Link's Awakening, and Super Mario Maker. If nothing else, it is worth to pick this controller up to have the option of play if you want a more traditional feeling controller over the more innovative and experimental Joy-Cons. It also has motion controls so you're not missing out on anything using this controller. I would recommend this controller to anyone, "Pro" or not.

This control has great form factor, holds a charge a long time, making it leagues above the controller that the switch comes with. However, I only once let it get to zero power, plugged it in to charge over night, and it was dead the next morning.  I only had it 6 month when this happened, and I am almost positive that it died from overcharge. Devices dying from overcharge was a common issue 8 years ago. Devices today have smart charging to prevent over charge battery death. For $60.00 I expected this device to have those technologies, which is why I can only give 3 stars.

Ordered it, opened it, brand new, left joystick was drifting drastically, making the controller unusable, I thought “hmm maybe I just got a bad one, I’ll return it and have them send me another one.” I got the second one same exact problem, left stick drifting drastically downward. Sent it back, never will purchase another one, I expected a quality product from the name brand, what I got was a broken mess.

It's an overpriced  xbox 360/one controller with nintendo slapped on it that has analog sticks that like to get stuck. But if you play your Switch docked you already know how annoying it is to take the joy cons on and off for charging, so you''ll likely break down and purchase this eventually.It does have a long battery life , and the rumble works well. But come on, the regular price is just too high..
Review: Nintendo Switch definitely nail their pro controler. I enjoy holding onto it more than other console controler. The grip, the feeling, and etc. also some nice features that it can.Pros:

Amazing controller. Everything about the pro controller is an improvement over the Joy Cons, and I already love the Joy Cons. The rubberized texture of the grips are comfortable to use over long periods of time and the buttons are responsive without being overly "clicky." This is now my go-to controller for anything I can connect it to, as the amazing battery life and all around comfort of the controller have made me reflect on how I settled with anything else for this long. Not to mention the colors and Xenoblade representation put this a step above the normal black pro controller. If you can't get this one, i'd also recommend the Splatoon 2 version to add a bit more character to your Switch accessory collection.

Great Design, feels like and improvement over ps4 dualshock or xbox controller, still the sugested retail price in mi opinion is steep, this should be shipped with the console, not to be purchased separately, but it comes with no suprise given that is after all Nintendo, it is well known that their business model relies on peripherals and add ons (useless robots, blasters, rumble packs, transfer packs, expansion packs, etcetera) that do not come with the console.

So glad i was able to get this. I did wait until one day amazon had it on sale as it is a bit pricey for a controller. However, I like it so much more than the joycon. Having a real controller to use makes all the difference. Charge is lasting for hours and easily charges from the switch doc.Def a must have for the switch if you can get it for a good price.

I'm not about to use my Switch in it's portable form. Knowing that, this is so much more comfortable than it's given controller. I game with the PS4 mostly, and even after hours with the Switch pro controller, my fingers don't feel remotely sore. I don't even feel like I pulled a marathon like I do on other systems.

I like this controller more than using the colored Switch controllers on the mount. This controller is more ergonomic, with more intuitive button placement. Good fit for both male and female sized hands as all friends have said they prefer this controller. Good battery life. Can actually use this controller with the Switch while it is off the docking station.

I knocked one star off this review because I feel that the smaller buttons on the face of this controller should be a little larger and taller.  By this I mean the screen capture button, the home button and the minus/plus buttons.  Overall, however, this is a very good controller for the Nintendo Switch.  4 stars.

I was hesitant to get one of these because it considerably more expensive then other switch controller options, but all the reports I looked at gravitated to the idea that its worth the extra money because its very well made. After getting mine, I agree with that sentiment. It is very solid, has a good weight, joysticks feel solid and the buttons press nicely. Its definitely the best feeling of any of the full controllers I have.

This controller feels great in your hands and has a very long battery life. However, I've noticed that the L and R buttons sometimes don't work if you deliberately try to lightly press down on them. The reason why I'm still giving it 5 stars is because I've never actually had any issues when I'm playing games that use these buttons. It could be that I press these buttons more harder when I'm playing a game (I don't mash down on these buttons, only hard enough and it works fine).

When docked I HIGHLY prefer this controller over the Switch's bundled controller that uses the joycons. It fits in my hands much better with less fatigue and all of the game functions/button are laid out in a way much easier to hit vs the joycons.Don't get the crummy wired ones, the wireless PRO is the way to go!

If you Play games on a regular basis this is a must buy. The Joy Con controllers are outclassed by the Pro controller in every concievable way except for the lack of HD rumble. The fantastic ergonomics will make extended gaming very comfortable and the controller was supported by every game I've played so far (its especially good for shooters). It pairs up even better than the default Joy Cons. It has a good battery life. It has a REAL D-pad and not that nonsense that everyone pretends is a D-pad on the left Joy Con. The analog sticks are also positioned much better than the Joy Cons are when they're connected to either side of the Switch. The triggers aren't the best when compared to the Xbox One and PS4 controllers but that is a nitpick. If you are above the age of 10 and play games as a hobby you NEED this controller. Let your friends and small children play with those Joy Cons.

This controller is great.  I have always been an Xbox guy, so this controller, with its offset sticks, feels very natural.  It seems like it’s based on the Xbox 360 controller, which is (I think) the best controller ever made.  Seems to be very well made, also.  Very solid feeling.  A great upgrade over the joy-con controller that comes with the switch.

An essential piece of hardware for the Switch. This controller is much more comfortable and has better button accuracy than the joy cons in the packages grip. Each button is clicky and accurate. I just purchased mine this week in November and did not notice any D-pad inaccuracies that launch controllers had. Do yourself a favor and buy one!

Despite the freedom the joycons give you, I still prefer this style of controller for more serious gameplay. It fits great in my hands and motion controls are impeccable. Not nearly as finnicky as the joycons. Charge lasts for a very long time and it recharges very quickly. Honestly can't think of anything wrong with it.

Overall, this controller is more durable and functional for the type of games I play on the Nintendo Switch. The feel is more comfortable as it is one complete unit compared to the Joy-Cons attaching to the controller point.The charge on the controller is incredible as it lasts for about an entire week or slightly longer before I have to do it again and the charge is quick overnight.

I doubt you'll need this review to factor in if you're buying this or not, but here you go. If you think you might want this for your switch, I say do it. Playing mario kart is a million times easier. The buttons press so smoothly. It's a night and day difference.

This thing is expensive but soooooo worth it, as many first party Nintendo accessories tend to be. The controller is comfortable, mimicking the Xbox controller style that many manufacturers do these days. The battery life is solid, around 40 hrs. I went on a Breath of the Wild marathon on my first charge and didnt charge again for about a week. It is study, durable, and the sticks feel waaaaay better than the Joy Con. Highly recommended.

I personally prefer the actual joy-con controller but this controller feels nice as well. There's two people who play the switch in the house so two controllers are a must and this is what I ended up getting and I have no regrets! It has a firm grip but it does feel different and a bit wider to grip if you always use the joy-con controller but it's still works. It was delivered flawless, no faults or anything which is probably the primary worry of buying electronics online or in general. Also, I really like the aesthetics of the controller. Very nice!

If you mostly or frequently play your Switch in home console mode this controller is an absolute must have. It might be the most comfortable controller I've ever used (up there with the Xbox One) and it's got no flakiness in the wireless connection like my joy-cons sometimes get. Highly recommend this for anyone putting in extended sessions on their docked Switch.

I actually bought this controller before I got my Switch. But my instinct was telling me that the Pro Controller would be a necessity. And my instincts were right.This is a very comfortable controller to use. Much more comfortable for me to use than the Joycons because of my hand size.

This is one of the most comfortable controllers that I have used in years. Very solid and feels good in your hands, especially after using the JoyCons. If you have a Nintendo Switch, this is a must-own accessory. The price may seem high, but it includes an Amiibo NFC reader and HD Rumble. The D-pad is really nice for retro games, which you lack with the JoyCons.

Had larger buttons for an adults hands, unlike the switch with its child sized joycon buttons....Honestly, Nintendo needs to make "adult" button sized joycons, using buttons the size of the pro controller, so adults can properly use it in handheld mode. Otherwise I always need to use it in TV mode.

I'm on my second one now because I love the controller so much, honestly one of the best I've  used for any console I've played (which is everything N64 to date) but's pretty disappointing that I had to1. Replace it after a year of fairly regular use, I'm not so mad, just a bummer that the thumbstick crapped out after just a year

Can't argue with the quality here.  It feels solid, has both rumble and motion tracking, and fits adult hands.  If you play on a TV, I highly recommend it.  The only complaint is that + and - are a bit harder to reach than I'm used to.  But I love that it feels so high quality and appropriately heavy.  If you're a gamer, used to standard controllers, it feels more natural.

You absolutely need this for comfort when it comes to playing BOTW or any other game on the Switch. The Joy cons are too small for my hands and this feels so right. It's actually more comfortable than a PS4 or XBox controller. Now am I saying this controller will fix your life? No it won't but it will making playing single player games so much more comfortable.

This is a great product when you can use it. It’s best for one player focused action. Nintendo really does make the controllers confusing letting you use them only some of the time and then making it slightly different muscle memory if you use a joy  con vs. this controller. Battery charge lasts a long time. I would get it again.

Given that the last Nintendo console controllers feeling sort of ”toyish” (and the price tag on this one) I initially considered simply getting a third party controller and calling it day.I’m so glad I didn’t! This controller is excellent. It feels great, it’s sturdy, definitely feels “premium” and worth the price tag.

The price is outrageous, like all Nintendo stuff, but it is well made and solid.It connects easily and has a USB C cable included, so you can play even when charging; which is something you can't do with the standard controllers.

Got it to play Legend of Zelda breath of the Wild because it ,unlike my previous  third-party controller, has a NFC scanner on it. Only thing I don't like about it is the same thing I don't like about any controlers for the Nintendo switch so far. I don't like that the L3 is linked to the analog. It should be it's own button because I will sometimes accidentally pressed it when I hold L2 and left analog down.

Highly recommend buying at least one of these for your console. Stock to the original Nintendo brand and avoid third party knock offs, unless they are licensed by the Nintendo. It is better size than the joycons. I wish they had kept “+” and “-“ buttons similar to joycons.

I'm an older gamer with arthritis, so need a controller easy to handle.  This is easy to use, and makes playing my games a lot better.  I would recommend this for anyone, but especially for older gamers.  I haven't tried other controllers, but then, I found the right one first

This is a really nice Controller. It is a bit of a higher price then Play Station and X box Controller's but, it dose come with the rechargeable battery and from what I have seen it is the same batter that is in the 3DS. It come with the USB to USB-c cable that is needed to charge it. The batter seem's to last 40+ game play hours before it need's to be charged.

Works as expected, love the fact it is rechargeable and does not require batteries that have to be switched out once depleted.  It was a breeze to match to the switch.  So happy I didn’t waste the money or time on a cheaper model.  I recommend only getting Nintendo brand.  You had to spend 300 on the system, why cheap out on the other stuff??

Maybe the price is high but is the most comfortable controller I've ever used in my life (after GameCube controller of course) and is compatible with PC games downloaded in your Steam client...thank you steam. I play like 10 hours before the battery die and I think is a good duration, gyroscope and rumble work well. But no include and usb cable for recharge, you must use the Switch's one or a cell phone charger (but under your risk).

This thing offers a whole new level of comfort compared to the joy-cons, especially if you have larger hands. The buttons and analog sticks all feel really good and responsive, trigger buttons as well. It has a bit more weight compared to some other controllers, but that's not a bad thing. You can also use this as a PC controller and connect it with bluetooth. Highly recommend.

Far more robust than the base joycon controllers. Better button feel. Probably better than any other gaming console controller I have ever owned. After playing Breath of the Wild mostly with this controller, I went and played using the joycon controllers attached to the portable screen, which is just not nearly as enjoyable of a gaming experience as using the pro-controller.

I bought these controller to use when I'm playing my nintendo switch docked. I have big hands so this controller does wonders for me since the joy-cons are really small as well as for the buttons. This controller fits my hand perfectly and it made it easier for me to play the nintendo switch docked!

Update: I reached out to Nintendo and they repaired the controller at no cost, and now the controller works perfectly. I have no complaintsThis controller was great for about the first 2 months. Now, the joystick constantly moves downward in the game. The joystick itself remains stiff, but it seems to move down in the game...

This is a much better way to play than the built in little sticks (to me).  I really like the feel of this controller.  So much so that I take this with me on the road when I travel.The controller feels very sturdy, much like an XBox controller.  Battery life is great (I tested for 25 hours and then plugged it in).

i was lucky enough to snag a pre-order of this the day before its initial release but then my left joystick got on the fritz so i decided to get a new one just in case my old one isn't just a simple fix. once i got it i put the new ones box next to my old box and came to the shocking realization that i received the European version not the American version that i initial got, so i was pretty butthurt about that. but if that isn't an issue for you guys this is in my opinion the best pro-controller right now. i also have the regular pro Controller and having already played with this version I don't feel right playing with the original after getting to use this one. if you're on the fence this is a definite buy!

I've bought a second pro controller because my other one had drift problems. So far this one is good. I had my first one for a year, but if I'm paying $70 for a controller I expect it to last longer than that. My left joy con also drifts. Nintendo needs to fix their controllers or at least make some new improved version. It's absolutely ridiculous!

Nintendo’s controllers are some of the best feeling, most responsive, controllers made. The battery life is excellent and they feel solid. The only thing I deducted a star for was the amiibo reader, it doesn’t work nearly as well at the Joycon reader. Sometimes it doesn’t pick the Amiibo up at all, in contrast the Joycon picks it up before you even touch it.

Definitively, the best experience playing the Switch is with this controller. The grips are fantastic and do not need any further enhancement. I let my girlfriend play with this controller whenever we play Mario Kart because it offers such a competitive advantage, and she really needs that when playing against me.

Wow! I wish I had gotten this when I first bought my switch! It makes games so much easier to play, and it really brings the console to life. Games like Doom, D3, and Super Smash are worlds different with this controller.If you plan on playing any first-person games or games that require aiming, this controller makes a night and day difference over the Joy-Cons.

Solid controller definitely feels well constructed, only issue is when waking up the switch if you press any button but the home button it wont wake the switch up and it seems to go into search mode for a few seconds and it wont wake your switch during this, even if I press the home button..

I like this controller a lot.  The buttons all feel great.  I know it's considered overpriced, but I didn't mind paying $60 for it.  I think the joycon controller is pretty good, this is just a little better and more comfortable.  I can't say whether you should choose it over any of the cheaper options from other companies - maybe some of those are really great too.

If you got big hands then this is your controller.  It's solidly built and connects super easy.  Buttons work great and have had no issues.  I can't use the smaller controllers that come with the switch so this is a great alternative.

Has some drift and the joysticks do not have as much of a resistance as I’d like - harder to make finer movements in FPS games like Doom. Also the right grip is a bit flimsy and shifts back and forth (I’ve tried tightening with electronic screwdriver but still shifts around).

Best controller I've used, good quality, works well and has good battery life, also the sensibility on the buttons and sticks is so much better than cheaper controllers'I play smash ultimate quite a lot and it has endured it. Before this one I bought a PowerA controller but it died within two months. So, im loving this one.

This controller works with the Switch docked and undocked in its portable mode. I also use this controller on my PC more than I use my Dualshock 4 because the cord stays in a lot better. If you're playing a shooting game on PC, this is the best controller out that isn't a custom one. The gyro works perfectly too and makes aiming with a controller way easier.

Pros: long battery life. Charges quickly.Cons:The throw on the sticks is too long, and often gets misinterpretted when playing a game that requires a lot of fast movement. Buttons have a light kind of vague feeling. Return springs on the sticks and buttons feel weak. The whole controller just has a kind of light, cheap feel.

I didn't pick one up at launch because I thought the joycon would be fine. When Mario Kart 8 Deluxe came out, the joycon weren't as comfortable to play with. I picked this up and I don't think I'll ever go back to the joycon. It's so comfortable and I play it with Zelda which I play the most. It also lasts longer than the joycon. I found myself having to constantly charge them if they weren't with the tablet. However with this I've barely had to worry. Now I wish I had gotten it at launch.

This is the best controller I've ever used. It's comfortable to hold, buttons are responsive, and it holds a charge really well. I didn't think that I needed this, since the switch comes with the joycons, but I was wrong. Every switch owner should have this.

This is a really nice controller. It has the solid feel of an Xbox One controller, and the battery life is quite long too. When switching from handheld to TV the button placement is so well done that you never have to look down to translate between the two schemes. Highly recommended. And it’s an official Nintendo thing so you know that it will never break.

I love the pro controller for my switch. The controller is so much easy to use compare to the joy con. Especially for old fashion gamer who still like controller over anything. The controller also come with a usbC to usb cable so you can use it to charge your switch and save you couple of dollars of getting a usbC cable when you travel.

It's a good controller overall. It is comfortable, has a long battery life, good button response. The major drawback is the vibration is extremely weak, which makes differences in vibration very subtle to detect. I've gotten used to it over a few months, but some might find it annoying, or it may be insufficient for certain games.

I was shocked when I received this product. I didn't expect Nintendo to make such an awesome product. This controller feels like an xbox one controller, it has big fat X Y A B buttons that stick out, a firm d-pad, xbox style analog sticks. One down fall is that the zl and zr triggers have no resistance . . . They're just buttons, it may bother some when it comes to shooters.

When I first unwrapped the Pro Controller and held it I was astounded at how *good* it felt to hold it. I wouldn't have thought a controller could feel better than an Xbox 360 controller, but Nintendo's newest (and rather pricey) Pro Controller definitely surpasses it. I actually just pick it up at random, without playing a game, to marvel at the quality and amazing feel. Weird, I know.The design feels solid without too much weight, the handles have a comfortable grippy material pleasant to the touch, and the buttons and control sticks are larger than the Joy-Con's buttons and sticks. The good ol' Nintendo d-pad is nice to have as well.
Came in exactly as the description said. Couldn’t be any happier having this in my possession now.

Much more comfortable than the normal joycon setup. I’m still not happy about the price, but it holds battery, is comfortable, and performs well. It is a little heavier than a PS4 controller, but this does not bother me that much. The light design on the controller is minimalistic and aesthically pleasing. I especially like using it for Smash Ultimate.

Expensive? Yes. Should be included with the Switch? Likely. Worth it? Yes!Quality controller and feels great in my hands. Going back to the Joy-Con while mobile feels painful after using this controller. Not just in the size and the grip, but the quality of the joysticks.

Feels like a real controller. Has a nice heft to it and the buttons have a good feel to it compared to using any cheaper options for switch controllers. The perfect blend of being smooth but having enough matte feel to it for it to not feel slippery. I bought two of these and if I need to get another controller, this is the one that I’d buy.

See title: I used stock joy cons for the entirety of BotW, Mario Odyssey, Gris, Mario Kart, AND Smash... before buying this MASTERPIECE. Phenomenal D-pad. Not my favorite controller, but ABSOLUTELY miles above joycon inserts that come with the Switch. If you're a fan of PS4, Steam Controller, etc. this controller is for you. Price point a bit high though.

Solid controller. The vibration is great, spacing of buttons is good, only wish the triggers weren’t treated as buttons, you can’t press them down part way like other controllers. It reaches a set point and then is active. Other than that, it’s great for games like Astral Chain.

Feels Great in my hands, holds battery for a good amount of time. The Charging cord is long enough for me to play while charging if I sit a few feet away from my TV. Also, the controller doesn't have the Ghosting Problem like others do, (Where the analog stick registers that it is being pressed either left or right, so when you are not using the controller, it is moving the camera or your character without any input from you.)

It's the official standard. Feels great in my hands. The tension in the joysticks and buttons is on point. You can turn your Switch on and off with a single button.You owe it to yourself to get one of these if you play a lot of single player. Do it.

Love it! Much better than the joycons! The first one I got, the left bumper was weird and didn't press correctly. It was returned and got a replacement and it works fabulous! Definitely the best way to play the switch! My only gripe is the price. It is way too expensive for what it is. It's a great controller, but it is just too expensive.

The controller is excellent.. functions perfectly and feels right. It's ther third package I've had placed on my front porch steps while raining, though. Fortunately the shipping box absorbed most of the rain and the product box received very little moisture. Had it been scooted forward even a foot.. a roof covers the porch and would have been completely dry.

My left joystick became unresponsive on my OEM joy-con so I started looking for a replacement. To replace the left joy-con itself cost almost the same as this Pro one so IMO its a no-brainer. This Pro controler has a nice weight to it and feels better in hand than the regular splitable joy-cons. It charges via usb so no need for batteries either. Bottom line is if you need a new controler, need an additional or just want to have the best Pro controller made by Nintendo buy this one.

I bought this to play Fortnite and for two player Minecraft and I am very happy with this controller. Similar to the Xbox 360 controller feels good in the hand nice weight feels solid and keeps a charge for a long time.

This thing really made Breath of the Wild easier for me; using the joycons I would accidentily press in on the analog sticks constantly -- usually resulting in my death during combat.  No problem with this.  It's actually one of the most solidly-built controllers I've come across recently!

These are good for awhile but heavy use causes the sticks to act up. Playing fortnite on the swich since August I have sent one back. Two others are acting up. The stick seems to start failing when a character starts creeping by itself. The one I sent back I no longer could stop this from happening. The other two can be stopped for now but this failure is a pain while playing.

This version had a updated version of the D-pad and it isn't bad anymore. With older versions it was  inaccurate and many times would simply twist the inputs.If you are not familiar with the Nintendo Switch Pro controller, it is good to have 40h autonomy and a nice grip but I do think it doesn't last too much.

Great controller! It's very comfortable and fits well in the hands. Holds a lot of charge, exactly as much as Nintendo advertises(maybe a little more). There is one flaw that prevents me from giving this product 5 stars. The down button on the Directional pad activates sometimes when pressing left or right on it. It may seem minor but it may severely impact some games which require crisp movement.

If you're like me used to gaming with both ps4 and xbox one controllers, or either one,  this switch pro controller is for you. Comfortable and much more natural to use. Even if you don't don't game on a ps4 or xbox one this controller feels much better in my hands than the standard switch controller. Price is steep but I say worth it.

This controller feels very premium. The price may offset some, but once you get your hands on it, you'll understand why. Solid build, artistic design, clicky and responsive buttons, and it uses the 3dsxl battery built into it, allowing for extremely long play sessions before even needing to charge. To top it all off, it even charges on USB type c cables. Now that's quality

Best controller I've ever used, period. Everyone has their own preferences, of course, but I can definitely say that it is the definitive way to play the Switch and it is well worth the $70. I will never go back. Kudos to Nintendo for finally making a worthy conventional controller, and in this case, they exceeded expectations.

I work as a hairstylist, and that alongside doing art and playing video games, it really takes its toll. I buckled down and got a pro controller because I've started seeing some warning signs of carpal tunnel syndrome in my right hand, and this controller. Holy crap. It's awesome. Well worth the money. Splatoon is way easier, Mario kart is way better, and Legend of Zelda is the best experience with this controller. I don't like using the pro controller for Tetris 99 however, the buttons sometimes don't do the right control, so I'll use the joy cons and grip with that game, otherwise this is well worth the money.

Seems well built, but the warranty is short because of a design flaw in the joystick.  Started drifting hard down 2 weeks after the warranty expired.  Thought I way paying extra for the perfect controller.

I was determined to get this on sale and it was well worth it. I have small hands and the joy-con are perfect for most games, but this controller is pretty great for all others. The sticks are the same size, while other controllers generally have huge buttons. It's really touchy and responsive too which is great, and you can charge while you play. This will likely be my #1 controller unless we're traveling.

I bought this before price dropped. I paid the original $80 each. I bought two controllers. Those controllers did not break on the hands of several 6 years old children who plays on my Nintendo Switch. Those are not like Xbox One controllers. It's super sturdy and probably last longer than $50 Xbox One controllers will.
I thought it might not work with the new switch lite but it did. And I really enjoy using it to play on the switch.

Maybe i got a defective controller but ive seen a few reviews with the same issue as well as on the internet. The left analog stick has a mind of its own (moving on its own) and calibrating it seems to do nothing.

My joycon controllers had drift beyond repair, so I sought out a Pro controller to replace them. Best investment any Switch Owner can make. 90% of games support it, and it can be used wired or wireless. I have noticed a tad bit of input lag (less than .5 seconds) but I believe this is due to my TV and no fault of the controller itself.

This product is not made well.  The joysticks wear out very quickly.  The wear is visible as their is a white residue that builds up on the joystick.  It's likely the plastic of the joystick against the casing.  It is also not a generous warranty period.  It is only three months and then it's $30 plus tax.  I would recommend you look into a 3rd party controller.  They will likely be cheaper and as well as better quality.

This controller is far more comfortable to use than the adaptor that they include with the Switch to turn the motion controllers into a single controller.  Build quality is great and setup is super simple.  I would have given this controller 5 stars if the feel were better.  The analog sticks feel rather loose when compared to my PS or Xbox controllers.  So it makes playing games like DOOM not as natural as it was on those systems.

I thought when I first got this that I wouldn't use it, but I was wrong. As a gamer who owns multiple consoles, this is the most comfortable controller I have ever used. Very durable, great quality and lasts very long before charging. Small and fits easily into a small bag.

If you are playing at home a lot or places or places where you aren't on the go as much, the Pro Controller is absolutely necessary. I primarily play in docked mode, and this controller is amazing. It has the best battery life of any of the console controllers on the market. It feels great in hand and is easy to use. No complaints at all. It's my second favorite controller ever built for the consoles.
I believe the Switch is the best console ever, and I’m 38 so I’ve seen a few consoles.The controller on the Switch compared to this is a drastic improvement.

This controller is so gloriously comfortable its ridiculous. I love everything about it.It's a little pricey, but considering that it has rumble, gyro controls AND it scans amiibos as well... It is not so bad.
This controller is a much better feel than the tiny joy cons are especially because I have large hands. The battery life on this controller is insane compared to the joy cons as well.

Had no issues at all, i've been using it since smash came out and with most of the indie games in the eshop. love the controller, it's really comfortable, and it feels kind of heavy, but  you can feel it's because of the quality of the pieces they used, would definitely buy another one and would definitely recommend you to get one. Battery is great, sometimes i use it for days without having to charge it.

The price seems gouged especially cuz nintendo has this market cornered. But I do not regret the purchase and it's very comfy especially compared to joycons. I love that it is compatible with other devices like Steam or my Fire TV. It functions well and the charge lasts a long time.

The controller has great ergonomics and battery life but it lags in one game - Timberman. The strange thing is, the Joycons don't face this issue for this game. Other than that, I haven't really noticed any other issues so far. Will update if I find more.

For someone whose hands cramp up using the Joy-cons, this thing is a godsend. On the pricier side, but for wireless, motion, and rumble, you have to pay that price.  Most of the cheaper controllers don't support those functions, so this is the way to go if you need those things.In about 20 hours of use so far, the only complaint I have is that the analog sticks don't feel like they give as much range of motion as the Dual Shock 4.  I find that I don't have far to push before I'm pushing the stick against the limit of it's movement radius.  Would have been nice for a little more control in this area, but it still beats the heck out of the Joycons.

I've always been a fan of Xbox controllers only but this is a very comfortable well built controller. The button lay out was a little weird to get use to with the a being on the right and b at the bottom. It seems well built and the battery last pretty long. Overall I think its worth the price.

I love this controller so much more than the original Switch JoyCon. It's easy to use and makes playing certain games way better from a controls standpoint (example, Zelda Breath of the Wild). However, my controller stopped charging after a few months of use and now I can only use it when it's plugged in. Anyone have any suggestions? I even tried replacing the battery and it still doesn't work.
enhanced gaming performace, i want nothing to do with the original joy cons after this purchase. i wish i would have pulled the trigger months ago

A good solid heavy feeling controller. Pairs easily to switch. Feel good and well made in hand. Offers motion aiming in games like Skyrim , Zelda or FPS games. Good stuff.The best made Nintendo switch controller.

You have hands that are bigger than a robin's claws.  This is a fact.  You need a controller that is comfortable to hold.  You need a controller that has a charge that lasts for DAYS (at least for me, a casual gamer).  I bought mine from an Amazon Warehouse deal.  There were no issues with the controller whatsoever.

This is mostly okay, but doesn't quite fit my expectations for a "pro controller". The buttons are too mushy, and the d-pad is all one piece. This makes playing games like Celeste very difficult toward the final levels - not because of player skill, but because you will often need to switch from left to right on the d-pad. Those kind of switches causes d-pads that aren't separated to hit up/down along the way, and one mis-click can ruin a game.It's nice if you want to casually play switch with a more-conventional controller, but labeling it as "pro controller" is maybe the wrong move here.

Comfort wise, I'd put this controller right up there with the best - the Xbox One controller. Much more comfortable to hold than those tiny Joy-Con things, even on the grip accessory. My only gripe is that it's a bit pricey, but I managed to snag it on sale. A definite must have for any switch owner.

So do you want to spend two or three times the amount of money for this instead of on an off-brand controller? Absolutely yes.The battery life is amazing, and the feel of the buttons is Nintendo perfect. Maybe get a couple cheap controllers for when friends come over, but buy this for your main control.
definitely one of my favorite game controllers. my only problem is the price.

I ordered this controller shortly after getting my switch. I personally am used to console controllers so this fit my hands better than the Joy-Con controllers that come with the system. I have used it quite a bit, especially for Mario Kart, and it works great.I would definitely buy this product again and would recommend it to others.

Feels great to use, Long battery life. I've never had calibration issue with any of the sticks like i have with the joy cons. Caught this on a great sale too. Caught this on sale few weeks before Christmas. Great price. UPS damaged my first one but, Amazon let return that one and had one coming the same time frame as the one that went back. Very happy with the way they took care of that.

Calidad óptima,  simplemente una cosa que me desagrada del diseño,  cosa vanal, los botones de + y - son tan planos y alejados de los demas que cuando coordinas sin ver mano y ojo es imposible encontrarlos

My son loves playing the Switch and was thrilled to get the controller.  He had to exchange it for another one since one of the control buttons was slow to respond and the seller was extremely quick to replace it.  Very happy with the whole transaction.

The control sticks are feather-precise. The buttons are perfect. The d pad is great, it is incredibly ergonomic as I played video games all day without any achyness in my hands. I returned a cheaper controller I bought through amazon thinking it would be ok. I'm so sorry nintendo... never again.

Has a good heft to it, a good weight and size. Actually for my smallish lady hands it is a little large. But soo much more comfortable than using the joycons in that weird little grip, that thing always cramped my hands after a while. I've been playing Skyrim with this controller and it works well, the motion controls are good for aiming my bow and arrows. Battery is good, d-pad is good, no complaints really. (Although it could definitely be cuter imo, I'd prefer more choices of colour, like white, without having to resort to skins or 3rd party cases)

I bought this controller around January after hearing all the great news about it, and they're not wrong! The controller is big, with big buttons, feels comfortable, and it has a long battery life! Simple, but one of my favorite controllers of all time. Much better than Joy Con's if you ask me. However, If you are planning to buy a pro controller, buy it when it comes on sale. The Pro Controller is still on sale a bunch of times here and there and I bought it when it was $55, and to be honest, $70 for this controller is a bit too pricey in my opinion.

If you're even considering to buy a Nintendo Switch, this Pro Controller is essential to enjoying the switch. Firstly, it gives you another method of playing switch games. While the joycons are fine for most games, and even are better in some games (Puyo Puyo Tetris) every other game just feels so much better with the Pro Controller. The sticks are much bigger and comfortable on the Pro Controller, and everything is positioned and slanted in such a way that it feels AMAZING to hold in your hands. Some may complain that the triggers aren't analog, but they feel really nice too and have their own feel that is still great. If you need a second controller, or are looking for a better game to play your games, you NEED this.

Left joy pad had an issue where character would just walk a certain direction. But was able to return it. Apparently it’s an issue with an older joy con design. Otherwise great controller. Just gotta make sure you get it from a source that would for sure have the updated ones. Like direct from Nintendo.

Hands down the best controller ever made for any system, if you are in dock most this is an ABSOLUTE MUST. Build quality is the best I’ve ever seen, it has HD-Rumble and NPC as well as a huge 24+ hour charge.

There is really nothing special about this controller but just for 1 thing: THE BATTERY LIFE IS CRAZY LONG!!!!! You can easily play 12 hours on 1 charge. I didn’t believe my friend so I bought one for myself. I didn’t play a full 12 hours but I did play 8 hours with no problem.It so worth the money.

I bought this product as i heard it was a life changer when it comes to playing the switch other than playing with the built in 2 controllers holder, and was not disappointed although it seems like a pricey remote it is well made and well designed and it is a 100% game changer when it comes to games like ‘’Zelda breath of the wild’’ or ‘’Super smash bros brawl’’ and I am sure for a lot more games, the controller is smartly designed with its button placement and the shape of it makes it SO much easier to play games and improve your skills.I would recommend for people who really do want a game changer and are willing to pay a little more than what your usual budget will allow.

Tried a highly rated 3rd party controller 1st to see if it would do the job at a lower price point. It was ok, joysticks and buttons felt clunky and cheap. Within a week it had drifting issues. Returned it for this official Nintendo controller and the difference is very obvious. Connects immediately, buttons and joysticks feel really smooth and of a much higher quality. Buy nice, or buy twice. I would definitely recommend this and I might buy another as my joy cons that came with the Switch are having drift issues and are uncomfortable to use with my giant hands.

Nintendo makes a great quality controller that's comfortable to hold and use. While I've had issues with the Joy Cons disconnecting during play at times, I've never had issues with the Pro Controller. I now have two. I like that the cord which came with them can be plugged into any USB charger to recharge the controllers too.

You want to get into smash but don't want to pay 150 bucks for a gamecube controller or 20 bucks for a knockoff controller? Get this. It's great. Better triggers than the gamecube controller too. Battery lasts a long time and you can unplug it and take it with your switch when you're taking it to the TV.

I had it for about a week and all of a sudden the bumpers and triggers stopped working. It's not a problem with most switch pro controllers because I've never heard of anyone else having this problem. I loved the controller while I had it, and still love using it at my friend's houses. All of my other buttons work except for the bumpers and triggers on my controller

It’s a real step up to the switches regular controllers, kinda feels like an Xbox controller but much lighter. Makes games like smash and fortnite easier since the buttons are larger and more comfortable to reach for, especially A,B,Y and X. I’d recommend this to any gamers who prefer to hook the switch up to the tv for a console like performance.

This controller is everything I could've hoped for. Is it pricey? Sure, but it's nearly in line with other console controller prices and contains all the same guts as the Joy-Cons. I love playing my Switch on the go but when I'm docked at home, this is the controller to use.It's incredibly comfortable and feels nearly as good as my Xbox One Elite controller. I've been using it to play Breath of the Wild for who knows how many hours and it's only been charged once so far! If the Joy-Cons just don't feel right undocked for extended gaming sessions, and you can find it, give this controller a try - you won't be disappointed.
I have purchased two of this controller. One worked for 4 months and now the buttons do not work. The other one did not work right out of the box. 60$ is extremely expensive for this piece of junk.

This controller works extremely well. Motion controls are smooth. The controller feels nice in the hand. The battery life is exceptionally good. If it failed tomorrow, I'd buy another, because some games on the Switch really need a controller that feels this good.

Works like a charm and feels good and solid in your hands. I cannot give it 5 stars though because of its flaw and I am just waiting patiently for the dreaded Controller Drift that these controllers suffer from after a while of use.

The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is the ideal controller for the console. It's arguably the best controller in my collection, comparing it to my PS4 and Xbox 360 controllers. It is lightweight and responsive. After being charged via the docket, the battery life is amazing. The buttons are perfectly spaced and have a great feel to them. I will forever be using this controller, and should it ever stop working, I will be purchasing a new one.

I believe the switch is three years old now so the price of this controller should have dropped by now considering we’re about halfway through this generation. Controllers from Sony and Microsoft are better and cost less.Hefty/weighty remote makes it feel like a quality part but the buttons and thumb sticks could be better especially when you’re paying $70.

Best and most comfortable console remote control I've ever used. PS1, 2, 4, Nintendo, Super Nintendo, N64, Gamecube, Wii and WiiU, Nintendo Switch Joy-Cons and Xbox comparatively. It fits my hands well, is quality constructed, has unbelievable gyro and motion accuracy. At first I thought it was a bit pricey, but you'll quickly learn it is well worth it. I highly recommend it for ALL Switch users!

It's hard to talk about the controller without talking about the Switch overall but I'll try to limit it. The controller is functional, comfortable to hold, has long battery life, and durable. I've never had an issue with it. It is slightly overpriced for what you get but that's Nintendo generally.

I got my controller in two days! I was super excited and opened the box, and as soon as I held it in my hands it was perfect feeling it in my hands, it was the perfect weight and just was Ｓｕｐｅｒ comfortable in my hands! Then it bummed me out when I found out I couldn’t start playing right away. It just so happened, I was not at my tv (and dock) so I couldn’t pair the controller for the first time. So I had to wait until I could play portably with it. But it’s still a really great controller! It has to be the best one I’ve ever played with!

I bought this controller thinking it would handle better for RPGs like Breath of the Wild and Witcher.While the grip is nice, the drift on the left joystick is terrible. Sneaking is a pain, and it is impossible to stand still with this controller. Maybe it’s a fluke, but I am very dissatisfied with its performance. Buyer beware!

This product is works well for a wireless controller for the switch but I don't think that the worth makes up for the price. I don't know why these controllers cost so much now. I barely use the motion gyroscope thing where it senses if you move your controller around.

I LOVE this controller! It's high quality make and speak design go lightyears beyond any "joy on controller" that comes packaged in with the switch. It's perfect if you play any hardcore games on switch like Darksouls, a fighting games, or even Breath of the Wild. The buttons have phenomenal push sensitivity. I know there are othe "more affordable" 3rd party alternatives to this control bit I assure you if you pay the (at the moment) Amazon price of $50 you wont regret it. Tbh I'm probably buying a second one sooner than later.
Llegó en muy buen estado y funciona de maravilla.Gran producto, lo recomiendo si quieren un mando más cómodo para jugar con la Nintendo Switch.

I have been a gaming for over 20 years and this controller exceeded my expectations. The Joy-Cons are great, but if you haven't used the Pro Controller on BOTW, you are missing out. This is not only the best controller Nintendo has ever made, but it rivals XBOX and PlayStation. Extremely comfortable and light, but also feels natural to use. If a game supports the Pro Controller, I don't use anything else.

I'm really impressed with this controller. I spend a lot of my time playing games (Xbox, PS4, PC) and I'm relatively new to the Switch scene. The controller feels great, and has the high quality rumble feel you get from the joycons. It works really well for Fortnite, Mario games, Zelda, and pretty much anything else where you want a traditional controller feel. Worth the money for me.

I’ve had it for about 6 or 7 months and it has worked well until some of the buttons started becoming less responsive and the left joystick started drifting. I loved everything about the controller before these issues, I’m just upset that Nintendo makes their Switch controllers so cheap and sell them for so much.

I've been gaming since the NES days and have held just about every controller out there and I gotta say, this one is up there with the all time comfiest controllers. Whoever designed the ergonomics of this thing should win an award. The price is kind of high at $70, but if you are on a 10 hour Splatoon marathon and want a comfy grip, it's worth the money.

I love the larger one piece pro controller. Reminds me of the Xbox controller. Good battery life and no connectivity issues. I prefer this controller over the small ones or the weird rectangle shape they make when using the provided adapter. Buttons are a lot bigger on this one and using it just feels more natursl.

The Joy-cons are sufficient for portable gaming, but no way would I use them when the console is docked. The Pro controller is better in every way, shape, and form. The battery lasts a surprisingly long time too, more than double the duration of the Sony Dualshock 4 controllers.
Very comfortable controller.  Great build quality, far better than my Xbox or PS controller.  Feels solid and is very responsive.  Battery life is incredible. Bit expensive but worth it.

The controller is fantastic. Best controller layout I've ever used. It is a must buy if you own a switch. I have 2. One for me and one for my girlfriend. The only thing that might not be as good as other controllers is the triggers are not pressure sensitive. They just click in. So if they end up making a racing game they can't have half throttle with the trigger half pushed in. 100% would recommend. And Amazon had it at the best price I've seen $58.

A good combination of DS4 and Xbox controller. Better ABXY buttons and D-pads than the Xbox controller while maintaining a similar grip feel. Great BT connection, good battery life, good rumble, no analog triggers.DS4 has better D-pads but the grip and the button layout don't fit me well.

I play my switch docked most of the time so I started feeling the need to upgrade over the joy cons. Though they are great for their intended purpose (sharing, playing undocked, Wii-mote & nunchuck style) joy cons just don't compare to a traditional controller. The pro has a solid weight and feel to it and is just flat out more ergonomic (the button spacing is an especially great improvement over the joy cons).

The Pro controller operates as designed and is nice to hold. I love the rumble (admittedly one of the reasons I went with the Pro), and the charge is great. I didn't time it out but I don't have to charge the controller often. I plug it in whenever it gives the low battery indicator on the TV screen. I wish they had more designs that were around the same price point, but I'm satisfied with this sleek black color anyhow.

This would easily replace my Xbox One Elite controller for PC Gaming if it had buttons/paddles underneath.The face buttons are nice and big - I played Super Smash with joycons on launch night, and my thumbs hurt real bad the next day. I don't have that problem with this controller, and it has a very high build quality.

Honestly the best controller I've had. The feel to this controller is way nicer than the  other consoles in my opinion. The grip is nice and motion controls work amazing with this controller. The only down side I see on it si the price but aside that is a great controller.

Great controller. If you are a Switch owner considering another controller, I would recommend having one Pro Controller around as it offers a better experience. It offers a better grip, a more accurate and sensitive analog stick, and better tactile qualities to the buttons. In case you haven't noticed, it doesn't split into two like the typical Switch Joy-Cons. The only setback is that it must be charged every now and then via the Switch power chord, but you can get a charging dock.

Good controller, it’s almost like the Xbox360 controller honestly, and it arrived early for me. Battery life is amazing and the way the controller is shaped is great for extended play time. I don’t have a use for the Amibo scanner at the time of writing this review 10/10 would recommend.

Have you used these? They are a million times better than the joycon, but I've been an Xbox guy for over a decade, so maybe I'm biased. Get this if you play frequently on a TV screen. One of the best controllers I've ever owned!

Really a nice controller. Better than ps4 but not quite Xbox one. The build quality is good. I like the no frills button layout. Comfortable and weighty but not heavy. The joysticks feel slightly cheap (classic Nintendo). Overall I'm very very pleased with this design. I hope they continue this trend!
I like xenoblade series so when I see this controller, I thought why not?also since I barely take the switch out of the dock,
This controller does not have a microphone.Overall it is very comfortable. The switches feel like good quality.

I liked this controller for about a 3 months. Purchased this in Jan and now it will say its connected but the trigger buttons with stop working along with the analog sticks getting stuck in random directions while they are in a anchored state. Battery is fully charged and the switch is stationed about 2 feet away from the controller. I'm not sure what the problem may be but this wasn't an issue the first couple months. great controller otherwise.

The joy cons are nice and cute but to get the most out of ur gaming experience, especially fighting games, the pro controller is a must have. I got my official Nintendo switch controller for what I consider a steal and it works jus fine.

Its a good controller with a similar layout than the xbox one controller, something that i really liked about this controller is the fact that it has a huge range, i can be playing with my switch on the living room and the controller would automatically connect and work even though its on my house second floor far away from the console. For smash players like me, its a good controller but needs to get used to it because of the layout. But so far so good

a must have if you own a Nintendo switch.  the controller it comes with just sucks if your older than 10yrs old.  just buy it.  durability seems fine had it for a while as long as your mature and dont throw it around it should hold up fine ... unlike my 150$ xbox one elite controller... thats another story....

Great controller for nintendo switch, perfect sticks, very comfortable to hold, and materials are superior to xbox one wireless controllers. usb type-c charging is very convenient as well. vibration works really cool in supported games.
Gamers know that lag is not acceptable in the controller. The amount of lag in this controller is just enough to drive you nuts. Unfortunately, I had to return the controller because of this.

I had been using split Joy Cons while playing Breath of the Wild and was pretty satisfied but within minutes of using the Pro Controller I was highly impressed. The motion controls are accurate and the thumbsticks feel great and have high accuracy. The battery life is amazing as well. I can go about a week before I have to charge the controller and I use it quite often.

I didn't have any issues with the regular switch controllers besides battery life. I don't have to charge this one as often. Plus have the ability to play plugged in if I ever did need to. The playing is easier with the traditional style buttons than standard switch controllers as well. Glad I made the purchase.

A must for Nintendo Switch owners. The only way to enjoy Mario Kart 8, Zelda: Breath of the Wild and many other games (like the upcoming Splatoon!)I'm surprised that you could find a controller that actually feels superior to an Xbox One controller, but this does.
