The button placement Is very familiar to other consoles and it feels very durable. Buttons are all very clicky and responsive. I would definitely recommend taking a look at this if you own a Switch, it is a must!

The controller worked fine until I needed to charge it, and then it simply won't charge. How can a controller that costs $80 be broken in such a fundamental way? I've tried half a dozen different solutions and none of them work. Defective controller.

This controller is so much more comfortable to use than the one that comes with the Switch. I haven't had any issues with control stick drifting, which seems common in generic brands.  The battery lasts a long time, and the vibration response is good. Everything you could want in a controller. I still use the joy-cons for multiplayer games like Mario Party or Rayman. This controller stands out for BOTW or first person games.

finally! a controller I can comfortably use! I never bother with the joy-cons anymore unless I have guests to entertain. I wish a free one came included with the switch console to be honest, but either way, this was a good purchase. also comes with the motion sensors as well, so when I play breath of the wild and have to deal with those moving puzzles, or aim by moving my controller, I can do so easily.

I just got a Switch for Christmas and wanted a real controller to use for my games when it was docked. So far I've really loved this controller. Had no issues with it and it lasts forever. I've played like hours and hours without it losing any charge and it feels good in your hands. Well worth the money and I'm glad I bought it.

Almost everything about this controller is perfect. The sticks feel as good as an Xbox One controller. The A B X Y buttons are perfectly sized and feel great to press. The only down side is the D-Pad. If you're looking for a controller with a good D-Pad this is not the controller for you. Inputs are not as precise as you want and it's a little too spongey. My other minor issue it the layout of the Plus, Minus, Home, and Screenshot buttons. When playing games like BoTW and fortnite I find myself accidentally pressing the screen shot rather than minus that would bring up the map. Not the biggest issues but I thought it to be notable. All in all a great controller for switch.

This is a great controller for the Nintendo Switch. It's too bad the price point is so high. I was able to get mine for $62 here, which is $20 off of official price, but even still, very high for a controller. I only use my joycons in portable mode now, and I rarely take my switch with me, so this is almost 100% exclusively my controller. Very satisfied even if it did drain my bank account to buy...

It's good most of the time. When the battery got to half the controller started disconnecting or just acting up. I guess it's an easy way for me to know it needs a charge.One thing to note for those who want to modify the case, the tiny screws strip very easily so be careful.
After 5 months of use, the D-pad is giving false upward pushes.This is obviously after the 3 months that Nintendo warrants this product. Typical.

Really like the weight and feel of this controller. It doesn’t feel cheap but rather well-made and sturdy. It just feels nice to hold in my hands, especially for long sessions. The battery life is also excellent having only need to charge it after maybe a weeks worth of using it. If you’re interested in a traditional controller for your Switch and you feel the Joy Cons aren’t doing it for you, I would easily recommend this controller.
Got this to play Animal Crossing after the drift on my left Joycon got really bad. I've been happily playing all my Switch games with this controller ever since. It's a nice and comfy option!

I think this is the best controller for the switch. Unfortunately, after 2 years, I started to get major drift from the left joystick. I mainly use the pro controller instead of the joycons. I don't really like the idea of buying a new pro controller every 2 years.

I found the joycons in the grip perfectly serviceable and didn't really feel like I was enjoying Breath of the Wild any less without the pro controller. However, after getting this controllers it's definitely a very noticeable improvement and feels great while playing Zelda. It's a bit pricey as far as console controllers go, but I'd definitely recommend if you are about to sink 50+ hours into playing Zelda on your TV.
Too expensive like most of the peripheral items and games - the console is reasonably priced. Like razors and blades - it's a model that works for the business... so I'm shaving only twice a week :)

The D-Pad doesn't work properly due to a major design flaw - it's a widespread and known issue, but Nintendo doesn't seem to care enough to acknowledge or fix it. The controller is comfortable, but impossible to use for games like Puyo Puyo Tetris or other games that require precise use of the D-Pad. Google it and you'll find many complaints about the same issue.

Connects with switch good. Will connect to multiple systems if needed.. Very comfortable. Futs hands perfectly. Just the right size. Great response from buttons. Buttons are solid and heavy duty. Holds charge for days without needing recharge.

Had to buy this, the nunchucks that come with the system have very poor connections and do t reach more than a few feet away. The pro controllers have excellent reach and no noticeable lag. They come highly recommended by me. A must for any gamer.

*THIS* is the way a Nintendo controller should feel.  Not that I have any issues with the Joy-Cons that attach to the Switch feel, don’t get me wrong.  This has a nice heft to it, you don’t have to hold your hands so far apart.  I’ll probably end up purchasing another one so two of us can play together.

Works great, responsive, comfortable. Not sure if it is blutooth or if it works with other products such as pc, android or apple. Force feedback is weak. Battery life is amazing! Not sure if it is the 40hrs it claims to be, but it will get you a weeks worth of moderate game play on a single charge. Supports NFC for your amiibos.

Better than using joycons and a grip. However this controller feels inferior to PS4 and Xbone controllers. Sad as it costs more :(. The ABXY buttons are a bit rattley and feel more like my $20 logitech controller than a proper $60-70 console controller. Also the sides of the joysticks are shedding plastic dust after normal use. A little dismayed for the price.

3 days into animal crossing NH with this controller it started getting drift on the left analog stick. I mean have you've ever tried hitting a resource or money rock with drift? It's not fun if you miss your shots and miss out on the resources. Anyways I'd probably get a cheaper controller if the drift starts up this badly after only 3 days.

Works very well. It was something I was looking for at I’ve time, toinorice precuaionjumpsin Mario odyssey.  But I’m going to be honest here — Id like to communicate that I personally think it’s too high priced, and that I don’t feel the need to use it.  I’ve grown to love the native Joycons. Ymmv.

I hated spending the money on this controller, even on sale, because it's overpriced and should be what's included with the console. They Joycons are pretty terrible controllers for games that require more precise controls and this controller does a much better job. Wait for a sale and buy one.

The Nintendo Switch is great and a lot of fun. What is not so much fun was the Joycon controllers. I purchased one of these controllers for myself and my son and it has made our gaming experience so much better. I recommend this controller

I love almost everything about this controller. It feels amazing in my hands, it has very tactile buttons and the letters are not painted on. My only slight issue is the dpad being all one button I can sometimes hit up or down when I only mean to hit left and right or vice versa. But all around fantastic controller.

Nintendo did a really nice job with these! Wireless, really long battery life, recharges while plugged into the dock, comfortable to use...I don't even know why you'd buy a third-party controller. The Joycon controllers are just too narrow for my big hands, but the Pro Controller is perfect.

Best purchase for my Nintendo Switch yet.  This controller is so comfortable to hold, and its battery lasts so long that I sometimes forget to charge it after 4 days of straight gaming.  This is a must buy for all Switch gamers out there.  And if you catch it on sale, consider yourself blessed that you will get this great controller at a lower price.

Love this controller and do not have any regrets on buying. Comfortable and a much better size compared to the joy cons. Liked it enough to even buy for a friend on their birthday. The price is well worth it. Also comes with a cable to charge the controller (connects to the switch base) that you can also use  to charge the Switch. Very convenient for travel I used to have to unplug the switch AC adapter which is a hassle.

I don't play games very often but when I used this controller, it was awesome. I tried one game for 10 minutes and the controller was comfortable, responsive, and just as advertised. I need to play more games with this controller. One day I will. What I can say is this... If you plan on playing one game for 10 minutes, then this controller us made for you.

You have a lot of money invested in your Nintendo Switch and all your games. Do NOT go cheap on a third party controller! The genuine Nintendo Pro controller is a thing of beauty, it fits the hands perfectly, has no input lag and just screams quality. Accept nothing less.

They're kinda expensive for a controller, but I'm telling you - they are worth EVERY PENNY.  They're cordless, the battery life is crazy long, like over a week, buttons in great places, comfortable to hold for long sessions, and HIGH QUALITY construction all around.  Built to last.  Built for abuse.  You're gonna love it.

The best controller I've ever tried. It just naturally attaches to your hand. Even if you ignore the extra features, the rumble, the Amiibo, the Motion, this controller just feels AMAZING to hold, the buttons are big and have great tactile feeling, the joysticks are great, it easy to hold on a regular sized arm for hours without producing cramps.I only wish it had ZR+ZL analog triggers like the gamecube controller, but that isn't enough to take a star away from what is the best controller I've tried. Battery life is fantastic, Amiibo functionality is flawless, motion controls work without issues, and the rumble is indeed a step above regular rumble on other controllers.

Good controller - an absolute must for me since the joy cons are extremely uncomfortable... the joy cons make my hands cramp. Just seems like really poor ergonomics. Anyways, loved this remote until it just refused to charge anymore. The LED charging indicator won’t come on anymore. I’ve had it for almost two years with super limited usage. Maybe played through 3 or 4 games is all since I don’t have a lot of free time. Repair cost is $40 so I’ll either just buy a new one or try a non-Nintendo version since these are so expensive.

I do not know how I used my Nintendo Switch for two years without the Pro Controller. Feels great, works great. Turns on the console so you don’t have to get up from the couch (this was the selling point that convinced me over getting a third party controller; yes I’m that lazy!). The only thing that noticed is that the HD rumble is not as intense as in the Joy-Cons, but it probably had to do with the size.

This controller is as comfortable as an Xbox or PS controller. The buttons are tacky and clicky, with no mush feelings. This is a great controller to pick up if you play in docked mode a lot as the dual joycons feel weird after long sessions. Also, 40 hour battery life is phenomenal, I need to charge this like once a week.

This controller is very comfortable and feels well built. Connects very easily and let's you play your games more comfortable than with the joycons! I would say it's a must have for frequent Switch users.

This controller should come with a new switch, but at least they lowered the price to $55 because if they didn't I would have just used the joy-cons. $70 is just way too much of a cash grab, always wait for a sale.

This pro controller is awesome! Only thing is this special edition controller overpriced because it’s limited edition but the pro controller itself is durable and had a long lasting battery. Sadly joy cons are expensive and break easily you need 2 for lots of games and the pro controller is great and all but the downside is u need a stand if u wanna play with the controller comfortably with the switch in handheld mode. Buy a pro controller (black color)  since it’s the best controller I used and owned since GameCube (even better in my opinion)!

Literally the best gaming controller to this date. I love the pro controller. It's not took heavy or too light. Its comfortable and has a good joystick distance. I think I've charged it 3 times in the last year of owning it so the battery lasts really long. Worth every penny

I bought this controller as the joy-cons are not the most ergonomic or comfortable controllers to use for extended periods of time. This is a great controller and it feels solid. My only complaint is that I wish it was a little bigger. I find my fingers overlapping a little bit when holding the controller.

I bought the Nintendo Pro Controller because the JoyCons have such a terrible "drifting" problem.  So far the new Pro controller works perfectly.  I didn't think you could activate the game with the controller but you can.  Just hit the "home" button on the controller and the game will start.

The most comfortable controller I've ever used, especially compared to the small size of the joy-cons. Not recommended if you mostly play in handheld mode, though. Also, this sometimes goes on sale for about $50, so I'd wait until then to pick it up. The full $70 MSRP is too much for any controller, no matter how comfortable.
The Pro Controller is the best video game controller that I have ever used.Pros

The joycon's vertical orientation hurts my wrists after a short time of use, but the pro controller is extremely ergonomic and easily one of the best controllers on the market today. Well worth the price.
Nearly perfect controller. The force feedback however is softer that the joycon and a bit disappointing. I expected better from a larger body. The the feel and quality otherwise is excellent.

The best controller for a Nintendo console. It is comfortable, and feels modern. The joysticks are super satisfying and feel buttery smooth. The buttons are big, but not too big. It has motion controls and vibration, and I destroyed all my friends in smash bros with it. If you're going to get a controller, get this one.
Great controller, very sensitive in terms of some directional inputs which is great for some game but super annoying for others. Overall a great build and solid feel.

The perfect wireless controller! It honestly feels like Nintendo took notes from Sony and Microsoft with the design. Feels slightly chunky in your hands so there’s something to grip but ergonomically perfect when gripping the handles.

Outstanding controller. I purchased this just to play Zelda. The Joy-Cons are very tiny for my large hands. This controller has big buttons and the material is terrific. Don't hesitate, buy this instead of the generic controllers.

This controller worked really well for 4 months. I'm not a power user - I play maybe 5 hours a week. I used this primarily to play smash and skyrim. A few months later, and the controller won't pair with my system when I plug it in with the USB-C cable. I've used multiple cables and multiple ports, to no avail. Bought a new 3rd party controller, and it works just fine. I'm kicking myself for spending $60 on this official controller when the quality is seemingly not up-to-par with Nintendo's standards.

Awesome controller for the Switch. Pro Controller comes almost completely charged. Once you plug in the USB cord, an orange/ambient light comes on. Once it goes off it means the controller is fully charged. No instructions so had to find this information online.
Feels great right out of the box.  Button presses are crisp, sticks are clean, and the controller feels great in the hand.  Love it, very happy I finally jumped on this at a good price
While a Switch is perfectly functional with the joy cons it comes with, this controller just makes it so much better if you’re playing on a tv. It’s weighty and comfortable. I have no complaints.

The D-Pad constantly registers wrong inputs and the front plate of the controller looks like cheap butt. The rest of the controller is fine. If you want a good version of this controller, be prepared to modify it, aka opening it to change the terribleness.
Thing works mint right off the shelf could of fell cause it had a lil dent in the box but hey I fell when on my head once or twice and I’m fine

So my girlfriend plays a lot in her's Nintendo Switch. I tried playing it sometimes and it just doesn't fit my hands.She said, hey, why don't we order the pro controller then ? It will fit perfectly !

Apparently the competitors can only handle about a 4 hour battery life, but this beast last ~40 hours, which is amazing. I plug it in periodically so I haven't tested the 40, but I've kept it on the couch for extended periods of time and find it responsive and comfortable.

It took me a while to feel comfortable buying one of these because the MSRP is a bit high for the product, but in hand, these Pro controllers are fantastic. They feel incredibly well made and are hands down, the comfiest way to play the Switch. They also come with a charging cord which is nice.
My husband loves this controller. It's much easier on his hands than holding the switch to play games with our kids. It's wireless, so you can move it around with ease.
Would have been 5 stars if not for being overpriced, in my opinion.So much nicer to use this at home than the stock joycons.

For everything other than Smash, this is my go-to controller. I’m terrified of accidentally crushing my joycons in a heated Mario Kart race and that’s always in the back of my mind to be gentle when I use them, but the pro controller feels perfectly constructed and I never have that fear. It’s so comfortable I sometimes forget I’m holding a controller in my hands & gaming becomes second nature

Un control que vale la pena para jugar mas fácil. Viene con su cable de carga USB que se puede conectar a la consola del Nintendo Switch. Al momento de conectarlo automáticamente se sincroniza a la consola del Nintendo Switch.

Great addition to my switch. I play my switch mostly docked so the standard joy con holder controller had an odd angle for my wrists. I got a full week of play on the controller before I had to plug it into n and charge it.
Controller drift in both joy sticks! And it’s from Nintendo? And during the shut down no returns! Hope they do the fix for free at least! But we will see.

Must have for every serious Switch player! I wish I had bought this WITH the Switch, because playing Breath of the Wild with it is a dream! It stays charged for a really impressive amount of time, too. Great weight to it. Might purchase a second one for multiplayer games that it would be good for.

I've had this controller for under a year. 3-4 months in I started noticing that the R stick was not responding properly but issue was not that bad as far as effecting my game play so I thought maybe it wasn't an issue. About a month later R stick got a mind of it's own. Without touching controller will move in any direction. I have not been able to use controller for any game without it having a spasm. Called Nintendo support to troubleshoot with no solution found other than replacing whole controller or repairs that are close in price of the controller itself.
My son is very pleased with this switch controller, which he says is dramatically better than a standard switch controller. This "worthy upgrade" easily earns five stars.

The joy-con controls are nice however the buttons is a bit smaller than what I’m used to.  Pro controller has the weight and solid feel of a ps4 or xbox controller.  Feels better for me on my hands.  A well made controller.  Just wish they had more color choices.

Having played for almost 10 months with the JoyCons and then switching to the Pro Controller I cannot be more happy with this purchase. It has enhanced my experience with the Switch (which was great to begin with) and made it awesome to play shooter games (i.e Fortnite) and Smash, amongst other. I definetly recommend it!

I've tried to use the dock for the joycons that came with my switch for a while and it's just way too small for my hands. I love to play the switch docked and using the Pro controller is really the way to go. All of the same functionality but it is significantly more ergonomic.

If you live with your significant other you WILL fight over this remote. It is amazing, all of the buttons are smooth and don’t stick. And there is no lag!! By far the best remote I have ever used (that includes xbox and ps4)

If your an adult you owe it to yourself to get a pro control. The comfort is worth the cost alone. The joycons are great but in handheld mode your hands cramp after a few hrs catching some shiny pokemon. But with a pro control your hands stay cramp free.  Battery lifes excellent, and comes with a usb charge cable.

Love the feel and size of the controller. The buttons and d-pad has nice click feeling to it when precessed down. Fits perfect on my hand. Its a Nintendo product so quality assurance is already there. Works perfect for fighting game or any game really. Use it when i play on the the Tv screen. Love it, no issues.
I never would have bought this without my friends telling me it's worth it. I was fine with the joycon controller until I tried this thing. Now I can't stand going back to the joycons.
This is a sturdy controller, excellent batery life. Cheaper than buying a switch joy-con controller. I prefer using my Pro controller instead of the joy-con. I bought another one for my son.
It feels durable, the buttons are great, the gyro motion is great...the dpad is garbage.  This disappoints me as Nintendo should know better.

This remote is so good, it saved my fingers from arthritis. Feels great in your hands that you don't want to go back to use the joycons. But the joycons are good when you want to move your hands around freely. I don't regret buying it.

So much better for playing Smash than the joy cons! No issues with connecting to my Switch and it feels like it will hold up to more abuse than the joy cons. Only reason it's not getting five stars is because I wish the ABXY buttons could be differentiated in a way. Not radically different like the GameCube controller but something at least.

I am an adult and play video games casually. This controller is so much easier to use and comfortable in my hands than the JoyCons that come with the Switch. The battery life is very long, around 40 hours of playtime, and I've never had it die on me. My son also uses this to play Switch games, and his smaller hands are also able to use it comfortably.
I like the way the controller feels in my hand while emulating gamecube and switch games. Easy to connect to the PC via Bluetooth. Nothing bad about the product that I can think of.
Really cool controller it’s really dark and the buttons are hard to see. So it can take some getting used to. If you have small hands I don’t recommend this for you. Enjoy just a great controller...

The Pro Controller is a nice gaming controller but about $10-$20 to expensive.  I like using this over the Joy-Con remotes and have found the controller to be precise, comfortable, and easy to use.  I'm just not sure why Nintendo is charging so much for this controller.  I spent less on similar Wii U controller.  For families to really adopt the Switch platform, I think Nintendo needs to get the price down by the holiday season.

Do not buy! My controller has a downward drift on the left joystick and I’m still waiting on the claim I submitted to nintendo MJ this ago. Makes the controller so frustrating it’s unusable. Very dissatisfied with this product.

I'm so happy I purchased this for the Nintendo Switch. I like the Joy Cons, but I wanted to test the pro controller. I must admit, I'm using the pro controller more.My hands are comfortable using the pro controller than using the Joy Cons which now goes to the second local player.

I think Nothing can really beat the Wii U pro controller because it has like 70 hours of battery life. I would say that The pro controller comes a close 3rd place as nintendos best controller (2nd would obviously be the gamecube).
Spend the money, it is worth it.  Very similar in size and feel to a PS4 remoteMuch better than the joycon setup and essential for playing Zelda.

Fantastic controller, copies king of console controller design with offset analog sticks, but missing something that limits Nintendo Switch overall...a headphone jack on controller for docked play.  My son has to sit right in front of TV so headphone cable will reach console.  Not sure why Bluetooth support isn't baked in allowing connection for chat???  Why Nintendo?  Overall, great controller, good battery and premium fill compared to $40 price point wireless options.

The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is nearly perfect, but it has some down sides the d-pad and no analog triggers. I love everything about this controller, it's such a perfect gamepad and would almost be better than the Xbox 360 if it weren't for the lack of analog triggers. The d-pad sucks but so do most so I can let that slide but I just I wished this controller was analog.

If you like the other game systems controllers then you will definitely like this controller.  Has built in rumble and is easy to recharge or you can play while it is charging.  I use it over the supplied controllers exclusively.

absolute must buy for the switch.  the joy con things are fine.  but when it comes to fine tuned movements like shooting arrows in Zelda - BotW you are going to see a huge difference here than if you used the little paddle controllers.

This is a must for anybody using the switch as a home console. Yeah the joy cons do a great job for what they are, which is portable, but for those heavy couch sessions the pro controller feels better and is more precise
I prefer this over the joycons because it fits in your hands much more naturally. It holds a charge for a long time, too.I do wish there were more colors to choose from, though.

Since purchasing the controller, I've had little use for the Switch joycons. I've had charging issues with the joycons, so not having to deal with that is great. This controller feels much more comfortable as well.

LOVE the new switch controllers. I swear, they’re even better than both the Xbox and Playstation controllers I’ve used in the past. These controllers on regular retail are a bit expensive at $80, but at the discouted price, they’re just perfect. My favorite controller. Glad I bought one for both my girlfriend and I :)

bought this Jan 8th of this year now is doesn't work. Was I sent a reused one or is it that these things only last 5 months.? I'm upset that I cannot play a game with my grandson because this controller is defective

This makes this console extremely playable. I prefer this controller over the ps4 and Xbox equivalents. You can use this with your PC as well, connecting via Bluetooth. I feel like if you’re playing on a TV, this is a must have quality of life upgrade.

Yes, it is expensive but I have adult-sized hands and playing on the smaller controller was giving me cramps. This is perfect sized and felt like a PS3 controller, but for a Switch. Just pay it. Your hands will thank you. I did not try the other lower priced competitors, but if you're going to be spending hours playing a game, then you might as well pay for quality!

Works AMAZING!! So much better than using the little switch remotes! Of course, on some games you don’t have a choice... you have to use the tiny switch remotes. When you do have a choice, use this! ESP if you care about your hands or you’re an adult. This is smooth controlling, good feeling in your hand without being to heavy. I enjoy using it. Wish it came in pink!
Great battery life. I've used the controller for days on end without it dying. I have the newer switch and the battery on the joy cons is about 4 hours so the pro controller is wonderful.

Must-have for using my switch when it's on the base. I'm not a fan of using the Switch Controllers alone, or in one of the controller holders. These are pricey but they are very sturdy, and hold a charge for a LONG time.

this is a steal. cheaper than best buy. too bad they had a promotion going on the next day i ordered. But still. it's only 5 dollar difference and i really think it's worth it if you are playing Zelda like i do.

Feels good, works good. only slight issue i don't like is the triggers, in inner edge of the triggers on the side facing you when you hold them are raised and the edge along that raised area is a little thin and with my big hands it can rub a blister on your finger if you're using the trigger a lot repeatedly.

Right shoulder button only works like 70% of the time, really unfortunate. I've tried blowing into the space underneath it and updating the controllers software in the system settings, nothing works.If you can get one that actually works, it feels nicer than using the Joycons in the holder dock thing.

This controller allows me to unleash my full potential and enables me to dominate my enemies in super smash bros. My rage knows no bounds and my finger’s lightning reflexes are on par with the controllers own super thinking mega awesome feel good gripping button sensitivity. It can withstand a thousand rage quits and blunt force trauma to my own head. All in all, it works.

Great controller. Phenomenal feel. I like ps4 a tiny tiny bit better but this is absolutely great.BUT, the rumble is a joke. Plain and simple. It's actually worse in this than the 2 switch controllers.
This controller is super nice! I already own both the regular, and Splatoon2 Pro controllers but I might have to say this one is my favorite as far as design goes.

I was at first skeptical about how much this cost compared to if it would be comfortable, and I had no way to test this controller before I bought it. Once I got it, I could see why it's worth that money. It feels amazing. The sticks feel better than the joycons. If you need a controller for the switch and you can afford it, get this controller.

This controlleris heavy which I can appreciate.  The button input is smooth and quiet--no 'clicking', which I also appreciate.  it has a nice wide frame for my hands and feels comfortable for hours of play.  It takes no effort to recharge and can be used even while charging.  it can even be used while charging from an external source (i.e. not directly connected to the Nintendo Switch).  A must buy for any Switch owner!

My husband wanted a good sized controller for his switch. The joy cons aren't really comfortable for him to use because they're just so tiny, even with the special holder they come with. This controller feels very similar to an Xbox controller. It fits his adult hands comfortably so he can play his switch.

This is almost a perfect controller.Almost. I had a pairing issue when I first opened it but after a unpair and repair it's works marvelously. My only small gripes are with longer gaming sessions is the grips can get a little slippery. But maybe that's just my hands. Also if the switch isn't on but any buttons are being pressed/held then it will continually try to sync with the console. Which uses battery. I left mine in a bag for a week and when I used it again it was on low battery. No worries though. Charges in about 2 hours even when in use.  Definitely would recommend.

While it is a bit pricey, I feel that this controller is well worth it, especially for games like Zelda.  The analog sticks are much more precise (the are also taller, which helps).  And it feels great in your hands.The original Switch controllers are great for my little ones (little hands, little controllers work great for Mario Kart).  But this controller is perfect for me.

Best controller for Nintendo and very close to my favorite Xbox 360 controller. It's an extra $10 more then the average controller currently, but well worth the price. Its priced higher due to the advance rumble, NFC, and the motion control that's added to the controller with the standard buttons. There are no trigger button that you also see in the PS4 or Xbox controller. BEWARE that this is $70 and because its limited, scalper will make it higher.

I got this to play Smash Bros since the joy cons are a huge pain to use. It's comfortable and works great. The battery life also seems really good and lasts through multiple long gaming sessions. Highly recommend, especially if you aren't a fan of using the joy cons for everything.

I refused to buy this controller for a year or more because for the price it looked far less quality than other console controllers. When one came up on sale and I had some credit I decided to give it a try. I'm super happy with this controller. It's far higher quality than the pictures make it look. It has a nice heft and feels good in hand. I wish I wouldn't have waited so long to get one.

It stays charged for a long time.  And I love the way it feels. I'm glad I finally got one. It feels really sturdy too like you could use it as a weapon against burglars. But seriously its a pretty nice controller you can use on steam games on pc too.

This controller just feels really well made. It’s comfortable and the controls are well placed. The battery lasts approximately one half of the age of the universe. It pairs easily and stays paired. Using it to turn on the switch actually works every time.Worth it.

It's worth every penny. No input lag or deadzones. Motion controls are instant and snappy. I've only used it in Splatoon 2 so far but it's improved my game play drastically. Highly recommend. I wouldn't bother with a knock off. Just buy the real deal cause you won't regret it.
Good:Comfortable
I like playing with this controller over the original Switch controllers. Joysticks are much better! Works great and I am happy with my purchase!
Only one level of vibration—hard. Length of vibration varies. Cardinal directions are hard to achieve with the knobs. Cheaply made.

There's not much more you can ask for in a controller. It lasts forever, all of the buttons and joysticks are nice and sturdy, and it has a level of quality to it that I've never seen in a controller ever before, from Nintendo, Playstation, or Xbox. I've even used it with my computer a bit, and it's a dream come true.

Personal preference, but I did not like how it felt to use. The joycons were better. However, after a year or two of regular use the left joycon suffered from a downward drift. This feels allot more substantial and will hopefully hold up better.

Bought this for my son for Christmas, he loves it. I have also used it and have a hard time going back to the joy-cons after usythe pro controller. If I needed another control for the Switch I would by ano, it makes playing Smash Bros and other games so much easier.

I thought the Pro Controller was a bit pricey but MAN is it worth it, it's one of the best controllers I've ever owned. It feels great to use and has a really solid design, plus the D-Pad actually works which makes it perfect for fighting games too (something not many controllers handle very well anymore, sadly). But the fact that you can also sync it to Bluetooth really takes it over the top. And the battery life is ridiculous, I haven't had to recharge it since I got it. I wish the Joy Cons lasted as long as this thing does! I can't recommend it enough.

I think this pro controller is perfect with its bigger buttons and an actual d pad along with a comfortable grip opposed to the littlw joycon grip. This only thing i dont like about this is that the pro controller doesnt have a 3.5mm jack like the ps4 controller (which is also cheaper)

Controller felt great, but 2 months in it developed a gradual downward tilt in the left analogue stick.about a week later the downward drift got so bad it basically rendered the controller unusable. I expected much higher quality from an OEM $70 controller.Save your money and buy a 3rd party controller. Otherwise, I highly recommend buying an extended warranty.
This is the 3rd Pro Controller we have bought for our switch. Each one performs great. Awesome battery life. Price is higher then the knockoffs but it's worth it in the end.

Awsome...i have bug hands and thr joycons were way too small, people werent giving the pro great reviews so i held off looming for something else but finally broke down and paid and glad i did it works great.

I held off on buying this controller for a while because the regular Joy-cons were great for Mario Odyssey and Mario Kart. I realized I was putting a little too much stress on them later on in games like Stardew and Smash where you are constantly moving/attacking.This controller completely changed that. It’s very sturdy and easy to use. I’ve barely used the Joy-cons, unless a game requires them, since I purchased it. It will definitely improve your experience on the Switch, especially with the retro Nintendo Online games. It’s worth the money!

This controller will handle anything you throw at it, and does so quite efficiently as well. I don't think I've even come close to draining the battery, but I still charge it when I'm done to be extra careful.

This feels amazing and a massive improvement over the controller config from the original switch packaging.  It most certainly is not worth the 70 bucks it costed a while ago OR the 55 I paid for it. For a controller, a good one but it's still JUST a controller, it should have either come included with the switch for a bit more money OR it should only be worth maybe 40 to 50 MAX.
I love this controller. I was annoyed when my husband bought this because we had 2 sets of the minis already but now when we play as a family I always use this controller

Whoever designs this controllers understands comfort because it feels great, everything about it is nice. I expected a nice controller for the money and I am still wowed . You know what? I don't think I can form all the sentences right. My love for the controller is just gushing out, so I'm just going to end my review.

Update: June 15th 2019:I had Nintendo replace the controller that was JUST OUT OF WARRANTY and ended up paying almost 50 dollars, and now the new controller is failing AGAIN, two months out of the new 90 day warranty!  I highly recommend getting a protection plan for this, it would be well worth the money as these controllers are not made well.

I like this controller a lot as I don't like to use the standard joycons for the Switch.  In my opinion, the price of this controller is a bit high for what it is compared to similar controllers for the switch and other consoles.
Hard to back to the hand cramp inducing joycons with tiny buttons after getting one of these.

Earlier on, I had made the mistake of purchasing a "Power A" type controller for my brother to play with me.  Turns out it was wired, and the cable wasn't long enough to actually reach our seats from the Switch.  This device is wireless, and even contains the gyro functions of the Joy-Cons.  If you prefer a traditional controller, make sure to get the "Pro" type and not the "Power A"- you can see these designations on the box label.

Amazing controller and love the asemetrical sticks. Face buttons and sticks work great, battery life is phonominal. My only small gripe would be that the triggers are buttons and not triggers. Comfortable as hell, would put in between xbox one and ps4 controller due to the asemetrical stick preference.

The description says it is original Nintendo Switch Pro controller. Even the packaging is of pro controller. But what I got was a knock off fake controller. Started a refund process. Don't trust this listing.
Solid controller! So happy I bought this. The joy cons are just way to small when you are just chilling on the couch and not having them connected to the console.

A far better alternative to using 2 joycons that,  by the way continually disconnect.  It's a sturdy controller that sits nicely in your hands.  The only reason I gave it a 4* rating is because they are expensive.  Otherwise a 5* product
The left joy stick went just a few months after I bought it
Just got mine a few weeks ago but so far I love it! This is my 6th different Switch controller now and none of the others even compare to it
genuine product, easily hooks up to the switch no problems. I like to add a magnetic plate on the back so I can secure it to a magnetic holder
This is much more useful and comfortable than using the joycons and now I don't have to worry about wear on my left stick!

I would definitely recommend. I know there are other wired controllers out there that are cheaper than the Nintendo switch controller. However, I would definetly recommend this one. The buttons don’t have that clocking noise like the other controllers. It feels really smooth in your hands. I would highly reconmend.

Got this for my son for Christmas, he loves it and says it works well. I'm not sure that I believe is any better than the normal pro controller, but he loves the design. It does have a great grip and it's more comfortable for many games than the Joy Cons.

I don't know if mine is defective, but very frequently when I flick the stick or even just let go of it after holding it all the way in one direction, it inputs the direction opposite to what I was holding when I let go and it snaps back to the center. This has caused me enough deaths in Super Smash Bros by sending me in the opposite direction to render it unusable and is a huge annoyance in basically any other game. A total letdown.

Excellent build quality. If you are looking for a good switch controler thats more like traditional controllers, this is probably your best bet. Cheaper k nock offs might work okay, but lets just say you get what you pay for.
I purchased a cheaper non Nintendo brand but it did not pair properly.  I had no problem with this. Works like a charm.
Much better controller than the joy cons joined together.  Easier to hold and everything is where you exspect it to be.  A bit tricky to charge on charging stations. But that’s a minor thing
So convenient and keeps a charge far longer than the Wii U remotes.Whether on Amazon or in store, the price for these remotes is way too high, and this is the only reason I subtracted a star.

It’s a lifesaver. I don’t mind the Joy-Cons on the go, but this Pro Controller is a necessary purchase for at-home gaming (if you are accustomed to gaming on PS4 and Xbox One). The battery life is phenomenal (I spent all day with this controller on Skyrim) and the buttons are responsive and made for fat fingers like mine.

All around a fantastic controller. Since it arrived I've just about stopped using the joycons altogether in favor of it. It feels very comfortable in my hands and the joysticks and buttons are satisfying to use. If I was pushed to find a flaw, I'd say I wish it was a little heavier. It's a little light for my liking, but I tend to prefer heavier controllers anyway. I cannot recommend this controller enough.

I originally got a cheaper version, it started having issues, so I coughed up for this one.  On occasion, it just "forgets" when I'm pressing buttons, or lags for a second or two.  Obviously totally annoying, but, I guess I will live!

I've had 3. They're great until they stop working. One can no longer hold a charge and two have a right analog stick that doesn't register up consistently. Recalibrating the stick doesn't work. It's due to a common manufacturing issue with one if the components they use. There are multiple forums on this. You can tear it apart and replace the broken component but for a $70 controller that's very disappointing.

Overall, this is a pretty good controller. Ergonomic with a good battery life, and easy to set up. It certainly feels far better to use than two Joycons on a "comfort" grip. Unfortunately, the D-pad is poorly designed, and will often input the wrong direction. So I can't recommend this for anything where precision is necessary, like Tetris or NES games, but it's great for games where the D-Pad isn't essential like Smash Bros or Mario Kart. It's just unfortunate that Nintendo would get this wrong when they had this down in 1983. If they would fix this oversight, I'd consider this an excellent controller.
Did a lot of research and testing of other controllers and this is the best choice I've currently found for the Nintendo Switch. Usb-C charging port is also a welcome sight.

So far so good. I recommend this to anyone that has a Switch. The joy-cons are tiny. This feels like a dualshock or something in that tier. It has long battery life, good vibration, quick button response, and uses a usb-c charging cable to make things easy. Highly recommended.

I purchased this on Amazon to avoid having to go to store and brave holiday crowds. Same product and price as GameStop and Walmart, but delivered to my house in 2 days on Prime. 😀 My kid loves the pro remote. I prefer to use this one on the games it's compatible with vs the joycons.

If you're someone who games a lot (you know who you are) this is leagues better than the Joycons. I personally think this is the best controller made to date for any platform, Nintendo did an amazing job with this one.

the joystick controller is very mediocre.  great for mobile gaming, less so when sitting back and playing off my TV.  bought the pro controller, response is great, feel is great, love the larger trigger pads.  absolute must for anyone playing the switch at home on a larger screen.

I got a lemon. Worked fine for a few weeks (I didn’t use it for a month after). Came back to the classic MarioKart and the controller suddenly pulls HARD to the left. If it didn’t do that I’d give it 5 stars.

The Pro Controller is really nice to use. It's comfortable in your hands and the buttons are all good. It's also very durable like most Nintendo products. I spilled a drink all over this controller, and it still works fine.
Great, high quality product. Definitely go for the wireless controller and not the wired one. No connectivity issues like the included controllers. I love the Amiibo spot which works very quick.

I was so happy when my wife ordered this! Xenoblade Chronicles 2 is a fantastic game and this controller looks amazing. It feels just like a basic Pro Controller, so if you like the Pro Controller and like XC2 then this is a must-have.
Stopped working after four hours of ownership, estimated 2hours of total gameplay.On the main menu, drifting to the left.  Not remedied by restart, charging or unpairing with console.

I'm really glad I purchased this controller. It's made playing on the TV screen a much better experience (especially in Splatoon 2)! I personally find this controller to be much more nicer and comfortable than both the PS4's DualShock 4 and the Xbox One controller. The battery lasts a very long time as well. It comes with a USB-A to USB-C cable that can be plugged into the dock to charge the controller. If you play a lot while docked or even in tabletop mode, this controller is worth the purchase.
Great controller.Just glad I got it for holiday pricing ($55)

Works so much better than the crappy joysticks! With the joystick controllers I have so many problems but this one I do not! My younger siblings love it as well, fits nicely in the hand, would recommend and will probably buy a few more myself in the near future

This feels more comfortable in my hands than the Joycon controller, and it’s already more convenient than sliding those off the Switch every time I want to play a game. I’m not heavily gaming at the moment, so this won’t get a lot of wear and tear, but I like it so far.

Wife got me a switch for Valentine’s Day and got me two of these controllers to play co-op on the TV. These are very well crafted controllers. These are the best, non gimmicky controller Nintendo has produced since the GameCube control. They are sturdy as well.
The joystick section is already broken on this Controller I cannot believe I brought this for a Christmas present and this is what happens when son is very disappointed

Shortly, this is the best controller you can get on the Switch, and one of the best in PC IMO. The only drawback I see is price. I understand that it has twpfeatures that obviusly makes it expensive, but I have never used them: HD Rumble and the Amiibo sensor. If this same controller existed without those two things for like $40-$45, it would get 5 stars. Highly recommended.

the set that came with the game only work to some extent and will intermittently now work, so i bought a second set and they didnt work at all, i bought a pro controller next and again nothing, THIS ONE WORKED my forth try at this

Works great for Mario Kart 8 or Smash Bros. Excellent controller if you are used to Xbox style controllers, as the other switch controllers felt too light and flimsy for my hands, whether they were 3rd party or the included ones with the console.Charges via included USB C style cable. Built in battery lasts weeks between charging, using it for 30 min to an hour a day or so.
I purchased it to play super smash and it made the experience 100x better. I can never go back to playing with the joy-cons.

I bought this to use as a backup while my joy cons charge but now I use it every day. It has a super long battery life (I charge it maybe twice a month and I game every day for several hours) and it is comfortable. Love it!
Great controller... until the left stick starts drifting uncontrollably just after the year warranty expires.
Holding the switch cramps the heck out of my hands. This controller is really comfortable. I have spent countless hours playing the Witcher 3 and Mario Odyssey.
Wtf? Bought the Controller got 2 batteries instead?

This thing saved my Switch. I can't stand the normal switch controllers unless its being played portable style. They are just too awkward and the joysticks are too sensitive when being depressed. This controller feels much more natural and has a good resistance too it.

Love this controller but it is already ghost walking my left stick. Super upset cause it cost $70! This is my second one doing the same things now! Only this one only lasted 3 months! No response when I sent an email. Gonna send one more.

Very glad that I bought the official controller. I have used off-brand models that friends have bought. There is an immediate difference that I noticed in the build quality.The controller itself is very responsive whether it's wired into the console deck or running wirelessly over Bluetooth.
Works as intended, I would suggest this item for anyone that wants the feel of a normal controller on the switch.
Works like it should because it comes from Nintendo.  Connects and syncs seamlessly unlike 3rd party controllers.

Great quality. Feels good in the hands and feels like a quality build. Joysticks have resistance, which is a good thing, kind of like driving a car in that you want to feel the road to maintain control. Without that it would respond erratically. So in short, good product, good buy.

I really love this pro-controller! My boyfriend has the original black one but I wanted something to tell the difference and I didnt want to settle with other budget controllers and I really liked the color scheme of this one! I love it!
Es un excelente control, fácil de manejar y duradero. Ha sido unbuen regalo de navidad para mi

I like this controller, it has a good response time and feel solid.  USB-C connector for charging is super nice.  All the buttons feel good. the only reason it did not get 5 out of 5 is that at the very extreme edges of the motion of the left stick, it feels like it is grinding a little bit.  Not so much as to impair game play but it is noticeable.  Leaps and bounds better than the Joy-cons; in terms of overall feel and experience.  Would most likely buy again.

This is a very good controller, feels great and the battery lasts for days, that I said I don't like the analog sticks, I think they are sticking out way more than they should, I wish they were more low-profile like the joy cons.
Great Nintendo quality product. Exactly what I was expecting good quality very sturdy good battery life etc. no complaints.

I love this controller. Works perfectly and the charge lasts a long time. One complaint is that there is a tiny crack on the top of the controller (see picture). Doesn't seem to effect the controller itself so it's not a huge deal, but still shouldn't be there. Will edit review if customer support helps.

After only 2-3 days of use my A button become super sticky and unresponsive; I always used the controller with clean hands so I have to imagine it was a faulty controller. I'm a bit annoyed this happened with a $75 controller, and that if I return it I won't have the funds but 2-3 weeks to buy a new one.

As the title says, the controller has the slightest bit of drift on the left analog, however it still works just as well as my fiance's controller.We did end up customizing our controllers to tell them apart and the internals for both were the same/similar so, in my unprofessional opinion, it is a legitimate controller.

This controller feels great in the hands.  I know it seems a little on the pricey side, but I am of the opinion that it is totally worth it.  A must have for gamers that plan to spend most of their time playing on a big screen at home.  I felt my hands were cramping up much more on the "controller" that is included for the joy cons.  You can tell that Nintendo did not skimp out on this one. Made with durable, high quality materials.  I am a big believer in you get what you pay for, and I know when you use this controller, you'll believe the same thing.
I love this controller.  It seems to hold a charge forever.  Actually, I play for hours and hours, and have never had it run out of power.  I do put it on the charger every night.
Dont buy in stores. Its 20 dollars cheaper here not on sale. Its a pro controller. Its the next best thing to a xbox elite controller with nintendos legendary craftsmanship.
Feels great in the hands. Everything feels really solid. I can actually tell the difference between this and a cheap controller. I would say it's worth the extra cash
Amazing! Works so well and really creates a better game play having a comfortable controller. Love that it has the home button feature for easy power access.

I love the joycon - they do have a couple of issues. First, they are best for only certain games. Second, they do not take well to the stress some games require and the break or wear out.The Pro-Controller is the compliment for full Switch experience. My son and I love it. It makes adventure or fighting games better due to the ergonomics, it retains a charge better, and it is a more durable construction.

This controller is super convenient and helps me play better at Super Smash Bros Ultimate. Admittedly the controller took some time to get used to, but now I'm more accustomed to it than my OG Gamecube Controller!
Delivered promptly and in good conditionWas European product but works fine with our system

Not only is this a great upgrade from the Joy Cons for my Nintendo Switch, but it's also a great controller for PC gaming too! If you play games on Steam with a controller, then this is a great option. Build quality is fantastic and the grips are textured so that even with sweat on your hands you'll still be able to grip the controller nicely. I play games on both PC and Nintendo Switch, so this controller is the all-for-one controller in my case. Great job, Nintendo!
Garbage dpad, no analog triggers so racing games are beat enjoyed on other consoles. Comfortable to hold and an improvement on Nintendo controllers but really in need of a new revision
I bought this controller because my joycon was drifting bit after about a month of light use this controller started drifting as well.

Great Controller, great feel, great shape, and great layout. My only issue is that the Dpad sometimes registers up or down when you are pressing left or right. Not an overly huge issue unless you are playing Tetris... Which I was, and the Dpad would constantly drop my pieces in the wrong places causing me to lose games. Q.Q
I have had this for about 1 and a half years and it is amazing! The battery is fantastic like 10 hours. The Pro controller is much better than the standard joy-cons!
I love the Nintendo pro controller. Its super high quality and comfortable to play for hours. It also has amazing battery life.  5/5 must buy product if you own a Nintendo switch.
does solid job, connects easily, good range, battery charge seems to last, but seems pricey  (to be fair most "oem" accessories are overpriced, per their business model it seems)
Not quite as good as the xbox controller, but way better than holding the joycons for hours!

WAy better than the Joycons. Those are really hard to use with adult hands and not comfortable at all. The Pro controller fixes that. The only issue I have is that some games do not support it. Common Nintendo get on that!

This controller indeed is at true contender to the legendary Xbox Controller. It's perfect for more Aracdey games than FPS or games that have any shooting involved.The downside? The price is horrendous. But it does have gyro tech inside, so I guess that may explains the ridiculous price?

I bought this for my brother for his early birthday gift. He already has one but nobody likes the joycons compared to this superior controller.Worth the price; you treat it right, it'll treat you right
Battery life is not crazy. Otherwise, a must have for the Nintendo Switch! Especially if you're an adult with large hands and wish to play for hours.

Ok, so I rated this controller a three star because the even though controller works perfectly fine, and as it should work, my problem with it is that when this controller arrived, the left joystick was as shown in the picture. I hate that it’s like this out of the box and looks as if it was used and they gave me a used controller. I’m probably just gonna go with Best Buy from now on because they are much easier to deal with when you get a messed up controller.
I love this controller. It makes playing Switch games so much easier. My hands are too big for the tiny Joy-Cons which makes them feel clumsy. This was a great solution.

Indispensable for the switch.  Makes BOTW even more of a joy to play.  The battery charges fast and outlasts my extended gaming sessions.  Connectivity is a snap too.  Ergonomics are in point!  Highly recommended! 👍👍

At $70 it had better be the best controller around and it is. My favorite was always the Xbox One controller...this one beats it with a slightly better feel and LONG lasting rechargeable battery. How is Microsoft still using double a batteries? Best controller around.

Trying to play some games with my son on those little controllers that come with the Switch is really difficult.  Highly recommend getting this controller.  Works great and has an excellent battery life.
Much better than the little joy cons.  Even when they are in the optional grip thing.  Bigger buttons, bigger joysticks and easier to grip.
Control stick drifting right out of the package
Expensive but I suppose if you want to make sure you're getting your money's worth, you go with the official gear.
I have somewhat larger hands and this was perfect for that.  Fits well in the hand, and the battery seems to last forever.

Much nicer in your hands than the joycons, doesn’t put as much stress in weird areas while playing. Playing Mario kart with the joycons in the comfort grip made my hands ache terribly, I haven’t had that issue with this controller.

This controller is a must have if you have a Nintendo Switch. I have big hands and long plays with the joy cons can be tiresome. With this controller everything feels great! The controller is very high quality and I would say that it is higher quality than other controllers of other systems!
Doesnt have analog triggers. Everything is very clicky feeling and cheap compared to even an Xbox 360 controller. Obviously Nintendo cutting costs on their end while capitalizing on it.

This controller is fantastic. I purchased it specifically to play Smash Bros with as the tiny Joy Cons hurt my hands after a few minutes of intense useage. The controller is very sturdy, as it can take being hurled across the room in anger and keep on working the next round. If you’re someone with anger and pain issues, this is the controller for you!

While the joycons are acceptable to use on the go, a pro controller is a necessity for anyone looking to spend any real time playing on the switch. It is as good as an xbox one controller, although I wish there were a more premium option like the xbox one pro controller. That said it works beautifully and anything extra would just be icing on the cake anyways.

Works great. Expensive but better to buy this than a wireless third party one and have nintendo send an update that breaks the connection. I suggest instead to buy the nintendo ones and save yourself the headache and money.

I've had this for a few weeks so far I'm very happy with it.  It seems well built and comes with a nice charger that plugs into the side of the Switch dock.  The buttons are spaced out better, are bigger, and have are more responsive.  Wish I had bought this earlier...
Very well made. Doesn't feel cheep. Better choice than joycons; this controller doesn't have the analog sway that comes with the joycons.

This controller feels really good in my large adult hands, the buttons are large and easy to reach, and the analog sticks are very smooth and solid. The only downside is the D-pad, it's very squishy and you can press all of the buttons at once. And doing diagonal moves/attacks with this controller doesn't feel nice at all, and sometimes the buttons don't input as you wanted. If you're getting this controller just for the D-pad itself I suggest looking for another controller.

The ergonomics of this controller are a great improvement over the joycon grip that comes with the Switch. The grips are solid and does not slip. Battery life is amazing and overall the feel of the controller is top notch
My Grandson wanted this for Christmas to go along with his Nintendo switch. He was very pleased to receive and has been playing with it ever since.

First of all the fact that this wasn't new, was a surprise to me.  Second the box is badly taped together.  The price was the same as a new one.  What game are they playing here.  Will return and look for a new one.
This is WAY better than using those joy-cons.  The only downside that I can think of is the price.  Nobody wants to pay $70 for a controller.
Easy to set up. Felt great in hand and used for Mario kart and had no issue with lag or steering. Also used for smash Brothers and it worked great.
Do I like the gamepad? No. But it's functional and has stayed that way. I'd kill for a ps2 gamepad for everything lol.

I bought the Xenoblade controller. It works perfectly. But when I connected it to my switch wired, it’s just no controller update. I don’t know it is normal or not.Also when I shake this controller, I can clearly hear the sound in the controller, it could be some components. I am not sure. As I already had another two Nintendo controllers that bought in my local country, when I shake them they are just silence.
Amazing battery life. I prefer to use this over joy cons because this doesn’t get a drift. I highly recommend this!

The joy cons might be manageable for portability and for child size hands, but the pro-controller is much easier to use in adult sized hands. It can also be used in the go, but obviously is not attached to switch screen like the joy-cons. Functions well and batteries last. Well built

This controller is way better than using the joycons in the grip. This controller is a great investment and so much more comfortable than using the joycons. The build quality is amazing and super sturdy. Makes the experience much better.
Very happy with the quality, you would never know that they aren’t brand new!  We received them even quicker than expected!

Bought this immediately after purchasing my switch. My friend told me I would love it. He wasn't wrong. I really enjoy using this over the joy con controllers for basically all games. Easy to link and easy to use!

I just received this product, tho the amazon box was a little damaged. The Nintendo box was in perfect condition. The joysticks feel alright, the d-pad feels amazing. Way better than the standard joycon one. The face buttons work fine, tho they’re a little mushy, same with the shoulder buttons. But overall it’s a controller that works. It came earlier than expected which is always a plus. Other than personal preferences of the mushy buttons it’s perfect, but saying that it also doesn’t bother me that they’re a bit mushy feeling.

I feel this is the best controller you could buy. The buttons and triggers are great, its super comfortable, and you can use it wired or wireless. You can connect this to a Linux or Windows computer ( not sure about mac) as well. Best controller for platforming or 2d games.Cons

I love the pro controller. Some of the problems I had with the Power A wired controller such as the analog stick having lag, the overall feeling being cheap, and button response have all been improved on. This is a must have if you play your switch in docked mode often l.

Bought 2 of these for me and my brother to play smash bros. The controllers feel good in the hand and have a nice weight to them. The biggest downside for me personally is the buttons feel kind off cheap and mushy. Another thing is that one of my controllers had a slight drift on the left stick. Fortunately there is a built in feature on the Switch that fixes that.
one of my favorite controllers to use has thenfc function it can read your amiibos

One month after our return window closed the toggle stopped working on the controller. Pretty disappointed that something this expensive only lasted that long when we used it properly and are carful with it.

My son bought this because he felt like the stock Nintendo Switch controllers as well as an off brand that he used didn't work as well. He is very happy with it and says his gaming experience is improved.

Only controller anyone should buy.  It is way more expensive then non Nintendo controllers. But I do not suggest buying the cheaper ones. I first bought a much cheaper one but after a week upgraded to the Nintendo pro controller.  Wow what a difference in quality.

Very comfortable and well built wireless controller, with a long battery life. The price point may seem a bit steep, but it's better than most other online sellers. I definitely prefer this controller over the Joycon included with the Switch.

Excellent controller. Compared to the base controller for the PS4 it fits better in the hand, and the amount of battery life per charge is mind-blowing.One of the few wireless controllers that justify the price.

I've been using a DS4 controller for the switch with an extra dongle and finally pulled the trigger and bought this.  Money well spent.  I would still suggest buying this product on sale since the original price could be a little steep.
Feels good in my hands. Unknowingly spilled a beer on it which was left to dry over the weekend. Once the buttons were unstuck, and the outer shell cleaned thoroughly, it still works like a dream.
I am on my 2nd pro controller. It works great but the durability is not great. Was having issues after a couple months of regular use. Seems to be an overall issue with everyone as well.

Excellent gaming controller. Feels great, plays great. Plus, I ordered mine in a bundle with Breath of the Wild -- extremely satisfied. I highly recommend this controller if you plan for at-home use of your Switch.

Excellent controller. Works well and I love the xenoblade design but save your money unless you're a xenoblade nut like I am and just get a regular controller or better yet a powera controller which is even cheaper.
Charge via USB-C which is handy, also last quite a while, very very easy to pair (seemed automatic once i turned them on). bought 2, can confirm it works with Super Smash Bro's.
Absolutely love using this controller.  Comfortable to using, great button layout, and loong battery life.  I've had no problems with setup or continued use
All of the reviews you read about this controller being one of the best made are absolutely correct.  Everything from the response, comfort and motion controls.  If you can afford it, get it.
Safest option and probably the best Switch controller out there! It has rumble and supports Amiibo, not something most aftermarket controllers do...

Great controller if u havent used one yet in the switch its better than the joycons.The color isn't a very bright pink its almost a fleshy red and it looks really nice. Def very happy with the purchase.
Good product. Makes playing my switch much easier and I used it during quarantine. No complaints.
yum! The plastic taste of both the ‘a’ and ‘x’ buttons are just delicious. I love how the different code panels have both a retro feel. The joystick is great 10/10 would eat again.
It's a real Nintendo Switch Pro controller, had mine over year, still works fine, hope this one will also.  Shipped and received fast.

I have a couple other switch controllers, and this is by far the best. Strong battery life, and a great hand feel. Vibration is the best I’ve had in any controller I’ve owned, Sony, Microsoft, or Nintendo.
It works, and it's a lot nicer than using the joy-cons. My hands tend to cramp up after using the joy-cons for too long, not the case with this controller.

I hate using the switch controls. However once I got use to them I found this beauty. It is a black and white difference between the controllers and will make the overall experience of the switch much more better.
The pro controller is nice to use with the switch. I just enjoy it much more than the regular controllers. Worth the money for a solid controller that feels good and is fun to use.

This is the only way to play on the Switch. The Joy-Cons and the Grip are okay, but the Pro Controller is the ultimate experience. The only down side is the price tag due to having an NFC tag detector and the gyroscope built in. Both are very convenient and well implemented, but you are going to have to pay for the luxury.
We host game nights with video games on a movie projector. The crowd loves these remotes and we'll probably buy another set of 4 eventually.

My husband bought this for his Nintendo Switch and raves about the quality of it. It has a very long last charge with very accurate wireless gameplay response. Truly a must have for all switch gamers!

Have had this for 3 months and still going strong. Previously had broken multiple PS4 and Xbox one controller d pads but this thing is durable. I use it on PC as well as my Switch and have to say it is the best gaming controller I’ve used.

The joy-cons and grip that the Switch comes with are passable but not comfortable for long periods of time. This is a well-made traditional controller despite feeling sort of plasticy. The thumbstick and button response are good and the battery life is fantastic.

Great controller to use for heavy-duty-button using games. Battery is great lasts for hours and hours. Much better playing with that the smaller ones that come with the switch. Get it while it’s on sale!

I received some Chinese knock-off garbage that was lovingly repackaged in an official Nintendo retail box. The controller I received is clearly not official, and has numerous issues with connectivity and joysticks.
Better price than buying a new set of joy cons and well worth it. If you spend any time at all with your switch on your tv you need one, trust me.

The left joystick failed 4 months in after super light use. Should have listened to other reviews and issues noted with the controller but it's easier to play some games with. Bought one half the price like some others suggested, if it lasts 6 months it's a win compared to what I paid for this thing.  Never had this so quick with my PS4 or Xbox
I've had 2 cotrollers from other makers because I'm cheap.  This one works far better and is totally worth the extra 20 dollars.
The pro controller is an incredible product for the switch, making it really fun playing on TV mode.  Highly recommend!
I give it a 5 because of my 12 year old Grandlove expression when he received it Christmas morning. He loves that it’s wireless.

You know what you're buying when you buy a genuine Nintendo brand controller. Nintendo continues to put out high quality "pro" controllers. Now if only my wii-u pro controller worked on the Switch. I haven't noticed any d-pad issues as others have reported.

I was happy with this controller until my left thumbstick started sticking in the down position.  When playing Zelda, Link just starts walking backwards when I don't touch the controller.  Or when cooking, he just throws food everywhere except the pot (Frogs and Lizards are happy about it).  Unfortunately, my 3 month return period is up.  I’m going to take it apart and see if I can find the problem.  I may buy this again, but with a extended warranty, if available.
I bought this use but when it came it looked brand new ! Very satisfied- thank you
You can't go wrong on the price! I'd have gone to a different color if they didn't run $99 bucks.I had no trouble hooking it up and it works great! Thank you for the quick shipping!
Bought this for my husband to play his Switch easier while docked. He loves the feel and usability of the controller. It has good battery life and doesn't take forever to charge.

Great!  One set of the joy-cons started constantly drifting to the left and I needed to replace them...  I decided to try a set of pro controllers since they were the same price and they work great!  They work with Amiibos too!

This controller is by far the best investment you can make for your Nintendo switch experience. Don’t hesitate to buy the pro controller, it’s what you want/need to take your gaming to the next level.

The pro controller is 1000x more comfortable than the joycons for me; I have hands on the larger side, but my girlfriend prefers it with her smaller hands too. It's much more well contoured and the buttons are larger and easier to distinguish from each other.

This controller feels a lot better than I was expecting it too. The price drop down to $59.99 (Standard version) also makes it a heck of a deal. I was holding off on buying one for a while, but since I bought Splatoon 2 recently, I felt more of a reason to get one.Money well spent.

Joy cons are great and all but get the pro-controller.  I have 4 of them so I can definitely say they are a necessity.  It feels better, you don't have to risk your joy cons drifting after moderate use, and it lasts a lot longer than the joy cons as well.
Bought this at a discount and it's probably thew best controller for the switch. Even better than the joy cons
Love my pro controller. It’s so comfortable to play with and makes going from my PS4 to switch less of an adjustment! Highly recommend
Yes this is used for gaming but it's also part of our entertainment system on/off routine. Gets used alot and works well.
My kid loves it and seems to be even better at Fortnite now. He says it is much more comfortable than the joy-cons.

The controller feels very sturdy, and the grips are nice. It feels like a premium product—although definitely too heavy for long periods of use. The sticks have a rigid feel compared to other controllers. The face buttons are nice and large, which sort of reminds me of a Genesis controller.The huge downside is the D-pad. It is poorly designed, with zero tactile feedback and no tilt-nub in the center (you can literally press the entire D-pad down all at once), resulting in a squishy, vague sense of control. What's worse, many people (including me) have received defective D-pads, where pressing one direction will activate an adjacent direction. Instead of sending mine back for a replacement or repair (because it didn't solve the issue for many others), I opted to open up my controller and fix the issue by placing a small piece of electrical tape over part of the contact that was giving me trouble.

The controllers I used to have were the xbox 360 and xbox one controllers that I mainly used for some PC gaming. I thought the different design would be uncomfortable going from those controllers to this one. The pro controller is very comfortable to hold even with my big hands. The trigger buttons are also very nice to press and the HD vibration is really cool.

If you have normal sized hands, and the Switch's joycon things make your hands cramp up, these are the way to go. Super comfortable in your hands, much easier to play games. Kinda spendy, but worth it.

This controller is good. The price was prob the best you can get currently so that in itself was a HUGE positive.  The ergonomics of the controller are a different conversation but yeah the quality is legit.Satisfied.

This controller feels really nice in my hands and it has just the right weight.  The rumble is good, but I haven't played anything to test out the gyro.  It would be perfect if it had a headphone jack (and if it was a little cheaper!).
I bought two. One for my son and one for me (or anyone) to play with our son. Makes gaming so much easier for me, at least!
Just to compare it to the joy cons, this works soo much better.  Input lag is almost gone.  Joysticks are 1000 times better.Really makes the joy cons look and feel really cheap.  I will buy again.
The product works well, it can sync to different switches just by plugging it into USB.Honestly the price seems very high.

Bought elsewhere for cheaper, love the look and feel. Great for smash on the go since you cant use a GameCube controller without a dock(therefore not portable and you would have to play with joy cons)!

If you spend an entire day (or more than an hour or two) gaming with your Switch this is absolutely worth the investment! It’s comfortable to hold and much bigger than the joycons (when plugged into its controller holder). The battery lasts a long time and the buttons are easier for gameplay.

At first I thought the price was too high, but this controller is EXTREMELY well built. Newer USB-C interface. Holds a long charge. Icing on the cake: can work with PC wired or with Bluetooth as well!

Controller isn’t as good as you’d expect it to be for the price, meaning it consistently looses signal and there is button lag. If I was a serious gamer like I use to be I’d rate lower but as a casual gamer it doesn’t generally have much impact on the games I play it’s just more of a constant annoyance like a mosquito constantly buzzing you.
