This is a great controller. It's very comfortable to hold and responsive to play with. The joycons can cause my hands to cramp up due to their compact nature, but that is not an issue with this controller. It's rechargeable with USB-C which is a great feature.
I have another 3rd party controller that is great but it can’t wake the system up or read nfc. If you can get this one for $20 or more off retail don’t even hesitate pick it up.

I was hesitant about buying this due to its high price tag but I have put in hundreds of hours of gameplay using this controller. Significantly more comfortable than the joy-con controller grip. The buttons feel more responsive and provides better feedback than the PS4 DualShock 4 controller's. Worth investing in, your hands will thank you.

I do not have anything bad to say about this controller. It is super comfortable in my slightly larger than average hands. The battery lasts longer than any other rechargeable controller out there by a significant amount. It's a really well designed, durable controller, unlike the joycons.
This fits into your hands perfectly the buttons are big and have great feedback this is my favorite controller for any home console must buy for switch owners
It was a gift for my brother (24). He absolutely loved it. Said it's one of the best controllers he has used. Even has a little rumble in it.
Bought this after trying the relay brand. Controller stays charged for a log. Time and connection is simple. Spend the money and go with the name brand!!
Great feel to this controller.  Much better than using the joycons.  Great battery life.  The best way to pair is to connect to the usb cable while it is connected to the switch.

It's advertised as an officially liscenced Nintendo switch controller. But what I received was third party. So I pretty much bought a third party controller for an official pro controller price. That's what you get for shopping online I guess. Otherwise I guess it's a decent controller. Doesn't have nfc reader. Or maybe mine just doesn't work. Probably a mistake on the warehouses part. If a controller has "N-switch" on the box, It is NOT a Nintendo liscenced product.
Great product for the Switch.  Recently was also able to use it with Steam on a gaming PC!

This is a great controller for Nintendo Switch games, The joy cons to me are pretty uncomfortable.This controller works great for every game I have played including Super Smash Brothers. I would say that it is the better controller for Smash Ultimate.
Absolutely love Xenoblade 2 but didn't get into it soon enough to buy the controller at retail but I'm glad I was able to at least get this one even if it was marked up a good amount.

Controller was working great for months until one day the buttons on the right side of the controller mysteriously stopped working in the middle of playing a game. Any attempts to re-sync the controller were met with failure. I tried all the troubleshooting on the official Nintendo website and nothing worked. I even called the Nintendo support line, but the lady on the other end basically just read me the troubleshooting guide word-for-word. I’m not too keen on spending another $70 on a replacement, so I’ll have to send it in for repair.
I originally bought the controller where you had to put in batteries but I'm glad I switched it out for  The pro controller. It is very responsive and works well with my switch.

Definitely the best way to play Zelda. I wouldn't buy from scalpers though $70 retail is more then enough. The joy cons work well enough until you can find a pro controller for retail price. It feels good and has a way longer battery life then my PS4 & XBOX one controller's.

Unlike other controllers this one have comfortable Grip in my opinion . The other controllers that I tried or been using the controllers grip are too thick , Makes me pissed Off for some reason But not with this controller .
Take it from a PRO, my son, nothing beats brand names controllers!
Glad we switched from the joycons... This should've been the standard in the first place

I purchased this product back in May for my Nephews birthday in June. On the box label it shows that it was inspected which was false. My nephew opened it up on his birthday and left analog was broken in half.
The only bad thing about this controller is that you'll never want to use another controller. Fits (in my hands anyway) perfectly and holds a good long charge.
This is the real deal and a must for anyone who enjoys playing games on the Switch.
Outstanding quality, love my remote,provides a different experience while playing, better than joy-cons for sure!!!
I can’t believe how easy it is to pair with the switch. Once paired, the controller was flawless.
What more can I say, I've purchased 2 of these and they were both high quality and worked like a charm. Well worth it.
Makes extended play on the switch much more enjoyable and the button mashing/response is perfect.

Just got mine and its worlds better than using the joycons and after shopping around at walmart,bestbuy,and frys electronics I found it far cheaper on here since every place that sells them wants 70+ bucks and here I got mine for 64 bucks shipped

Got this after giving up on playing Cluster Truck with the Joy Cons. I still prefer the Joy Cons, especially when I can have my hands not together, but in terms of basic controllers, Nintendo’s quality shows.
My son loves this more the the ones that come with the switch! Will buy over and over if needed!
This is a controller for a person that can not handle the joy cons I can’t so this is great for me
Its a fully featured controller. And you know how many hours you are going to be playing your switch, so just get a comfortable controller.Battery life is great too.
Pricey, but far better experience than playing with the joy cons. Just bought a second for my other son.

The Joycons are OK, but if you have man hands or just want something a bit more comfortable than this is necessary. I only knocked off a star due to the price. There is no reason for this controller or the Joycons to cost as much as they do.
when i press the left directional button, it presses along with the up button. very disappointing especially when playing fighting games.

Great controller! Long battery life, usb c cable included, and comfortable grips. What's not to like except the high price tag and the subpar D pad (which I dont use). Otherwise, it's the perfect controller for any switch fan. It's better than other controllers I have used from other consoles.

From smash ultimate to BOTW, this is an incredibly solid controller. The best parts about this controller is how comfortable it is to hold and the much shorter bumper input distance (as compared to a normal game controller).I also really enjoy using the motion controls for aiming in games such as BOTW.
the large joystick gives tons of modulation which makes it easy to aim in shooters.its very comfortable for me to play long hours without hand fatigue.
Very poorly put together.  its better than the jon cobs so it works
Great controller for home use. Comfortable and holds charge for wireless gaming. Comfortable to hold if you have big hands.

Take the Xbox 360 controller and make the dpad worth a crap and improve the triggers and you have the best controller ever made, hands down. I use it with the Mayflash adapter and play all my Steam games with it. Absolutely worth it.
No lag. No cords. Long battery. Fast shipping.  love it!!

It is very nice in the hands but none of the buttons click and the DPad is pretty random, which really sucks when playing Tetris. The triggers could've been better like the Xbox One's triggers. The HD Rumble is actually better and vibrates more than the joycons, but it could just be my joycons.
Great product overall, we own multiple pro controllers and some click and some don’t...it’s very strange. There’s a small clicking sound when moving the stick initially
Hubby has been waiting for this for ages, and he finally got one. He is a happy little gamer!  Pro controller makes some games much easier to play, and as always Nintendo delivers the best quality.
I really wish I would have bought this a lot sooner any of you guys thinking you might want this it's worth it if you have a switch get it it's awesome

I enjoy the feel of the new joy-cons, but I do miss a traditional controller at times. I saw this and had some credits and gift cards, so I used them to buy this controller. I have pretty big hands, but this controller has no issue with them. This is extremely comfortable and would recommend this to everyone! The only downside is the $70 price tag. I still give it 5 stars because after the credits and gift cards, I only paid $5. If you have the extra cash to blow, and you want an amazing and comfortable controller for your Switch, get this controller!
Nintendo really outdid themselves with this controller...  It's just amazing, and every Switch owner needs one.  JoyCons don't compare when playing games like Breath of the Wild.

Probably one of the best controllers I have used. Feels great in hand and has good weight. The thumb sticks are very responsive and buttons pushes are crisp. Battery lasts a very long time. A must have IMO for single player switch games.

Just buy it, this thing is so much more comfortable than the aftermarket pro controllers, can't recommend it enough. My brother even tried it out on his Switch and is probably gonna pick himself up one sooner or later. Plus having all of the actual functions is nice such as NFC, motion controls, and the home button actually powering on the console. Works great, feels great!
Totally worth the purchase. Hard to adjust to at first, but now I use it EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. That I play my switch docked.
I'm loving it so far! No complaints. Handle with care. It can get scratched easily, especially on the front part where the USB-C connection is.
Made gaming on the switch sooooo much easier. The tiny controllers were hard on my hands. This took care of that. Weight and feel of the controller is nice. Everything geels smooth and glides nicely.

Great controller. I almost exclusively use this now. Battery is long lasting and it feels good in the hands. Must have for anyone with a Switch who wants to step up their game and remain wireless and keep motion controls.
This was definitely well-worth the cost. Great for games like Zelda where you need full controls, and it feels more comfortable and natural to hold than the combined Joy-Cons.
This is the original factory accessories, wireless controller, very convenient, you can move around freely when playing games
I'm glad I purchased the Pro Controller instead of an off brand version. This controller works great and is very responsive. It fits great in my hands. I have no complaints.
The best controller for the Switch. Very comfortable, responsive and durable. The only thing I wish it had was a headphone jack...

Kids love this controller. Worth the month they both now can hook the switch up to the tv and play against each other. My son said he could do more things with it compared to the remotes that come with it.

If only the joycons were as comfortable and amazing as the Pro Controller. After using the Pro Controller you're not going to want to go back to the Joy-Cons. It's well worth the price! Additionally it's got way better gyro controls than the Wii U gamepad. I haven't used the HD Rumble feature and it's already worth it.

I love the feel and weight of it, and the buttons feel amazing to press. I mostly bought this just to upgrade my play in footnote since I feel that if Im to rough on the analog sticks, they might break. Its also great to play smash bro.s, as well as street fighter with the pro controller.

I've been gaming for the most part of my entire life. I know far too many bad controllers, but this my friends, this isn't a bad controller. The texture? Great. I can hold it for hours because of it. The size? It could be bigger but it's not all that bad. The button quality? Great. My only gripe is the dpad but that can be remedied with some Scotch tape.
We opted to buy the name brand and these work very well. Have not noticed any issues.
too much time to have it, in Colombia the price of this same controller have a cost of 350.000 cop the equivalent of 100 usd :)
Dont worry already checked... cheapest place to find this controller new
I'm glad I bought this particular controller as it's worked super well with my switch 2.0.

This is a very comfortable controller and a must have for the Switch. My hands cramp up on the Switch as it is not very ergonomic but this controller is the complete opposite. If you like the Xbox one controller then you will like this controller.
Opened up the box, plugged it in to charge, once it  was charged I just started using it and it paired with my switch instantly.Completely effortless!
Great shipping fast. Excellent package. Works perfect.
Don't waste your money on the cheap ones this one works great.  I had to return generic ones with in a few weeks. This one is a lot better made.

Bought on March 1st 2019, used lightly maybe twice a week through writing this on Sept 3rd, 2019 & the left stick on the controller sticks & doesn't recognize input to the point where it's almost unusable. Boo Nintendo, poor quality.

Is the best controller for the switch handsdown when playing table top mode or playing in docked mode while in portable mode in the hands joyce joycons connected is better for that one scenario. But regardless I give 5 stars.
My grandson was very excited to receive for Christmas. Delivery was prompt, up to Amazon’s standard.
I bought this for my switch to use when docked to the tv. I love this and will be buying a 2nd for my husband.

The official NS pro controller. Feels better than any other controllers. So the price is expensive too. Maybe a little bit higher than the value. But it still gives the best experience when playing Zelda.
Way better than what comes with the Switch. Comfortable and great quality. Steep price, though.
My 7 year old only uses this one now!

This is a great controller.Currently my favorite controller is the Xbox One controller and I drew a few comparisons to it. This controller comes incredibly close in design to it and I find it very comfortable to hold, though not quite as ergonomic as the Xbox One controller, at least for me. I think so far it has earned a place as my second favorite controller. The buttons are large and responsive. The analog stick is very smooth. The d-pad isn't perfect but it suits my needs (see below.)

The only way to play.  People complain about the price, but it’s well worth it.  Other controllers don’t have gyroscopes, which, while an expensive addition, adds a lot to precision aiming and other control elements.  I own PS4, XBOX One, and multiple other systems.  This is my favorite controller.
One of the best console controllers you can get. Sort of like an improved version of the 360 controller. if you're gonna be logging long hours into breath of the wild I recommend this controller.

Great controller.....until the dreaded drift.  Bought this after my factory sent Joy-cons started drifting.  Worked great for several months.  Longer than the Joy-cons for sure, but just like the joy-cons the left stick started to drift.  Really disappointed in the lack of quality.  My Xbox and previous Nintendo console controllers all still work YEARS later from initial purchase.  A few months of use is inexcusable.
Very comfortable during gameplay, definitiely preferred controller over my other ones. I will play for hours at a time over several days before this thing is even close to needing charged.
Wish it was $20 less but great controller & battery life. Sturdy too.
So far my experience has been very positive! It feels great and after getting used to the controls it made playing very easy. Would recommend to people who aren’t huge fans of the switch controllers.
You get exactly what you pay for with this one. Very high quality product, highly recommended .
everything is great. it's just heavier than i expected but that's probably because i'm use to wired controllers and the added battery pack is new.

Won't work with some games, such as Pokemon. But this controller feels so good in my hands. The the clickers are smooth and addicting and the rest of the controller fits nicely in my palms. I would highly recommend to anybody who needs that standard controller for the switch.
So much nicer for adult hands than the joycon controllers that come with the switch. Has a bit of weight to it which is nice.
Nintendo has done it again, making another solid controller. Doesn't have the ridiculous battery life of the Wii U Pro, but still extremely good. Plus, it's Xenoblade!
Definitely way better than the joy cons. Essential for me to have a solid controller, especially since I mostly play docked. Looks pretty cool, I dig the slightly transparent black shell.

The stock controls on the Switch are too small to play comfortably for me.  My thumb covers all 4 buttons.  This controller was far more comfortable to use and has motion control. I haven't noticed any issues with the unit yet. With moderate use, I recharge weekly.  The price is what it is. I haven't seen any discounts yet. I use this when docked and on the TV. Delivery was prompt as usual.

The pro controller is definitely heftier than the joycons, but it feels good in the hand. The input is laggier than joycons, but only by a very slight margin. The controls are also more sensitive than the joycons and take some getting used to.

I bought a Switch Pro controller (super smash bros ultimate) last week, and left stick drifting - character moves downward without any input.So I returned the special edition and bought this standard one.
This was what our 13 year old asked for for his birthday.  He loves it.  It feels great in your hands and makes play a lot easier for him since it's bigger than the regular switch joycons.

It feels great in my hands and my accuracy and control in certain games such as Smash Bros and Rocket League has improved drastically. Not to mention, it is more affordable than the Joy Cons. Well worth the purchase.

This is a must have if you don't like to use the joy-cons that comes with the switch. The analog and the buttons are much bigger then the joy-cons and the battery can last for days without having to recharge it.
My 10 years old son loved it! It was a Xmas present that he asked for. Battery life is very good and the design look very cool... at least that’s what he says...
Arrived the box is crushed and the controller is clearly broken. The right joystick is gone and it’s not even in the box.
This item came true to description and brand new! My bf and I have been using it for a few months and have had no issues with it. Great product!
This controller is great.  The recharging is easy...now if I can get my 6 year old to remember to plug in.  The wireless stays unlike the stuff that I used back in the 90’s.
If you play docked a lot, do yourself a favor and get this controller. Leaps and bounds better than the joycons for long gameplay of most games.
Title says it all. Feels like a tad bit bulkier than an Xbox One Elite controller.
never worrying about joy con controllers wandering have been using this for a while and no issues and second battery lasts a very long time

I absolutely love this controller and believe it’s one of the better controller that Nintendo has made since the gamcube. I really want to get a second one but i know it’s a little pricey but you will find out why because this controller is amazing
Just bought another one. I had a off brand controller but connecting to the Switch was a pain and it felt cheaper.
The controller is fine and all, but I have sharp fingernails and scratched the rubber by accident, this may be my fault but the rubber on the joysticks is very weak.
Awesome controller and well  worth the money.
This is the most comfortable controller I've ever held. The only downside is that it makes me notice the little imperfections of the Joy-Con controller when I switch back and forth between the two.
For 4 player games at my house, this is now the controller everyone fights over. So much more comfortable to use than the joycons, even in their holder.

Only issue is price. I mean it's a basic controller but it cost more than any other consoles basic controller while talking about being a pro controller but only has the most basic of button layouts. But it's also the most comfortable controller

Great product, seems durable and made of good material. Really liked the battery of the controller. Supposed to be 40 hours of charge and I'm probably about more than 20 hours in and I still haven't had the need to charge it again. It's a great controller for playing Super Smash Bros, especially since the controller that comes with the Switch is small and a bit uncomfortable after a while.

Although this one's the L and R buttons need to be pressed a bit harder and it smelled like cigarettes, it's one of their best controllers. Why doesn't it have a power button, though? The home button can be that in an update since you can already put it in sleep mode to begin with.

Been playing a lot with this controller. The grip feels great, and this is coming from a PlayStation Dualshock 4 user. It is a little heavier than a DS4, but the battery is definitely something great as it seems that the charge seems to last for at least 50 hours. It's very comfortable to use too and I definitely recommend this for good old couch gaming.
I prefer these over joycons but they drift too.
The switch pro controller is my go to when playing games. Before buying games whether physical or digital I purposely look for the different playing options such as joycons or pro controller.
Beats any PS4 Controller. Not cheaply made. OVER 40 hours of play time for 6 hours of charge is an amazing ratio. Recommended for anyone who plays Mario Kart and Smash.
Better feel in the hands than the new Xbox controllers, and similar to Playstation's in terms of build quality. Looks like the Xbox controller but has some small changes.

I extremely recommend this controller. Not only a Xenoblade chronicles fan such as myself should be using this controller, I recommend this to any user fan or not. This controller has a solid dpad, the colours are featured in a simple yet astonishing design. A must recommend.
So much better than the joycons!
This is 100x better than the controllers that initially come with the console. It's pricey, though, unjustifiably so. Highly recommended if you're going to play anything docked.
Great controller, feels so much better in the hands.  Great connectivity.
It was perfect everything's working like it should all the buttons gyro and wireless connection.
Bad design.
Excellent. Wish was cheaper, but fits perfect in hand.

The build of the controller is great. It's more precise and way more comfortable than the joycons. The battery life is also insane, 30hrs or so. PlayStation could learn a few things from the pro controller.
This is not good value to buy because it is amiibo not working, I already try a couple time. I think if you want , you can buy a cheap one.
Good controller for switch works great but need to turn on switch on the dock before you can turn the controller on. Other then that it works great
I bought two for Christmas and they both work perfectly for the Switch!

This is probably my favorite controller at the moment not only for the Nintendo Switch but gaming controller period.  I've always enjoyed the Xbox controller layout and feel, but this Xenoblade Pro controller fixes the issues the regular Pro controller has while maintaining it's ergonomic design.  It feels nice and grippy to hold for long periods of time and I just love the color scheme here.  I'll be the first one to say I wasn't totally in love with Xenoblade Chronicles 2 the game, but I do love this controller.
We liked our first Pro Controller so much that we bought a second one to use when playing the Switch with multiple players - these are comfy to use & work great!
Most comfortable gaming controller out there in my opinion.  if you have a nintendo switch you will not regret purchasing this controller.

This is probably the most ergonomic, comfortable, easy to use controller I’ve ever had. I thought it would be tough to ever beat the Gamecube, Genesis, Xbox 360, or orginal PS Dual Shock controllers, but Nintendo comes away with an absolute gem here!
It’s a great controller. Way more comfortable than the joy con grip. However my few gripes with it is that:1. A couple of the buttons are “sticky” and have a little resistance when being pressed
It’s expensive compare with some 3rd party controller. But totally worth the money. Battery life, touch feeling, control button quality are all great!

It's incredibly comfortable and feels like it was designed specifically to the contours of my hands. One minor complaint is the d pad can be a bit overly sensitive, but that doesn't detract much from an otherwise outstanding controller.
I thought that input lag was the same between the Joycons and this controller, but I have to say I see a difference besides the obvious comfort.
This controller is just amazing. So comfortable, Nintendo got it right. I have a PS4, and XBone and while I like those controllers this one quickly had me wishing I could use it for any system lol.

Flat out the best controller for the Switch. I've had the Switch since it launched and have been using it in either hand-held mode or the Joy-Con grip. Since I bought the pro controller, I've used it exclusively for all my gaming. Playing games with these are just better.

Based on the reviews and being an XBOX & PS4 owner, I knew I had to get a good quality controller, especially for Super Smash Bros Ultimate. This is a great controller and I think it is better than the XBOX one. The only thing is I wish this was a little cheaper, in the 40 range would be fair but nontheless, it is a must have!
Great battery life, extremely comfortable, works great on almost every game! (I say almost because you literally cannot use it for pokemon Let's go)

I found that the controller that accompanies the switch was too small for my hands, and this controller was the perfect purchase as it synced to the system very fast and seems to actually have better connectivity and battery life than the included switch conroller.
Excelente mejor que los que trae por default
Why can't my PS controller feel this comfortable?  Makes playing Stardew Valley a pleasure.
Works great according to the kids. They're happy so I'm happy

The Joy-Cons that come with the Switch are quite good. Nothing wrong at all with them, they are just not as good as this controller, that is more like what we're all used to after the last few generations.If you are one of those that only play the Switch in Tablet mode though this is not for you.
Excelente ! Recomendado !! Fácil de usar
This is must have controller and it is a great investment. It links up quickly and it is easy to use. This is by far a great investment for my switch.
First bought the non-Nintendo brand controller that was DOA.  This one is Nintendo brand and thus has no problem with product QA.
Bought this product for my grandson and he says he likes it.
The only way to go for a controller for the switch. I have tried all of the controllers available for the switch even the toggles. This is by far the best one

Get one, it feels so much better playing some games.Yes the price is a tad bit high, but trust me, it is so worth it. I was playing mario cart, fornite, and minecraft with this. After having one even with a charging grip for joy cons, I prefer the feel of these.
Works perfect love it excellent deal thank you

Pro Controller > Joy Cons in every manner.
Typical nintendo controller

Really great controller, high build quality. Much more comfortable than the JoyCon controller that comes in the box. I also like it better than my old Gamecube controllers and this feels much smoother (although GC controllers are basically 15 years old at this point). Very expensive though (bought for $70). If this goes on sale, worth the purchase.
Being a PlayStation user, this is a lot easier to use compared to the joycons.

As if the wait time was any good, once the product arrived I immediately noticed that the box was heavily beat up. Upon opening I noticed that both stick were: Broken, stiff, could not stay in place, and could not fully rotate. All other buttons seemed okay expect for one or two that felt stickier than others. Wow.  After using this, I can't go back to the slide-off controllers anymore, even when inserted in grips.  The real Nintendo controller is pricey, but REALLY nice.If you have large hands, this is a must-buy.

One of if not the most comfortable controller I've ever used.  I have huge bony hands and it molds my hands perfectly!  The buttons are nice and large and the controller provides a nice grip.  It is nice and weighty with good battery life and analog tension.  My only complaint isn't something that the controller can fix too much, which is the lack of analog triggers, but it does a good job with making them not too clicky and have quite a bit of give which feels natural.
Who knew Nintendo could make such a great "normal" controller. I like the pro controller because it is larger than the joy-cons with grip and fits much better in my hands without cramping them up.
Best  controller design out there right now. Valve made it compatible with PC through steam.

Love love LOVE this controller. The Joy Con controllers have always been difficult for me. I got this controller after I kept getting whipped on Mortal Kombat 11. Thanks Nintendo for this! Worth the money! Let’s go.
Works well and easier than using tiny control.

Order came in a couple days faster than expected which was great. Box came in perfect condition and I love the controllers grip and feel and not to mention the glossy design. I'm currently playing breath of the wild with this controller and the button commands feel smooth. I'll consider Xenoblade 2 after buying this controller to pair it off well.
It’s a controller. Has a charge cable. Works good.It feels much more like a real controller. The “+” and “-“ buttons are a little far but not enough to be upset.
I’m so glad I grabbed one of these prior to starting out on Breath of the Wild since this controller is very comfortable and holds charge for a very reasonable amount of time.
This is a really awesome controller. It’s solid and sleek. It fits in your hands nicely and holds a great charge.

Works well. Can also be used as the primary controller when playing on a television. This makes it easier than sliding the controllers off the game screen and then sliding them onto the hand unit and then putting them back on the game screen to charge.

AMAZING!!! The best way to play Nintendo Switch. I will never be touching those tiny joycons again. All the buttons are super smooth and have a satisfying click and their size is prominently larger leaving you without having to press the wrong button and mess up your whole game. The home, plus and minus buttons could be larger but I agree with their size because if they were any bigger they'd have to downsize the XYAB. Anyways, love this controller and I cannot thank my friends enough for reccomending this for me.

Experiencing drift in left stick after roughly a year and a half of use. Already tried to clean, but still not working. Nintendo said I could either pay 40 bucks to fix or buy a new one. Would not recommend unfortunately, as I love this controller otherwise.
Wasn't a fan of the attachment controller for the joycons when I got the Switch. The pro controller makes the games more enjoyable to play.

Decided to buy this controller because the original joy con grip is a bit too small for my tastes. I was a bit wary of the price tag but I have zero regrets. This thing has a comfy grip and is quite well made. Nothing about this controller feels cheap, whether it be the materials or the buttons.This gets a perfect score from me, you can't go wrong with one of these.
Very happy with the purchase, it's perfect.  The battery life used during wireless play exceeded expectation!
Very similar to the xbox one controller feel. Good controller!!

This is my new favorite controller, it may take a bit of getting used to but once you do it'll feel hard to go to anything else. Cost is a little high but if you wait for a deal you get the Best Controller for the Switch. Highly recommend!
Night tight control and great battery life.
Excellent product good size and easy to use

Wish I would of bought them earlier. I got used to the joycons but this is so much nicer to use. Wish I would of bought before playing through Zelda. Marked down one star for price.

Perfect controller! I have had this for a few weeks now and absolutely love using it. I was a bit hesitant to purchase this at first due to the high price but I do not regret this purchase at all, it really makes the switch much more enjoyable to play while docked.

Fantastic! The packaging was a little clumsy but really that doesn’t change the fact that I got everything I need. It came with the pro controller and the charger. No manual but who needs that. wish all the buttons worked.

Expensive, but well worth the cost. 40 hour charge time (take note Sony!), Comfortable and is my favorite of the 3 current gen console controllers. Great for Zelda and Mario Kart, the only 2 games I own so far. Much better than the included holder thing that uses the Switch's included remotes. Highly recommended!
Couldn’t get the other controller to work so I bought this one and it’s great.

I honestly think this is my favorite controller ever it’s like an og Xbox controller only better cause it’s nintendo come the release of smash Bros I’ll probably get the game cube controllers but wouldn’t be surprised if this thing holds up well if you don’t have one get one cause it’s just a great controller.

This is one of the most comfortable and ergonomic controllers I've used since my Xbox one S controller. A plus is that the battery lasts forever on a single charge. All of the buttons are very responsive and tactile, making inputs effortless.
These feel solid and are a nice change from the standard controller
This product has completely changed for nintendo switch experience for the better. Nintendo just continues to provide me with the utmost pleasure. Thanks!
Bought this as a gift for my son-in-law and he is very pleased.

Must have for any Switch owner actually planning on using it docked. I didn't purchase this at launch, but after struggling with the joy-con and the grip at times,  I purchased this. One of the best controllers I have ever used.
Very comfortable but takes a while to get used to when you switch from the standard controls. I wish I had bought this earlier.
No issues with this controller. Syncs with the switch and works perfectly.

This controller is just more than amazing. The build quality is fantastic and it’s very comfortable in my hand. A must have controller for your switch console. Special thanks to Amazon and their members and the company itself.
No issues. Just as expected. Have found that my kid just likes to carry around rather than hook up to big tv so doesn't use the controller much.

The only thing that needs to be said about this controller is it’s worth the price. If you own a Switch and do not yet have a Pro Controller, you’re missing out. I guess that’s two things that needed to be said.

Good product

My mom bought me this controller and I love it everything feels great the buttons feel great and so do the sticks and triggers. But the only thing I don't like is that the triggers aren't analog like the PS4 and Xbox One triggers are but other than that I love it.

My biggest issue with the switch was feeling like my hand was going to break the controller. I absolutely adore this well worth the money.

Well, I decided to put some money into it and purchase the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller. Here are my thoughts on the pro controller.The Good:

One of my little brothers friends stole it so I bought a cheap one at walmart, but this controller is way too good so I buckled and bought another one a week later. No hyperbole when I say this is one of the finest, most premium controllers ever made.

Pro controller for the pros.Leave that half joycon for your friends and teach them who's boss! You'll dominate effortlessly with this controller. No more excuses if you suck though. It's definitely NOT the controller. It's you, sorry.
Excellent controller definitely my favorite of all time!!

It's what I expected. Definitely recommend getting at least one of these for your switch.  It's very very similar to an xbox one or xbox 360 controller both ergonomically and with button layout. The kids were so tired of the wired controllers for their switch, these are so much better and being rechargeable makes them even more amazing.  LOVE them!

The control is fantastic. Its got a good weight and feel. The buttons and analog sticks are all great. The trigger buttons though feel a bit weird since their digit and not analog, like the ps4 or xbone controllers. Other than that I probably like this controller more than the others.

Stopped working. Never damaged either. Never had food or liquid on or near it.
So far, this controller has been great. Comfortable to use for long periods of time, every button has continued to function, and it holds its charge.

So much more comfortable than the joy cons. An amazing controller.

If you want a controller for the Nintendo Switch, definitely worth it to get the pro controller! It feels great to use and I like that it comes with a USB-C cable to charge it!

Not quite as comfortable as everyone says... but damn does it have incredible battery life, and it feels so much better than the joycon pseudo controller. I'm fully satisfied with the purchase. Has aided me in many intense games of Mario Kart.

I bought this because I wanted something a bit larger than the joycon + controller that comes with the switch.The hand grips are rubbery, but not too grippy. The trigger buttons are also larger, which I liked.

This thing is comfortable, has a good weight to it, and a very long battery life when used wireless. Several third party options for around $25 which is tempting as that is less than half the price of the Switch Pro Controller. Those third party knock offs are cheaply constructed, hard wired, and sit awkward in your hands. This thing was well worth the investment.
Awesome. Works with any Nintendo switch device, even Firestick TV!

This is a wonderful controller. Well made by Nintendo. For those who prefer a real console controller in your hand instead of the small switch controllers. This is the best you can get.

Received this controller today and I immediately started playing, after 2 hours I don't feel any pain in my hands. the build quality is top notch, the joysticks are way better than what you get with the joy cons. 100% recommend it for players that get cramp with the miniature controller that Nintendo decided to give us by default.

Great price, I was worried this was gonna be a copy but its the original Nintendo pro controller :)

Best controller for Switch that I’m aware of. That said, it’s flawed. D-pad is all one piece, and sometimes when you push Right the controller registers this as Up (which makes Tetris impossible since Up is the button for Hard Drop — results in constantly dropping pieces by accident). Seems like this would be the D-pad on a really crappy 3rd party knockoff controller — not the licensed (and irrefutably overpriced) one.I’ve been using the controller for 3 weeks. The left analog stick is already quite loose/worn out. I’m guessing it’ll fail within another 6 weeks.
After waiting a year after I got my switch for christmas, I used some of my gift card to get this and man it's one of the best I've ever held in my hands.

During a couple months of use, the forward sensor for the left thumb stick was failing. Instead of the hero moving at a full walk when the left thumb stick was all the way forward, the hero would move slower as if the left thumb stick was partially forward. After talking to customer support, Nintendo emailed me a shipping label with mailing instructions. 3 days later at Nintendo's expense, I had a new replacement (Nintendo had a contract repair company in the next county over.)The controller feels amazing and may be the best console controller I've ever used. Aside from questionable internal parts quality, my only complaint is the location of the D pad. The left thumb stick and D pad locations should have been swapped. The current D pad location makes it easy for the player to accidentally press diagonal up/right or diagonal up/left, which is the D pad issue people are complaining about. BTW, the controller is $10 more than the MSRP for the PS4 controller, but the PS4 controller does not come with a charge cable.

This controller is great until it’s not. It’s a comfortable weight, it fits your hands nicely... and then the Bluetooth stops working and the warranty sucks so it cost 75% of the cost to ship and get it repaired by Nintendo. Would not recommend, going with PowerA this time around.

I bought this controller to use when my switch is docked, but unfortunately I had to return it. The controller was generally pretty good, but had in my opinion a fatal flaw: the d-pad.The d-pad is way too sensitive, and judging from many online reviews it seems like a poor design rather than a defect with my specific controller. First of all you can press the entire d-pad down from the middle, which is kind of weird because the d-pads I've seen in the past generally pivot around a center point that does not depress. But the issue is that pressing left/right buttons on the d-pad and applying even the tiniest force in the vertical axis will trigger up/down presses. There are videos of this on youtube which match my experience exactly, leading me to believe this is not just a single instance defect.

Was on the fence about buying a pro controller but saw a YouTube video about people’s joy-cons wearing down from sliding them on and off the Switch. Apparently the button you push in has a raised peg and sliding it on and off the metal rails of the Switch so many times wears it down and your joy-cons can slide off dropping your Switch. So I had originally opted for a second set of joy-cons instead of a pro controller so one set of joy-cons for now on will be attached to my Switch and the other set will not go back on the grip but used as two controllers sideways and I bought the pro controller so I had a controller to game on titles that need that many buttons like Zelda Breath of the Wild. The second set of joy cons charge on a slide in slide out charging dock, that don’t click into place to damage that peg connected to Joy-Con release button. The first set stays attached to my Switch and charges in the dock attached to the Switch. Mind you I know I will have to remove Joy-Cons to play for more than three people but this solution of one pro controller and two sets of Joy-Cons greatly reduces the Switching involved to wear down my Joy-Cons. By the way I’ve been playing the Switch pro controller for 4 days now about 3-5 hours a day and as of this post I still have a almost full charge, although I don’t see any drop off in battery charge icon, but it should have at least gone down a drop but if I had to estimate I’d say it’s still full charged. Great product Nintendo I’m impressed!!!

This is a must have for the Switch. Gaming is so much easier with the pro controller than with the LR Joy Cons that come with the system (which I find buggy). If you are a fan of the PS 4 controller, you will love the Switch's Pro. Very similar. Allows for a nice grip and easy game playing. While everyone loved the Wii's motion censored controller, I often found i buggy and that it wouldn't synchronize well. There were also so many different ways to use it that it wasn't simple enough for me. I also prefer two handed game play. The Switch's Pro Controller allows both hands on one controller, and since it isn't a motion controller like, the Wii, and doesn't have two components to it, like the Switch's Joy, you don't have the issues of synching and connectivity. It's an intuitive controller to use, as well. You don't have to "think" while using it.Only reason I'm docking a star is because of the price. At $69.99 I find it really expensive, especially given how poorly the Joy Cons work for games like MARIO Kart. You will want two Pros if you have that game. But that is a $140 additional investment, not to mention tax.

So originally I got this controller because I needed something other than the controller grip that was included with the Nintendo Switch which just wasn't cutting it for me. The Joy Cons themselves, while are impressive little controllers, can be frustrating at times due to their size and the size of the buttons being so small. This is especially apparent for games like Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild where you need those precise controls in order to really take full advantage of the combat mechanics.So I bought this and I've got to say that I'm pretty impressed. First off, being someone who's always played Playstation and used to having the analog sticks being side by side,  I was worried that the directional stick layout which is very similar to Xbox One's layout, would take some time to get used to but that turned out to not be the case. Not only do they work great but I also adjusted to it very quickly and had a blast using this. The controller feels lighter than my PS4 controllers and it fits snug in my grip. It didn’t cramp up my hands like the Joy Con controller grip did. The grips have a nice texture to them that keeps them cool and easy to hold for long periods of time and with the buttons also being a lot bigger then the Joy Cons, I don't have much of an issue with hitting the wrong buttons. Also this controller is rocking a rechargeable battery that boasts a 40 hour life span on a single charge. Since I’ve gotten the controller a couple weeks ago, I’ve only had to charge it once, which is a major plus compared to other controllers like the Duelshock 4 which I’m lucky if I get a good 8 hours out of. I'd even go as far to say that the RZ & LZ trigger buttons are better than both Playstation's and Xbox's counterparts. The buttons seem to travel less distance to activate so it feels like they're responding quicker. Other pluses to this controller is that all the buttons found on the Joy Con make their way over onto this controller, it has the reader which lets you use Aiimbos with it, and its a very quick transition if you want to swap from the Joy Cons to the Pro controller during gameplay.

The Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is a must-have accessory for anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch home console. Although expensive, it's necessary for hardcore gaming while at home, due to the Joy-Con device buttons being too small and primarily designed for handheld use instead. Although it's a step down from the previous generation (the Wii U Pro Controller took 4.5 hours to charge and lasted 80 hours total, while the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller takes 6 hours to charge and only lasts 40 hours total), the Switch Pro Controller does have additional features, like Amiibo support, motion controls and HD rumble. The position of the Control Sticks on the Switch Pro Controller actually brings back memories of the Nintendo GameCube Controller, which was designed in a similar way. Perhaps this is Nintendo's way of bringing back the GameCube fans who left for Sony and Microsoft during the Wii and Wii U eras. In any case, I highly recommend it, especially for games like Zelda, Mario Kart Deluxe and Splatoon.

Boy do I love this controller. I've had every controller since the NES and the Gamecube and Xbox 360 controllers were always my favorite. This has taken the cake for sure. It sits in your hands very well, all button placements feel appropriate and ergonomic. The weight or heft of the controller is perfect, a little on the heavy side but not enough to fatigue you. Sticks are fantastic, D pad is arguably the best (you may prefer the Sony style, but this is easily second to that if so). It also uses USB C to charge so you can (likely) share the cable with your phone for years to come.Only complaint I have is the price, which when you factor in the battery life, amiibo function, motion controls, is understandable but still hard to swallow when you consider the library for this controller. You'll likely only use it to play Zelda for a long while until other Switch titles start rolling out. You can be crafty and use it on your PC for sure, but it would be nice if Nintendo made it plug-n-play for PC as Microsoft has done.

I have two sets of joycons and a pro controller, and I really like the joycons, but if you're trying to decide between a second set and a pro controller, I'd recommend going with the pro controller. The Pro Controller is top notch. It was easy to link up with my switch, and it has become my preferred controller since I started using it. Prior to purchasing this controller I really enjoyed using the joycons with the grip, but this controller feels so much better. It fits perfectly in my hands and has been great for long gaming sessions.The battery life on it is excellent and after you're done using it, you can plug it into the wall and not have to worry about it ever running out of juice. I haven't run into any D-Pad issues that were mentioned in previous reviews, but I will update if I run into those problems. It's a great controller and I'd recommend picking one up if you're in the market for an additional controller.

Until this controller is in your hands, you can't help but feel it's a waste of money- based on the pictures. But boy this is a beauty. Especially up close, it's a work of art. It feels extremely durable & very solid, it's got a nice weight to it and fits my hands perfectly. I'd go as far to say this controller is more comfortable than Xbox 1 and ps4 controllers. $70 may seem steep for a controller but let's remember there is an accurate motion sensor built into this. Plus the battery life is incredible, I've read it lasts 40 hours. I've played here and there for 2 weeks and still haven't needed to charge it.The reason I rated it 4 stars is because...well first and foremost, people don't trust 5 star reviews BUT also the controller is not very breathable. I believe it's mostly the material used for the hand-grips. So your hands will get sweaty sometimes. Nevertheless, in my opinion this controller was definitely worth the money.

This thing is far, far nicer to use than the Joy-Cons that come with the Switch. I have large hands, and the Joy-Cons are really not very pleasant to use, no matter whether used with the grip or not. So I picked this up to play Breath of the Wild with, and let me tell you, it is a world of difference. It's very ergonomic, the buttons and sticks are now a proper size for your fingers and feel good, and the build quality is great. Not great? The price. With both PS4 and XB1 controllers going anywhere from $40-50 at time of writing, this thing is at a minimum $30 more expensive for practically no reason. And as far as I can tell, those controllers technically have more features than this controller does (touchpad, headphone jack, big lights, etc), making the price even more disappointing. But considering it's either Joy-Cons or this, you don't have much of a choice if you want a nicer playing experience.

The pro controller is very good as far as controllers go. Of course the layout is very similar to an XBox controller, which I always found a let-down considering the GameCube controller was so uniquely Nintendo and also very comfortable and effective. That said, all 4 shoulder buttons are sized well and spaced out well; the trigger action on ZR and ZL are better than the PS4 and XBox controllers, in my opinion, because they provide the right amount of spring -- neither too much nor too little tension, which is what I prefer for shooters.I have 3 critiques. First, the A, B, X, and, Y buttons feel so cheap. They look generic, and there's something about how they feel when you press them that comes off as preschool-toyish. They're not terrible, but it's something I always notice. Second, the "rumble" feature is more like a stronger version of a cell phone's vibrator. It's just a generic, flat, buzzing feeling. Compare that to the PS4 rumble where it feels like some creature is crawling around inside your controller. Sometimes it's so jarring that I look down at the controller to see what's going on. I don't know what Sony's mechanism is, but it's more effective than Nintendo's. Third, naturally, is the price 😱 Nothing to say about that that hasn't already been said.

I ordered this controller to have a second one so that my husband and I don’t have to share Joy-Con controller halves, which get uncomfortable after long-time play. It is very comfortable to hold, though after getting used to the Joy-Cons in the grip, I found I had to get used to the layout of this controller all over again. It also feels like it was made for someone with large hands. I have average-sized hands, so while the controller is still perfectly usable to me, it just feels a little large. Bottom line: my husband loves having his own controller now (and prefers the feel of the Pro controller), and I usually play with the Joy-Con controller in the grip, so we are both happy.

A work-of-art controller with a great feel.  It is pricey, but it feels like an expensive controller, not a cheap controller.  I suppose that's a good thing. The charge it holds is incredible; I didn't know it had amiibo detection capabilities, but that is pretty cool, too.  I also used the C to A cable that comes with it to hook up the switch itself to an external battery pack to add another three hours or so of Zelda play when I was away from the base unit.  I have the xbox One S as well, with those cool white controllers and I love the feel of them, but this is actually a bit of a cut above those.  Like others have mentioned, this is a great controller for playing Zelda on a big screen and also is nice for Mario Kart to add a third player to the mix.  Good job, Nintendo.

This controller is incredibly comfortable. I was a huge fan of the Wii U pro controller and used that controller constantly. Than this controller came out and it is the best controller I have ever held. The ABXY buttons are pretty huge and oval shaped, the shoulder buttons are very ergonomic, the analog sticks have a concave design with ridges on the end for precision if you want to grip the edge of the analog stick and it is pretty heavy so it is a solid feeling controller. A pretty minor gripe I have about this controller is that the D-pad is pretty stiff. Overall with the included features of this controller, it makes the $70 price worth it.

This is a great controller. It has a roughly 40 hour battery life, it is far and away a better experience than using the Joy-cons on the comfort grip or by themselves, and it feels very sturdy and well made. It is very reminiscent of an Xbox controller and I really prefer using it for Zelda while I'm playing on my television.Overall I really like the controller but I just don't see why it is more expensive than a dual shock 4 or Xbox One controller.  Maybe considering the battery last much longer and it has NFC for the Amiibo figures but I just didn't see $70 here. While I can recommend it since it is a great controller and currently is the only option besides the Joy-con controller I can't recommend these scalped and inflated prices that you see while stock is limited. If you can find it for $70 and you really wanted the full controller like I did, then go ahead and get it otherwise it may be worth it to see the other options coming out in the next few months.

If you own a Nintendo Switch make your self the favor and buy a Switch Pro Controller, its the most pleasant controller I've ever held in my hand - yes I mean it feels better than holding an Xbox One controller. The price seems right based on 40+ hour battery life(lasts way longer than a PS3/PS4/Xbox 360 or Xbox One controllers), NFC reader, Motion Gyro controls, HD Rumble and rubber grip feel in the palm handles + including a really nice 5 foot long Type C to USB A charging cable. Oh yeah it also works on PC through bluetooth and its recognized as for directinput - no lag.

+It's very comfortable to hold and feels substantial in your hands. I want to stress how solid this controller feels and the build quality behind it. I can twist the grips pretty aggressively and they don’t give or make noise. In comparison Sony and Microsoft’s controllers creak and feel like they’ll break from noticeably thinner and weaker plastic.+The analog sticks are very comfortable, have little friction, and the edges have a nice grippy pattern. After 2000 hours of Splatoon 2 the analog sticks return to neutral and there’s no wobbling or drifting. The sticks do rub against the sides though and will produce some plastic dust. One disappointing problem I ran into was occasionally the right stick would register a click despite not being pressed down.

Let me say right away that this thing is 5 stars for every single reason other than price. I only put it at 4 because the price point for this thing is so ridiculous at $70. It honestly feels better in the hand than my PS4 controller does (the handles are a bit straighter and narrower) and Nintendo really needs to think about including one of these with the console. The battery in it is also phenomenal, as a single charge seems to last for weeks of standby and play. It's silly that you have to buy this thing in the first place, and sadly because of it's high price, I feel that few will get to experience the joy of playing with this. It really made my Switch feel more like a proper home console than the Joy Con did. I actually play it way more on the TV now than I did previously, and it's made me download a lot more of the indie games to play on the TV as well. Overall it's fantastic and I would say every switch owner really deserves one; it's unfortunate Nintendo priced it so very few will be willing to shell out the money for it.

No complaints here. Ergonomics are fine, buttons are responsive and reasonably stiff, motion controls work well, solidly built. Minor quibbles are the minus button being hard to get with it's location past the left stick, and the usage of a USB-C connector instead of much more common UBS-micro and mini connectors. It may be expensive but if you're finding the Joy Cons to be small and flimsy, especially if you have larger hands, this will save the day and you'll be glad you spent the money for a legit, serious gaming pad.

I'm a huge controller nerd/collector, and this fast became my favorite general-purpose controller. The sticks are accurate and precise, and moving them feels smooth and comfortable. The face buttons feel and actuate like those of a fresh Super Famicom pad. The controller speaks standard-enough Bluetooth HID protocol to pair with almost any PC or smart device without special software. The one disappointment - and it's a super minor one - is that there's no analog shoulders, which just tells me Super Mario Sunshine on Switch Virtual Console might not happen :)

I have had this item for almost a week, and I have not had to recharge it yet. I'm very happy with the Pro Controller, and it is definitely worth the money.

The analog sticks feel substantial and sturdy, unlike the ones on the Joy-Cons. The gyro works well in Breath of the Wild, but I'm especially excited to use it with Splatoon 2. HD Rumble feels awesome in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. Heavy, but not too heavy -- the weight is just right, I'd say. Seventy dollars is pricey for a controller but it was definitely worth it. The upgrade from dual Joy-Cons makes a world of difference!

So it's registering a diagonal press instead of a horizontal one.
One way Nintendo is ripping people off, with there pricey items for the new switch, but still its needed item if you love playing games but dont enjoy the joy cons that it comes with..
This controller is fantastic.  The battery life, size, grip are all perfect.  This is the 2nd best gaming controller next to the Xbox one elite controller.  Must have for all switch owners.
A must have if you are an adult or child with big hands. I found the switch buttons to close for my fingers. Works great and holds charge for a long time. Bought a second one also.
A must for anyone with a switch unless they have small or super healthy hands. It reminds me of my xbox 360 controller. ( FYI I don't have any systems of the xbox one era of consoles.)

There's a reason why this controller is getting sold; the joycons that come with the Switch are just not ergonomic. This one feels quality-built. It also includes a USB-C cable and supports NFC and motion control. I would say it's worth the price.
I want this Controller to have for my Switch. It has better battery life and Amiibo than Xbox One and PlayStation 4. So it’s bit expensive than its Competitors.But worth it.

The Nintendo switch pro controller is akin to an Xbox controller. The controller is great, but it is a large deviation from the Joycon in the way it feels. If you love your Joycon you may not like this controller, but if you feel cramped you'll likely love it. Aesthetics and battery life are great bonuses!
The  Nintendo Switch Pro Controller it's  a good Pro Controller to use but too expensive it's best  to wait for the price to go down or  buy third-party  Controller and save some money.
Wish it was a bit more meaty (?). Like I love playing with my Xbox One controller (on PC). However it's pretty good. Especially since I'm not a fan of the joycons.
Great controller otherwise. Buttons are top quality, great dpad. A shame that QA wasn't better.

Nintendo got the design of this controller right. It feels very balanced and comfortable. It has some similarities with the XB360/XB1 controller shape, so if you're used to that, this will feel pretty familiar. Construction quality is very good, too. It doesn't feel cheap. It's worth the money, so long as you're not buying it from some jerk who has spiked the price due to availability issues.I don't know that I'd say this is a must-have for the Switch, because in my opinion the grip for the joycons is pretty good too, but this is definitely much more comfortable. It's not a bad idea to get the pro controller if you're going to be doing a fair bit of gameplay on your TV rather than using the Switch mobile.

Didn't realize how much better this would be until I got it. By far the most comfortable controller I've ever used(including anything from Razer, Xbox, or Sony). This has become a prized possession for me.

The pro controller is a very good buy and, if you're looking for an extra controller, I'd recommend forgoing another pair of joycons and getting this one instead. It's quality is great and competes well with even Xbox or PS4 controllers, though it doesn't win against them.
feels good in the hands and yea the price is very steep and if you always play in tv mode then consider it or get the wired one,it will lack rumble gyroscopes and the amibo reader and being wireless
If you prefer the regular style controller, this is awesome.  It amazes me how long the batteries last.  I am used to the xbox controllers that eat batteries up fast.  These last for several days!

This is a great addition to the Switch system. I personally enjoy the Joycons, but this controller is far more comfortable for extended periods of use and feels more responsive and easy to use for games that require precise control input like Street Fighter.
Awesome controller - perfect companion for the Switch - it's what we use when the Switch is docked. Comfortable, responsive, and quality construction. We love it for Zelda, especially.
Nintendo made the best controller in the market by taking the best aspectes of both the Xbox one controller and the PS4 controller and made it better

this controller is a wonderful, wonderful gaming controller and has great battery life. nintendo has done well with this one

The d-pad and syncing with the controller needs to be fixed. Whenever I press down on the d-pad and move my finger a little to the right or left, it would go in those directions instead of the down input and it does feel kinda cheap. Also the controller sync messes up sometimes which would leave my game character running in the last direction that was pressed leaving me to have re-sync the controller.
Makes playing the Switch so much easier for those of us with larger hands. Its pricey but worth it.

The controller had a faulty d-pad that would sometimes trigger up or down when pressing left or right and vice versa. I returned it for a replacement, but it also had the same issues. Also pay attention to the left and right grips, feel the straight edge where they connect to check if they are flush/even with the controller. If you're gonna be playing on the TV with your switch this is almost a must have. Controller feels great in the hand, all the buttons have a nice feel, especially the D-pad which may be my favorite I've used. Price is the only downside at 70 bucks, but it does pack some nice tech in there like HD rumble, and an amiibo reader. You also can't beat the 40 hour rated battery life, as well as the included high quality USB-c to USB-a cable. Going to be getting at least one more once Mario Kart 8 Deluxe comes out for some good multiplayer.

If you see yourself playing the Switch primarily at home on the TV, this controller is definitely worth the investment. So far I've used it for LoZ:Breath of the Wild and the Splatoon 2 global testfire, and with both games I have had no problems with any features (gyro aiming, amiibo scanning, triggers, d-pad, control stick, buttons, etc.). The controller is a tad expensive, but since I primarily play on my TV, I already feel like it's worth the money I've spent. Compared to just the joycons, the buttons, sticks, and triggers are much more comfortable, particularly the size of the buttons and the placement of the the sticks. If I had to rank controllers, it would be among the top, or at the very least above the WiiU pro and GameCube controllers. Now I just hope there are many more games coming to the Switch so I can continue to enjoy this great controller for years to come.

This controller is super comfortable. The analog sticks feel buttery smooth, literally the best feeling analog sticks I've ever used. The slightly larger buttons was a little odd at first but they also have a good feel to them. All the shoulder buttons also have a really great feel to them, all four are digital (you don't need analog triggers as much as you think you do) and the ZL & ZR buttons have an ever so slight give to them, they are easy to reach and comfortable with using either one or two fingers grip style. The gyroscope works really well with Splatoon 2 (global testfire tested).The only thing I can state as a potential weak point (besides my personal preference of top side analog sticks) is that the d-pad is quite firm, and isn't as nice to use as a primary character input as the Wii U Pro Controller's. But it's still better than most other d-pads.

I'll get the good parts out of the way, good controller, as should be expected for a $70 pro gamepad from Nintendo.All the rumors you may have heard about the d-pad are 100% true. I didn't believe it at first, that it couldn't possibly be true and must be exaggerated. It is absolutely broken. It's a fundamental design/manufacturing flaw. It is possible to hold down one direction on the d-pad an push it in such a way that you can trigger both adjacent directions. Not only that, but if you really want  to, you can trigger the opposite direction on the d-pad. Nothing short of Nintendo going back to the drawing board on this and offering free fixes/replacements would be satisfactory. Incredibly disappointing. A Nintendo Switch Pro Controller this is NOT!

For your $70 investment you get: Fantastic ergonomics that rivals the XBONE controller. Excellent battery life. USB-C power delivery charging. Convenience of not having to remove and reattach joycons. There are several downsides: No audio out (Seriously Nintendo? No BT Headphones on switch or 3.5mm port on "Pro" controller?). Button clicks not as satisfying vs joycons as it does not have an actuation "click," where Joycons behave like MX Blue switches and the Pro Controller behaves like a MX Red. If the high price point doesn't faze you, you should definitely get in on this.

I am on my third controller now and all of them have D-Pad issue. When I press left or right on the D-Pad, I would get up instead of right or left. I've used the Input Test on the System Settings to confirm. Now what happens with the D-Pad is if you hold a direction and then shift or roll your thumb perpendicular to that direction the input changes. It also happens when if I press the a direction off center. The issue is the same for all three controllers, I returned the two previous ones. I have to keep this third controller but I am thinking of returning it, I just can't play with the joycons. They are less precise and the Switch Pro Controller is really great for the Breath of Wild. The Pro controller helped me beat so many Lynels in BotW but it also cause me to die in the game. I would be in the middle of a fight with a Silver Lynel and my sword breaks. I press right on the D-Pad to quickly change to another weapon but I get the runes instead. I press two more times and I get the runes both times. Then I die from its AOE blast. It is very annoying when that happens. I don't have the game Puyo Puyo Tetris yet but people on forums have written that's impossible to play with the Pro's D-Pad. I don't think the majority of the people have noticed this problem or maybe they think that they only pressed the wrong button while playing. I want to love this controller but D-Pad issue is a big deal breaker for me. Could it be bad luck and I just got three bad controllers in row? I read on a forum about other people returning their controllers and still having the same issue with the replacements. Some have sent theirs for repairs and still have the issue. I don't know if I can justify the $70 price tag now with this D-Pad issue.If you have read this review, please test out your controllers in System Settings.
